{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"An oxygen-supply system on the space station's Russian side has failed","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/international-space-station-oxygen-supply-system-failure-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5637884bbd86ef195c8bb4b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"international space station\" height=\"2832\" width=\"4256\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/station/research/news/15_ways_iss_benefits_earth\" target=\"_blank\">NASA</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The oxygen-supply system on the International Space Station's Russian segment failed this week.</li>\n<li>Crew members aren't in danger, since the station has another oxygen system on its US segment.</li>\n<li>But the issue is the latest in a string on the station's Russian side &#8212; there has also been a broken toilet and an air leak.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The International Space Station is starting to show its age, particularly on the Russian side. In the last few months, <a href=\"https://balthazarkorab.com/2020/10/10/toilet-breaks-in-russian-module-on-iss/\">a toilet in that segment went bust</a>, an air leak got larger, and <a href=\"https://www.spacedaily.com/reports/Temperature_Increasing_on_Russian_Zvezda_Module_as_Air_Continues_to_Leak_From_ISS_999.html\">temperatures mysteriously increased</a>.</p><p>Then on Wednesday, the Russian segment's oxygen-supply system failed, according to space agency Roscosmos. The Zvezda service module, where the system is located, has been in orbit for 20 years.</p><p>The failure coincided with the arrival of three new crew members, including <a href=\"https://blogs.nasa.gov/spacestation/\">NASA astronaut Kate Rubins</a> – bringing the station's population to six. The crew isn't in danger, however, since the station has two oxygen-supply systems: one on the US side and one on the Russian side. The other system is functioning normally, according to Russian space agency Roscosmos.</p><p>\"Nothing threatens the security of the crew and the ISS,\" a Roscosmos spokesperson <a href=\"https://www.sciencealert.com/oxygen-supply-has-failed-in-part-of-the-international-space-station\">told the AFP.</a></p><p>The station also keeps extra oxygen onboard in case both systems break down.</p><p>Still, the failure is another sign that Russian side of the orbiting lab is in need of upgrades. The station has already outlived its <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/missions/highlights/webcasts/shuttle/sts110/iss-qa.html\">15-year life expectancy</a>.</p><p>\"All modules of the Russian segment are exhausted,\"&#160;cosmonaut Gennady Padalka <a href=\"https://ria.ru/20201015/kosmos-1579901308.html\">told Ria Novosti</a>, a Russian state news agency.</p><p>Roscosmos did not immediately respond to Business Insider's questions about the failure.</p><h2><strong>An oxygen-system failure, a busted toilet, and an elusive leak</strong></h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f74f56c0ab50d00184ad71d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"transferchamber\" height=\"664\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Astronaut Jeffrey Ashby moves through the Transfer Chamber hatch into the space station&#39;s Zvezda Service Module with a video camera, May 25, 2011.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The ISS has two sides: the Russian Orbital Segment and the US Orbital Segment. The Russian segment contains the station's oldest module, the Zarya Control Module, which launched in 1998.&#160;</p><p>Its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-roscosmos-found-leak-on-international-space-station-2020-9\">Zvezda Service Module</a>, which <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/atoms/files/np-2015-05-022-jsc-iss-guide-2015-update-111015-508c.pdf\">launched in 2000</a>, is the Russian segment's main module. It houses cosmonauts' living quarters: the kitchen, bathroom, and life-support systems, including the water-filtration system and the oxygen-supply system that just broke.</p><p>The report of the oxygen failure came after crew members spent months trying to find the source of an air leak on the space station. The ISS has been leaking at an above-average rate since September 2019, but crew members only started investigating in earnest over the summer.</p><p>In September, NASA and Roscosmos <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-roscosmos-found-leak-on-international-space-station-2020-9\">determined the leak was coming from the Zvezda module</a>.</p><p>Daniel Huot, a NASA spokesperson, told Business Insider he wasn't \"aware of any relation between this failure and the leak.\" The agency is working to get additional information, however.&#160;</p><p>Crew members still haven't pinpointed the exact location of the air leak, which they'll need to do in order to fix it. Officials maintain that the leak isn't major, though it seems to have contributed to the decision to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-roscosmos-found-leak-on-international-space-station-2020-9\">push back Crew-1</a>, SpaceX's first official mission for NASA.</p><p>A recent temperature increase that cosmonauts reported, meanwhile, was also in the Zvezda module, <a href=\"https://www.spacedaily.com/reports/Temperature_Increasing_on_Russian_Zvezda_Module_as_Air_Continues_to_Leak_From_ISS_999.html\">SpaceDaily reported</a>. So was the toilet that broke down, though it has been repaired, <a href=\"https://ria.ru/20201015/kosmos-1579901308.html\">according to Ria Novosti.</a>&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"The best equipment for starting your own home gym","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-home-gym","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Working out at home has become nearly everyone's new normal and though it requires purchasing an array of equipment, it's not as daunting of a task as one might think nor does it require a dedicated room or weeks of setup to create.</strong></li><li><strong>Outfitting a home gym to fit your needs can be as straightforward a process as figuring what exactly you hope to accomplish, the kinds of workouts you'd like to do, and the budget you're working with.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>To help you figure out how to start setting up your own personal workout space, we've tested a variety of gear fit for almost every kind of at-home exerciser, from larger equipment like <a href=\"https://amzn.to/3bGDzcM\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">treadmills</a> and <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FExerpeutic-Magnetic-Upright-Exercise-Bike-with-Heart-Pulse-Sensors%2F1952600319526003\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">stationary bikes</a> to strength training gear such as&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-resistance-bands\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">resistance bands</a> and <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001CC724W/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_011818_best-home-gym-gear-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B001CC724W&linkId=93c8544585dd79f6a7096a7f57cbf07685dd79f6a7096a7f57cbf076\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">dumbbells</a>.</strong></li></ul><p>Working out at home has become a necessity. What was once mostly used as a stop-gap between visits to the gym or to supplement someone's weekly routine turned into standard practice almost overnight. With the future of brick-and-mortar workout facilities <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/workout-at-home-fitness-future-gyms-boutique-studios-2020-5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">somewhat murky</a>, keeping fit at home appears likely to be our new normal for the foreseeable future.</p><p>But that sentiment shouldn't be a bleak one — working out at home allows you to hone in on the kinds of exercises you enjoy and provides an opportunity to focus entirely on what works for you. There's also something to be said for having unfettered access to the equipment you need <em>exactly</em> when you need it.&#160;</p><p>Yet therein lies the ultimate dilemma: Where do you even start when outfitting your own home gym? The easy answer is to first buy what you're familiar with while keeping in mind what exactly it is you want to accomplish (and what your fitness goals are), the kinds of workouts you want to do, and what your budget is. The entire process doesn't need to be a wallet-gouging affair, either, even if you're intending to <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/best-garage-gym-essentials\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">stock an entire garage</a> full of gear.</p><h2>How to shop for home gym equipment</h2><p>When shopping, it's smart to first develop a workout plan detailing what you want to attain. Though workouts of all varieties do well to work together to improve one's overall fitness, starting out by focusing on one or two areas helps you refine your goals. Perhaps you <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/how-often-should-you-strength-train\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">want to strength train</a>; purchasing a set of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-resistance-bands\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">resistance bands</a> or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dumbbells\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">dumbbells</a> is likely where you want to start. If it's cardio or a full-body routine you're after, maybe a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-treadmill\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">treadmill</a> or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-rowing-machine\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">row machine</a> is more appropriate.</p><p>This initial research is important because there's so much more to stocking a proper home gym than attempting to mimic the studios you're used to. Study the <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/resistance-bands-vs-dumbbells-weights\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">differences between resistance bands</a> and dumbbells to find what suits you best, download and stream a few <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/work-from-home-workout\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">at-home workout apps</a>, or figure out <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/when-is-the-best-time-to-workout\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best time to work out</a> each day. Doing this not only informs how exactly you prefer keeping fit and the best methods for doing so but it ultimately teaches you which equipment is right for you and your home gym.&#160;</p><p>If you've winced at building out your own workout space because you think it requires a dedicated room, a huge expenditure of money, or more knowledge than you possess, we're here to help. You can get a great workout whatever your budget and you don't need a ton of space to do it.</p><p>Below is the equipment we've personally tested over several days, weeks, and months of adapting our own workout routines to being strictly home-based. The list is exhaustive and should be viewed as a customizable blueprint — i.e. you don't need <em>everything</em> on this list. Pick and choose what works best for you and rest assured that what's featured below is the equipment we're actually using in our own homes.</p><p><em>Editor's note: See below for information on </em><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-home-gym#how-to-make-the-most-of-your-home-gym-13\"><em>how to make the most of your home gym</em></a> and <em><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-home-gym#how-we-test-14\">how we tested the equipment</a> featured.</em></p><h2><strong>Here's the best home gym equipment:</strong></h2><ul Bar</a></strong></li></ul><p><em>Updated on 10/16/2020 by Rick Stella: Rewrote the introduction and how to shop for home workout equipment, named NordicTrack's S22i Studio Cycle as the best stationary bike, updated the section on how we test, checked the availability of all featured products, and updated the prices and links where necessary.</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best training strap system\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a5f9721f4214979048b558b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trx\" height=\"946\" width=\"1262\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\">If you're looking for a reasonably priced whole-body workout that uses your own weight to provide resistance, check out the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01LXL27XI/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">TRX GO System</a></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\">.</strong></h3><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01LXL27XI/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">TRX GO system</a>&#160;is essentially a series of sturdy straps, handles, and hooks. But fasten it to a door, rafter, beam, or even a sturdy tree branch, and you have the equivalent of a full-on gym.Not only does the system strengthen and build muscle but it also helps improve stability and flexibility. Best of all, you can apply as much resistance as you need, making the system suitable for beginners and fitness buffs alike.</p><p>You'll love the effectiveness and versatility of the system, along with the fact that it's easy to take along while traveling. Because the Theraband Exercise Ball retains air so well, you won't have to reinflate it that often, either. It does take quite a bit of time to inflate the first time around, though.</p><p>The TheraBand ball has just the right type of surface for grip-ability, so it won't move around while you're working out. It's available in four sizes from 45 cm to 75 cm and comes in several different colors.</p><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Maintains its shape and holds air better than other exercise balls, includes a slow deflate technology if the ball is punctured, extremely firm, has a good surface for just the right amount of grip, offered in four sizes</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Takes a long time to inflate, no inflation pump included, only one color per size</p><p><strong>If this exercise ball isn't the one for you, you might prefer the following:</strong></p><ul style=\"list-style-type: disc; padding-left: 30px; font-family: Georgia,Times,sans-serif;\"><li><strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dynaprodirect.com%2Fproducts%2Fdynapro-exercise-ball\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noopenernoopener nofollow sponsored\">DynaPro Exercise Ball</a></strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FLive-Infinitely-Exercise-Ball-55cm-95cm-Extra-Thick-Professional-Grade-Balan%2F836870665\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noopenernoopener nofollow sponsored\">Live Infinitely Exercise Ball</a></strong></li></ul><h3>For some workout inspiration, check out our <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/best-at-home-exercise-ball-routines\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">favorite exercise ball routines</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-exercise-ball\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full guide to the best exercise balls</a></h3>\n\tThe best foam roller\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5df257b9fd9db2041d7d5c53?format=jpeg\" alt=\"luxfit high density foam roller\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The&#160;<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KAEJ3UE/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_011018_best-foam-rollers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00KAEJ3UE&#38;linkId=6f37772665657b1e1d09a55f6da7f250&#38;th=1&#38;psc=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">LuxFit Premium High-Density Foam Roller</a> is an affordable and simple tool that gives your muscles relief before or after you work out.</h3><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KAEJ3UE/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_011018_best-foam-rollers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00KAEJ3UE&#38;linkId=6f37772665657b1e1d09a55f6da7f250&#38;th=1&#38;psc=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">LuxFit Premium High-Density Foam Roller</a> is made of polyethylene foam, which is easy to clean. The roller has a 6-inch diameter and is lightweight enough for easy transport or storage.&#160;</p><p>The roller comes in three different lengths: 12, 18, and 36 inches. The longest option is ideal for tall or heavy individuals, the medium is good for working all parts of the body, and the small is good for targeted areas, like the neck. Whichever you choose, they're covered by a one-year limited warranty.</p><p>This high-quality foam roller is affordable, too, starting at just $9 for the small on up to $25 for the large. The roller has a slight texture to prevent sliding and the foam is just dense enough to massage your muscles and support your body. Users noted that the roller is effective on the back, upper chest, and abs.&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Affordable, three size options, one-year warranty</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Certain materials may slide along the surface without rolling</p><h3><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-foam-roller/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full buying guide to the best foam rollers</a></h3>\n\tThe best pull up bar\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a4a93eeb0bcd51c198b7877?format=jpeg\" alt=\"pull up bar 1\" height=\"1125\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Garren Fitness</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The&#160;<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00RJFRV1K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;creativeASIN=B00RJFRV1K&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;tag=biipgf_011818_best-home-gym-gear-20&#38;linkId=5d2bceba51008f5b06cb1f57751c9fab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Garren Fitness Maximiza Pull Up Bar</a> is easy to install and gives you a great workout.</h3><p>The&#160;<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00RJFRV1K/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;creativeASIN=B00RJFRV1K&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;tag=biipgf_011818_best-home-gym-gear-20&#38;linkId=5d2bceba51008f5b06cb1f57751c9fab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Garren Fitness Maximiza Pull Up Bar</a> is made of chrome steel and comes with three sets of mounting hardware with two of the sets able to support up to 300 pounds of weight. The medium-duty door mount supports 150 pounds and is not recommended for use above waist height.</p><p>You can also use the bar without door mounts for sit-up foot support and other light exercises. It's adjustable and fits doorways between 26 and 36 inches wide, and can be installed so that you can still close the door.</p><p>The bar features non-slip, extra-long foam grips to ensure you won't easily lose your grip. You shouldn't have any trouble with installation, though it may take a little work to get it to the right length.</p><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Comfortable foam grips, unobtrusive, solidly built</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Installation requires drilling into a door jamb, foam grips may wear from heavy-duty use</p><p><strong>If you want a different option, we also recommend:</strong></p><ul style=\"list-style-type: disc; padding-left: 30px; font-family: Georgia,Times,sans-serif;\"><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.ultimatebodypress.com/ceiling-mounted-pull-up-bar-14.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noopenernoopener nofollow sponsored\">Ultimate Body Press Ceiling Mounted Pull Up Bar</a></strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FStamina-Power-Tower-Home-Gym%2F12536778\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noopenernoopener nofollow sponsored\">Stamina 1690 Power Tower</a></strong></li></ul><h3><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-pull-up-bar/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full buying guide to the best pull up bars</a></h3>\n\tHow to make the most of your home gym\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a5f8c2cf421493e0d8b5487?format=jpeg\" alt=\"workout fitness push up exercise gym\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock/El Nariz</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Just because you're not visiting a brick and mortar gym or fitness studio, doesn't mean you can't replicate the workouts they offer. Everything from high-intensity interval training and strength workouts to cardio routines and resistance training can easily be done at home.</p><p>Here are a few basic exercise categories to familiarize yourself with before jumping into any workout routine.&#160;</p><h3>Cardio exercise</h3><p>Cardio &#8212; which comes from cardiovascular &#8212; exercise is defined by the <a href=\"http://www.acsm.org/about-acsm/media-room/news-releases/2011/08/01/acsm-issues-new-recommendations-on-quantity-and-quality-of-exercise\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">American College of Sports Medicine</a> as any exercise that raises your heart rate and breaths per minute while repetitively and rhythmically using large muscle groups. That's a fancy way of saying that cardio or aerobic exercise is anything that gets you moving fast and hard enough to break a sweat. Typical cardio exercises include running, biking, jumping rope, etc.&#160;</p><p>The benefits of aerobic exercise are many, including weight loss, stronger bones and muscles, better sleep, lowered levels of depression and anxiety, and even the reduced risk of many types of cancer, to name a few.</p><p>The <a href=\"http://www.acsm.org/about-acsm/media-room/news-releases/2011/08/01/acsm-issues-new-recommendations-on-quantity-and-quality-of-exercise\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ACSM</a> recommends adults get at least 150 minutes per week of moderate-intensity aerobic exercise, which can be broken down into multiple sessions as short as ten minutes.</p><h3>Strength training&#160;</h3><p>Strength training &#8212; also called resistance training &#8212; is the use of exercise against resistance to build and strengthen muscle. That resistance might come from your own body weight, a dumbbell or other hand-held weight, or a wide range of resistance machines.</p><p>Along with improved muscle strength and definition, resistance training helps develop bone density and assists with weight loss.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.livestrong.com/article/514068-what-are-the-acsm-guidelines-for-strength-training/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ACSM</a> recommends healthy adults do strength training two or three times per week, engaging in eight to 10 different exercises focusing on a variety of muscle groups. Beginners should aim for eight to 12 repetitions of each exercise, using the amount of weight that leads to muscle fatigue within that set of reps.</p><h3>Balance and flexibility training</h3><p>While various cardio and strength-training exercises help improve balance and flexibility, it's important to incorporate training that specifically targets these two functions. They make daily living much easier and help improve your overall health and mental well-being. Aim for at least two balance or flexibility workouts each week.</p>\n\tHow we test\n\t\n\t<p>Each piece of home gym equipment recommended in this guide went through a series of tests to help determine its effectiveness. We considered each piece's feasibility for use in a home, if there was a steep learning curve or not, its relative value, how portable or easy to stow it might be, and how practical it is for every day or every week use.</p><p>We understand that not all home gyms have the ability to be created in equal fashion, so the equipment tested covers a wide array of use cases that anyone can pick and choose to their liking (and, perhaps most importantly, for what fits their home workout space). This means that if you have the space for a treadmill, you likely won't also be in the market for a stationary bike or a full-on Bowflex workout machine.&#160;</p><p>Some of the testings also took place during the creation of other guides (like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-treadmill\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best treadmills</a> or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-dumbbells\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best dumbbells</a>), so that experience carried over for input here, as well. Where necessary, we included similar equipment that was also tested, as well as links to our more focused equipment buying guides.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original 1493e0d8b5487?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-089_745f39d16a931afa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ajmLKEjmJZk:rBv0D0Q46mw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-24-024_423d9bd5b0120113.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ajmLKEjmJZk:rBv0D0Q46mw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn4@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-28-705_3e03f1f7c10cd04b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ajmLKEjmJZk:rBv0D0Q46mw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn84@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-21-458_5ed96143a59c1736.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ajmLKEjmJZk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn51@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-15-829_1b5b4455f46cd851.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799766},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"10 ways to boost your cellular signal and stay connected to your network","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-boost-cell-signal","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88994d9e9fe40019009951?format=jpeg\" alt=\"woman on street with bike looking at phone earphones\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>If your cell signal keeps cutting out, there are a few tricks you can try to boost it.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Maskot/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can try to boost your cellular signal with simple fixes like moving outdoors, going in and out of Airplane Mode, and keeping your battery from entering low power mode.&#160;</li>\n<li>Many factors can affect your phone's cellular signal strength &#8212; here are 10 ways you can try to boost your cell signal.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>You probably hear the question, \"How many bars do you have?\" pretty often. Cell phone signals are an essential commodity these days, since it affects not just your ability to make phone calls, but also send text messages and even connect to the internet when you're away from <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/wi-fi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Wi-Fi</a>.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to boost your cell signal</strong></h2><p>Any number of factors can affect how well you can keep your phone connected, so here are 10 things you can do to troubleshoot and improve your cell signal.&#160;&#160;</p><h3><strong>Get out from behind materials that block your signal</strong></h3><p>Cell signals are easily blocked, and so if you find your signal is weak, solving the problem might be as simple as moving outdoors.</p><h3><strong>Reboot your cellular radio</strong>&#160;</h3><p>Sometimes your phone can get confused and fail to lock onto the best cell tower. If you suspect a problem, turn your phone's Airplane Mode on and off, or just restart the phone entirely.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f889502d260780019341a5e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_boost_cell_signal 1\" height=\"2409\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Turn Airplane Mode on and off again, or just reboot your phone.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h3><strong>Change your location</strong>&#160;</h3><p>Even if you're outdoors, tall buildings and large bodies of water can block signals, so move to a different spot or go to higher ground.</p><h3><strong>Remove the case</strong>&#160;</h3><p>While unlikely, it's possible your phone's case can be interfering with your cellular signal. If you recently got a new case and noticed a drop in cellular signal, take it out of the case and see if that improves your phone's signal.&#160;</p><h3><strong>Check a coverage map</strong>&#160;</h3><p>All the major carriers publish coverage maps you can check to see if you are in an area with limited or no coverage. You can zoom in on your location on <a href=\"https://www.t-mobile.com/coverage/coverage-map\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">T-Mobile's coverage map</a>, for example, or if you can look at <a href=\"https://www.att.com/maps/wireless-coverage.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">AT&#38;T's coverage map</a> if you are a customer there. <a href=\"https://www.verizon.com/coverage-map/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Verizon</a> also publishes a coverage map.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8895cc9e9fe4001900993e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_boost_cell_signal 2\" height=\"1289\" width=\"1979\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>All major carriers have maps you can use to assess your coverage area.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h3><strong>Update your carrier settings</strong>&#160;</h3><p>If you have an iPhone, it's possible that your cell service provider has updated its settings, and you need to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-update-carrier-settings-iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">update your phone's carrier settings</a> to take advantage of them. To check, make sure you have a good connection (cellular or Wi-Fi) and then start the Settings app. Tap \"General\" and then \"About.\" If there's an update available, install it.&#160;</p><h3><strong>Don't let your battery get too low</strong></h3><p>If your battery gets critically low, your phone automatically enters low power mode, which may dedicate less power to the cellular radio. If you're having trouble connecting, charge your phone – and you can do things like lower screen brightness and make the screen sleep faster to extend the battery life through the day.&#160;</p><h3><strong>Install a signal booster </strong></h3><p>If you live in an area with poor service coverage, you might need to install a signal booster, sometimes called a repeater, in your home. These devices boost the cellular signal and give you a usable signal. Unfortunately, they're often expensive, costing hundreds of dollars. If you think you need one, call your cellular provider – most offer boosters you can purchase, though you can also buy one on your own.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88967bd260780019341a62?format=jpeg\" alt=\"surecall cell signal booster\" height=\"952\" width=\"824\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can install a signal booster at home if you like in an extremely poor service area.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Surecall</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h3><strong>Change carriers</strong>&#160;</h3><p>If you live or work in an area with especially bad cellular coverage, you might not need to tolerate it. Competing cellular providers might have better coverage where you need it most, so check coverage maps (see the \"check a coverage map\" tip) to see if another provider is better.</p><h3><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">Use Wi-Fi instead</strong></h3><p>While this doesn't technically boost your cell signal, it can accomplish the same thing: Whenever possible, use Wi-Fi. Make sure your Wi-Fi is turned on and you join trustworthy Wi-Fi networks when they're available, since that can avoid the need to use spotty or slow cellular.</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-stream-hbo-max-over-cellular\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to stream HBO Max over a cellular connection and watch content without Wi-Fi<br></a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-boost-internet-speed\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to boost your internet speed at home in 8 ways, and make sure you're not being overcharged for low speeds</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-a-good-internet-speed\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">'What is a good internet speed?': The internet speeds you should aim for, based on how you use the internet</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-fast-is-my-internet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">How to find out how fast your internet is using a free and accurate Google speed Businesses weren't the only ones who won this year. Prime members from a total of 19 countries collectively saved a whopping $1.4 billion during Prime Day.</p><p>If you're wondering what Prime members bought — or need a little insight on what to buy this Black Friday or next Prime Day — we rounded up the most popular Prime Day purchases from Mexico, Japan, Australia, and more, below.</p><h3><strong>Keep reading to discover what shoppers from around the world loved most from Prime Day 2020:</strong></h3><h2>United States:</h2><div id=\"ProductCard_5cc75a13b14bf45aca2b36a3\" style=\"position:relative; 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"Tesla just quietly updated the Model 3's range, performance, and styling — here's what's new","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-quietly-updated-refreshed-model-3-range-performance-styling-specs-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89fded9e9fe40019009e2c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3 update\" height=\"653\" width=\"1142\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Model 3 now has more range, black trim, and a new center console.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Tesla quietly updated its top-selling Model 3.&#160;</li>\n<li>The Model 3 now boasts more range across all three versions.&#160;</li>\n<li>It also gets new black trim on the exterior, refreshed wheel options, and a new center console with wireless-charging capability.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Tesla just updated the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-model-3-vs-other-electric-cars-2020-4\">Model 3</a>, giving it increased range and performance along with some new features and styling touches.&#160;</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://www.tesla.com/model3/design#battery\">Tesla's online configurator</a>, Model 3 sedans now boast higher range estimates across all three variants. The Standard Range Plus now has an EPA-estimated range of 263 miles — <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-model-3-standard-range-compared-chevy-bolt-longer-range-2020-5\">up from 250 miles</a> — while the Long Range version now promises 353 miles, a 31-mile bump.</p><p>The Performance model, built for speed and acceleration rather than distance, will now go 315 miles on a charge, up from 299 miles. Tesla also shaved one-tenth of a second off of the model's 0-60 mph time, and it now makes the sprint in 3.1 seconds.&#160;</p><p>As for the exterior, the Model 3's door handles, side turn signals, and window trim now come finished in black trim, instead of chrome. Tesla also updated the Model 3's wheel options, introducing new 20-inch \"Überturbine\" rims that come standard on the Performance model. Customers can also choose refreshed 18-inch and 19-inch wheels on the lower trims.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89fd9ad260780019341f59?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3 Interior\" height=\"741\" width=\"1246\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tesla updated the Model 3&#39;s interior with a new center console and finishes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tesla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Inside, Tesla revamped the center console by changing out the satin elements for matte finishes and integrating wireless-charging pads. The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-model-vs-3-polestar-2-ev-electric-vehicle-comparison-2020-9\">Model 3</a> also gets a power liftgate, sun visors that magnetically snap into place, and new trim on the door handles, window and seat controls, and sill plates, according to <a href=\"https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a34396306/tesla-model-3-design-updates/\">Car &#38; Driver</a>.&#160;</p><p>According to Tesla's website, customers will need to wait between five and nine weeks to take delivery of a refreshed Model 3.&#160;</p><p>The changes come as Tesla strives to hit an ambitious <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-cuts-prices-of-model-s-variant-in-united-states-china-2020-10\">annual sales goal of 500,000 vehicles</a>.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-quietly-updated-refreshed-model-3-range-performance-styling-specs-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=oyUGPLNfHZM:JCHuT-qMqmc:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oyUGPLNfHZM:JCHuT-qMqmc:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=oyUGPLNfHZM:JCHuT-qMqmc:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oyUGPLNfHZM:JCHuT-qMqmc:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=oyUGPLNfHZM:JCHuT-qMqmc:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oyUGPLNfHZM:JCHuT-qMqmc:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/oyUGPLNfHZM\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 20:42:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f89fe02d260780019341f5d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3b863fae5be026fc93dfb065800fc5ee","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn39@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-13-883_50e1b1852aa4ac56.webp","destWidth":815,"destHeight":611,"sourceBytes":39074,"destBytes":39074,"author":"tlevin@businessinsider.com (Tim Levin)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f89fded9e9fe40019009e2c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn52@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-27-368_1e026963fff26864.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f89fd9ad260780019341f59?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn44@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-25-183_832e1583ddb03912.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oyUGPLNfHZM:JCHuT-qMqmc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn44@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-27-309_5628f2324c9fa0ac.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oyUGPLNfHZM:JCHuT-qMqmc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn84@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-24-002_ddd175086e13dd8a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=oyUGPLNfHZM:JCHuT-qMqmc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn88@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-24-966_069a88f7be39ff21.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/oyUGPLNfHZM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn27@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-621_b77aa9ec01ea4ea6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799692},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"How to track your sleep with an Apple Watch using the built-in Sleep app or third-party apps","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/does-apple-watch-track-sleep-apps-review","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f747de10ab50d00184ad368?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Apple fall September event Apple Watch iPad\" height=\"1079\" width=\"2158\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to track your sleep using an Apple Watch.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong>You can track your sleep on an Apple Watch using the built-in Sleep app, or a variety of third-party apps.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>To use the Sleep app on your Apple Watch, you'll need to update it to watchOS 7, and have an Apple Watch Series 3 or newer.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>There are also several third-party sleep tracking apps, like SleepWatch and AutoSleep, that offer more advanced sleep metrics.</strong></li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>When you're not getting a good night's sleep, it's hard <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-happens-when-you-dont-get-enough-sleep-2017-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">to be productive, balance your emotions, and stay healthy</a>.&#160;We all know the importance of eating right and exercising, but sleep is just as key to promoting a healthy and happy life.</p><p>Just as you track your steps or count your calories, you should be keeping tabs on your sleep routine. Luckily, your Apple Watch can help you with that.</p><p>All new Apple Watches come with a built-in sleep tracking app, simply called \"Sleep.\" It can detect when you're sleeping, track&#160;<em>how</em> you're sleeping, and more.</p><p>However, if you're looking for more detailed sleep analysis or features — some apps track your REM cycles, and some can even play music — you might want to look into a third-party app.</p><p>Here's a comparison of the leading sleep-tracking apps currently available for the Apple Watch, including the built-in Sleep app.</p><h2><strong>The official Apple Watch Sleep app</strong></h2><h3><strong>Cost to download:</strong> Free and built-in</h3><h3><strong>Paid membership:</strong> No</h3><p>The built-in Sleep app was added in the watchOS 7 update, which is exclusive to the Apple Watch Series 3 and newer. If you have a compatible Watch but don't have watchOS 7, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-update-apple-watch\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">be sure to update it</a>.</p><p>Your Apple Watch has the ability to detect when you're sleeping and for how long, based on micromovements that signal respiration during sleep.</p><p>The Sleep app can also detect periods of wake and sleep throughout the night — all put together in a handy little chart that tracks your sleep schedule over time. All your sleep data will also be automatically synced to your iPhone.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0dbf9e9fe40019009e6e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"apple sleep2\" height=\"1446\" width=\"1306\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Sleep app generates a chart to track your sleep schedule, which syncs with your iPhone.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>You can use the Sleep app in conjunction with your Watch's Wind Down, Sleep Mode, and Do Not Disturb features. This can help you develop a specialized routine before bed, which can include a customized watch face, bedtime reminders, screen dimming, and more.</p><p>Your Watch also has the ability to wake you up by delivering light vibrations or soft sounds.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0cff9e9fe40019009e6c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"apple sleep\" height=\"1134\" width=\"1030\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Sleep app tracks when you go to bed and when you wake up.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Although the Apple Watch Sleep app offers a lot of features to sync your devices together, it doesn't provide as detailed sleep data analysis as some of the other third-party apps available from the App Store.</p><h2><strong>AutoSleep</strong></h2><h3><strong>Cost to download:</strong> $3.99</h3><h3><strong>Paid membership:</strong> No</h3><p><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/autosleep-tracker-for-watch/id1164801111?mt=8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">AutoSleep</a> offers a super quick setup — you don't even need to make an account.</p><p>Perfect for people who like to lay in bed and watch TV or read a book, AutoSleep requires you to tell the app that you're going to sleep (through its Lights Off function). In other words, a six-hour, unmoving Netflix binge will never trick it into thinking you've fallen asleep.</p><p>You can activate Lights Off directly from your Apple Watch and track how long it takes you to fall asleep.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ca51cc8569b5548df4d16e8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1.PNG\" height=\"390\" width=\"312\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Press &#34;Lights Off&#34; to let AutoSleep know you&#39;re going to sleep.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christine Kopaczewski/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>You can view your sleep session on a graph that plots how deep your sleep was, as well as your heart rate over time. It'll show the peaks and troughs in your sleep that indicate when you woke up and when you were in sound slumber.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ca51cf46b5265452f420e47?format=jpeg\" alt=\"3.PNG\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can access all your data from the iOS AutoSleep app.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christine Kopaczewski/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The sleep rings show your time asleep, your time having quality sleep, your time in deep sleep, and your sleeping heart rate. You can set goals for each of these, and the rings will compare with your goals, letting you know how well you've done.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ca51d3e6b5265452f420e4b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"4.PNG\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Much like the Apple Watch&#39;s activity goals, AutoSleep offers rings to track your sleep.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christine Kopaczewski/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>There's also a feature to show your \"sleep bank\" for the week. This is based on you getting a full eight hours a night. If you sleep less, you'll go into debt, and if you sleep more, you'll have extra credit.</p><p>Overall, AutoSleep provides a decent amount of data and you can compare day-to-day to see how your lifestyle affects your sleep. For the one-off charge of $3.99, it's a great value.</p><h2><strong>Sleep++</strong></h2><h3><strong>Cost to download:</strong> Free</h3><h3><strong>Paid membership:</strong> No, but offers in-app purchases</h3><p><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/sleep/id1038440371?mt=8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sleep++</a> is the most basic of the available sleep apps, but it's free to download and has no hidden extra costs. You can choose to have your sleep tracked in auto mode or manual mode.</p><p>Auto mode will automatically track your sleep, using your movements — or lack thereof — to know when you're in dreamland. If you use manual mode, you'll have to tell the app when you're going to sleep and when you wake up.</p><p>Press \"Start Sleeping\" and then \"Stop Sleeping\" on your Apple Watch or in the iPhone app.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ca51d7cc6cc50614b3a7939?format=jpeg\" alt=\"6.PNG\" height=\"390\" width=\"312\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sleep&#43;&#43; offers multiple ways to track your sleep.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christine Kopaczewski/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>You won't get much data from this app, just one bar showing you how deep your sleep was. However, it's totally free and a great place to start your sleep-tracking routine.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ca51d92c6cc5063da7f8be2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"8.PNG\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sleep&#43;&#43; provides data that&#39;s specific to the minute.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christine Kopaczewski/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>Sleep Cycle:</strong></h2><h3><strong>Cost to download:</strong> Free</h3><h3><strong>Paid membership:</strong> 1 month free, then $29.99/year to get trend data and premium features</h3><p><a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/sleep-cycle-smart-alarm-clock/id320606217?mt=8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sleep Cycle</a> has the unique feature of a built-in alarm with a \"Wake up phase,\" that automatically wakes you up at the optimal time, based on your sleep pattern. Set the time you need to wake up by, and the app will wake you (using haptic vibrations on your watch) up to 30 minutes before when you're in your lightest phase of sleep. You can adjust that time frame in the app if you want a longer window of time before you're woken up.</p><p>If you buy the paid version (you get a 1-month trial to test it out first), you'll unlock premium features, like a sleep aid to provide you with soothing sounds, weather alerts when you wake up, and heart rate monitoring.</p><p>Although the features may be better than the other apps, you won't receive a data analysis of your sleep cycle.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ca51dcac6cc506cb179b1a6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"10.PNG\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sleep Cycle also allows you to share your graph results on social media.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christine Kopaczewski/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>SleepWatch</strong></h2><h3><strong>Cost to download:</strong> Free</h3><h3><strong>Paid membership:</strong> 7 days free, $3.99/month or $29.99/year to gain access to better analysis</h3><p><a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/sleep-watch-by-bodymatter/id1138066420\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SleepWatch</a> provides the most data of any of the tested apps, but you'll have to buy a membership to make the most of it, as well as receive heart rate comparisons and comprehensive sleep analyses. The paid membership will give you a numeric value for your quality of sleep — think of it as your sleep credit score!</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ca51ddf16c9583d9a55f7b5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"11.PNG\" height=\"1334\" width=\"750\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>SleepWatch is one of the more expensive sleep tracking apps, but offers the most data.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christine Kopaczewski/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>You'll also get data based on your sleep patterns, a ratio of light-to-restful sleep, and your heart rate. You can view this data on your Apple Watch, as well as on the mobile app.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ca51e0ac6cc50636b63f4f9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"14.PNG\" height=\"390\" width=\"312\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The SleepWatch app is sleek and detailed.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christine Kopaczewski/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>You can set your sleep goal and adjust the sensitivity of the sleep detection. The Smart Bedtime Reminder is another paid feature that will remind you to go to sleep at a certain time to improve your sleep rhythm.</p><p>If you love to analyze data and see how changing your lifestyle can affect your sleep, then this is the app for you.</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-update-apple-watch\">How to update your Apple Watch manually or href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-reset-apple-watch-password\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to change your Apple Watch password or reset it if you've forgotten it</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-connect-strava-to-health-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">How to connect your Strava fitness app to
