height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 21:28:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f84ab35c255d800190b966c?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"2f37d0fda3f82084b5d6dc5d8a0d827f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn33@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-13-722_5177f9c0d9394760.webp","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":87524,"destBytes":87524,"author":"insider@insider.com (Dave Johnson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f84ab43c255d800190b966d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn88@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-15-122_f1d4a326208b80e3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f84a713c255d800190b962f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn19@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-15-781_d9f184644e673edf.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f84a7d191aa9e001880b112?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn83@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-16-305_d02b665a23b66ce0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f84a871c255d800190b9653?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn27@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-18-318_d232371b9cf276af.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ls0VAXqRccM:s1yfXImqbrA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn100@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-24-201_a730ee61404d68fd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ls0VAXqRccM:s1yfXImqbrA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn3@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-29-182_024cb6bb0d85eb8a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ls0VAXqRccM:s1yfXImqbrA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn44@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-21-807_60f97f607b4566e9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ls0VAXqRccM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn32@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-15-601_533ebc9666c5e3bd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799680},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"Wildfires have killed an estimated 600 jaguars in Brazil's Pantanal wetlands. Vets are using stem cells to treat injured cats.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/brazil-pantanal-fires-nex-institute-jaguars-stem-cell-treatment-2020-10","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/yryWPVwW-jZbcmOYf.html\"\nwidth=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"Wildfires have killed an estimated 600 jaguars in Brazil's Pantanal wetlands. Vets are using stem cells to treat injured cats.\"\nstyle=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Wildfires have destroyed more than one-fifth of the Pantanal, the world's largest wetland, in Brazil, Bolivia, and Paraguay.</li>\n<li>Volunteers at the NGO, the NEX Institute, have been rescuing injured jaguars from the Pantanal and rehabilitating them with an experimental stem cell treatment.</li>\n<li>Stem cells have generated excitement in the scientific community for their potential to help both people and animals heal quickly, but it remains unclear if the treatments actually work.&#160;</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/BusinessInsiderToday/\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">View more episodes of Business Insider Today on Facebook.</a></strong></li>\n</ul><p>Deep in the Brazilian wetlands, a jaguar named Amanaci was recently rescued from raging fires in the Pantanal — the world's largest wetland.</p><p>She's undergoing an experimental stem cell treatment after surviving the deadly wildfires blazing through the wetlands since July.</p><p>She was rescued by volunteers from the NEX Institute in Brazil — an NGO dedicated to protecting endangered wild cats. Few are as lucky as this jaguar.</p><p>\"It makes me angry and sad seeing how these animals are suffering,\" NEX founder Cristina Gianni said. \"And also how we have got to this stage, because of a lack of prevention.\"</p><p>The spotted cat was found with severe burns. NEX scientists took Amanaci's cells, cultivated them in a lab, then injected them into her paws.&#160;</p><p>The Pantanal stretches across Brazil, Bolivia, and Paraguay, and is one of the planet's most biodiverse ecosystems. This year's fires have already destroyed nearly one-fifth of the Pantanal.</p><p>Tourists flock to the Pantanal for its dense population of jaguars, not to mention the scores of other species like tapirs, giant river otters, caimans, and capybaras. But thousands of these animals, including an estimated 600 jaguars, are now dead.</p><p>NEX works with veterinarians to help save jaguars it gets to on time, like Amanaci. The organization treated its first feline with stem cells nine years ago for a fractured front paw.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0c2ad260780019341f9e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"jaguar\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1920\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Amanaci, a jaguar, was found with severe burns, and was treated with stem cells.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>Around the world, stem cells have generated excitement in the scientific community for their potential to help both people and animals heal quickly, but it remains unclear if the treatments actually work.&#160;<p>\"The result (with stem cell treatment) is surprising,\" veterinarian Patricia Malard said. \"People are very happy with how the injury is evolving.\"</p><p>The fires threatening these animals <a href=\"https://news.mongabay.com/2020/09/for-the-pantanals-jaguars-fires-bring-death-by-a-thousand-needle-wounds/\">are often man-made</a>. Every year, ranchers use fires to cheaply return nutrients to the soil and renew pasture for their beef cattle. But scientists say climate change is <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-climate-change-brazil-pantanal-insigh/burned-jaguars-fire-tornadoes-blazes-in-brazil-wetland-deliver-climate-warning-idUSKBN2651DZ\">only making the problem worse</a>.</p><p>The tropical wetlands are now fully parched, so fires started to help the soil are actually penetrating farther into forests, burning more trees and causing more damage.</p><p>Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's government has been <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/bolsonaro-to-world-brazil-is-victim-of-environmental-smear/2020/09/22/54505f2e-fce4-11ea-b0e4-350e4e60cc91_story.html\">criticized by environmentalists</a> and local media who say he is emboldening illegal ranchers and land speculators who set fire to land to increase its value for agricultural use. It's a claim he denies.</p><p>This year's fires are the worst since record-keeping began in 1998.</p><p>As for Amanaci, the dressings around her paws are changed periodically, and she's left in her cage to continue recovering. It's unclear if she'll be able to go back to the wild, as that could mean sending her right back into danger.</p><p>Activists at NEX fear it's only a matter of time before these fires destroy Amanaci's homeland.</p><p>\"In the end we have to deal with the cause (of the fires), because we are used to suffering but this is nothing like we have ever seen before,\" Gianni said.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/brazil-pantanal-fires-nex-institute-jaguars-stem-cell-treatment-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/W0v0Xdi7mWQ\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 21:51:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0fa69e9fe40019009e76?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"6a182b868abb642662213679c8eadec2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn15@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-18-260_70bffa91af101f2b.webp","destWidth":1440,"destHeight":1080,"sourceBytes":84804,"destBytes":84804,"author":"jbaylon@businessinsider.com (Jacqueline Baylon,Claire Molloy)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0c2ad260780019341f9e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn31@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-28-757_7690a03db97ecbf2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn47@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-25-255_14e5929b16bf54e2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn7@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-20-677_ee6506627e213d1f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=W0v0Xdi7mWQ:VusbhWHlqws:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn8@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-27-850_ff003e66065a5df3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/W0v0Xdi7mWQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn63@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-20-275_f46ee3a6b34fe0ca.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799672},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"For 2 years I taught English in small, idyllic cities in southwest France — and it wasn't the vacation I thought it would be","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/teaching-english-abroad-isnt-as-easy-as-you-think-2020-7","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f18a43e3f737074ab5d7835?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ciara McLaren on a day trip to Biarritz, a seaside town on the southwest coast of France.\" height=\"2095\" width=\"2794\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ciara McLaren on a day trip to Biarritz, a seaside town on the southwest coast of France.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ciara McLaren</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>After graduating with her master's degree, Ciara McLaren moved from Florida to a small town in western France to work part-time as an assistant English instructor at a public school.</li><li>She was paid roughly half the French minimum wage and lived in a dormitory for young workers.</li><li>McLaren says the beginning of her stay in France had many challenges, from overcoming the language barrier and experiencing culture shock to learning how to work well with teenagers.</li><li>Still, after two years in the program, McLaren says she would do it again \"in a heartbeat,\" and encourages others interested in teaching English abroad to go for it with \"eyes and mind wide open.\"</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>For the past two years, I've taught English for 12 hours a week in small, idyllic French cities. It's a lot harder than it sounds.&#160;</p><p>Before you start playing the world's tiniest violin, hear me out: I was an <em>assistante de langue, </em>a classroom aide for English teachers at French public schools. As nice as it may seem to work part-time in the land of baguettes, champagne, and bimonthly vacations, teaching is tough. It's even tougher in a culture that is not your own.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://frenchhighereducation.org/teaching-assistant-program/prospective-applicants/faq\">Teaching Assistant Program in France</a> recruits Americans ages 20-35 to work part-time providing English instruction in French public schools for €785 per month, plus health insurance. I was fresh out of a rigorous graduate program and having conversations in English&#160; for 12 hours a week seemed like a vacation in comparison — I applied, got in, and made plans to move to France.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Lesson learned: Moving to a foreign country is not a vacation.&#160;</strong></h2><p>By the time I applied to TAPIF, it had been three years since I'd spoken a word of my intermediate college French. I tried my best to prepare by watching every French movie on Netflix, but with the school year rapidly approaching, I could still barely string a sentence together.</p><p>Immediately upon arrival in Paris, it became clear that this would be a problem. It's one thing to be an English-speaking tourist, and quite another to be an English-speaking resident. I did my best to express myself using an expansive English vocabulary, my best French accent, and elaborate hand gestures. The result of these attempts was usually tears: tears at the bank, tears at the train station, tears at the phone shop, etc.&#160;</p><p>Once I had cried my way to a French phone number and rail card, I traveled south to the city where I was assigned: Niort. The small city has two main claims to fame: One, it contains the headquarters of several insurance companies, and two, the great writer Michel Houellebecq called it one of the <a href=\"https://www.thelocal.fr/20190104/ugly-french-town-hits-back-at-literary-rebel-houellebecq\">\"one of the ugliest cities\"</a> ever. (For what it's worth, I actually thought Niort was quite charming.)</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f18aba9aee6a8386942dcef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The view from the Donjon de Niort, a medieval castle in the downtown area of Niort. Ciara McLaren\" height=\"2809\" width=\"3745\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The view from the Donjon de Niort, a medieval castle in the downtown area of Niort.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ciara McLaren</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>To make ends meet on my minimal salary (half the French minimum wage), I lived in a <em>foyer des jeunes travailleurs, </em>a dormitory for young workers. With <em>CAF, </em>a government housing supplement, I paid just over 50 euros a month in rent for a small room next to a shared toilet. Not exactly Versailles, <em>mais bon.</em>&#160;</p><h2><strong>My first day on the job, the culture shock hit me before I walked through the door.&#160;</strong></h2><p>Outside of the school gate, dozens upon dozens of teachers and students alike were chain-smoking cigarettes.&#160;</p><p>The school where I would be working was a <em>lycee professionnel, </em>a vocational school, with students ages 15-18 (with some older and younger outliers).&#160; It specializes in automobile repair and bodywork (which I knew nothing about), and the student body was made up of about 95% boys.&#160;</p><p>This turned out not to be much of an issue. Most of my students, regardless of age, gender, or career path, asked me the same questions during class time. \"Do you have a gun?\" \"Do you like Trump?\" \"Have you met XXXTentacion?\" No, no, and no.&#160;</p><p>I turned their questions back on them. Do <em>you</em> have a gun? Do you like France? Have you met Macron? Also no, no, and no. But it provoked a conversation, in English, which was really my only job. And I liked my job, most of the time.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f18ad62f34d0557821db916?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ciara mclaren Good bread, jambon cru, and courgette salad from the local market of Pau, France.\" height=\"2402\" width=\"3203\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Good bread, jambon cru, and courgette salad from the local market in Pau, France.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ciara McLaren</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>Speaking English with students was simple, but not easy.&#160;</strong></h2><p>Teenagers are teenagers wherever you go, and discipline was a constant issue. I sent students to the principal's office for everything from sexual harassment to physical fights. Despite my part-time hours, I always looked forward to school vacations.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f18accd988ee3675f44f746?format=jpeg\" alt=\"On a hike in the Pyrenees (don’t look too closely as the sheep). Ciara McLaren\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>On a hike in the Pyrenees (don&#39;t look too closely at the sheep).\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ciara McLaren</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Many weeks, I didn't even work my full 12 hours. Shortly after I arrived, the <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/dec/03/who-are-the-gilets-jaunes-and-what-do-they-want\"><em>gilets jaunes</em></a> protests erupted across the country, and more <em>manifestations </em>against austerity and school reform followed throughout the year. Daily life was so disrupted that some days I couldn't get to school, or would arrive to find the gate locked and nobody there.&#160;</p><p>In those moments, I turned to my <em>profs référents, </em>the teachers assigned to look after me. They answered my questions, invited me to their homes, and included me in conversation in the break room. Sometimes, they'd forget to tell me there was a strike going on, but they were always very apologetic afterward.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f18ad85f34d0557da4c73ba?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fresh pastries from Le Pain Pascale in Pau, France. Ciara McLaren\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Fresh pastries from Le Pain Pascale in Pau, France.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ciara McLaren</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Looking back on my two years spent teaching English in France, I feel both privileged and exploited.&#160;</p><p>On the one hand, I worked 12 hours or fewer a week, with frequent vacations, in one of the most beautiful countries on earth. On the other hand, the job combined two very difficult things: being a foreigner and working with teenagers.&#160;</p><p>In testimonials on the TAPIF website, former assistants describe freedom, friendship, and growth. They don't mention the long hours spent fighting with French bureaucracy to accomplish basically anything, from getting an apartment to validating your visa. They don't mention how hard it is to control your temper when your students won't stop asking you whether you prefer \"French fry or French kiss.\" In Facebook groups and local assistant meet-ups, we would commiserate over our difficulties and celebrate our triumphs.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f18ac1b3f7370799d366832?format=jpeg\" alt=\"In quarantine in Pau, France, in March 2020. Ciara McLaren\" height=\"3671\" width=\"2835\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In quarantine in Pau, France, March 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ciara McLaren</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Despite some challenging moments, I would do it over again in a heartbeat. Two years working part-time hours in France gave me the time and space I needed to become a freelance writer. My contract ended earlier this year, and after months of quarantine in France, I returned to the US in early July. (Despite everything, it's home.)</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f18ac93f34d05569325b51d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"On a balcony overlooking the Pyrenees, January 2020. Ciara McLaren\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>On a balcony overlooking the Pyrenees, in January 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ciara McLaren</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Still, I would tell anyone considering teaching English abroad to go for it — with eyes and mind wide open.&#160;</p><p>Being an <em>assistant de langue </em>may seem like a dream job, but it's really just like any job, with one big difference. Some days it's great, other days it's awful, but either way, you're in France.</p><p><em>Ciara McLaren is a freelance writer with bylines in HuffPost, Gastronomica, and elsewhere. You can read more of her work on </em><a href=\"https://alottosay.substack.com/\"><em>Substack.</em></a><em>&#160;</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Bzfb7m_mN18\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 17 Oct 2020 01:08:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f18a43e3f737074ab5d7835?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"022fc014f08cc63a0b7f3880cb80d162","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn13@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-01-473_116089f3564a8b6a.webp","destWidth":2794,"destHeight":2095,"sourceBytes":427416,"destBytes":427416,"author":"insider@insider.com (Ciara McLaren)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f18a43e3f737074ab5d7835?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn13@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-01-473_116089f3564a8b6a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f18aba9aee6a8386942dcef?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn71@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-24-979_ca5e2a72b9d82df8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f18ad62f34d0557821db916?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn16@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-15-464_e5a386d2b535b4a6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f18accd988ee3675f44f746?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn19@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-24-342_198b20ed237e8e2c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f18ad85f34d0557da4c73ba?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn72@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-23-349_2fb68a26e18ac79d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f18ac1b3f7370799d366832?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn87@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-24-248_6b4d1ca8c3a12a04.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f18ac93f34d05569325b51d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn4@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-24-218_a247db022ac801c1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Bzfb7m_mN18:E-YK6An2juY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn96@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-18-275_9fca4bfc2dd2959d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Bzfb7m_mN18:E-YK6An2juY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn91@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-27-156_9ea6b1642bf1ac42.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Bzfb7m_mN18:E-YK6An2juY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-21-057_2964ea6e491f67ec.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Bzfb7m_mN18":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn39@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-15-724_9bac6e6833d4cfb9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799708},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"Big tech's biggest shield is under fire from all 3 branches of government — here's how repealing Section 230 went from a Trump threat to an impending reality","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-section-230-facebook-trump-clarence-thomas-ajit-pai-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ca599e9fe40019009ca2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mark zuckerberg congress WASHINGTON, DC - OCTOBER 23: Facebook co-founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg leaves the Rayburn House Office Building after testifying before the House Financial Services Committee for six hours on Capitol Hill October 23, 2019 in Washington, DC. Zuckerberg testified about Facebook&#39;s proposed cryptocurrency Libra, how his company will handle false and misleading information by political leaders during the 2020 campaign and how it handles its users’ data and privacy. (Photo by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)\" height=\"2734\" width=\"3645\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Pressure is mounting in all three branches of government to strip blanket protections that big tech companies have long enjoyed.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Section 230 &#8212; a federal law that Shields social media companies from liabilities that would otherwise reshape or crush their businesses &#8212; appears closer than ever to being rewritten.&#160;</li>\n<li>President Donald Trump has escalated a recent push to repeal Section 230 as retribution for Facebook and Twitter fact-checking his posts. He says they're proof that the platforms are biased against him, a claim Republicans have echoed.</li>\n<li>Before that, both Democrats and Republicans have said for years that Section 230, which shields tech companies from being held liable for the content of users' posts, needs to be updated.</li>\n<li>But repealing Section 230 was still a remote prospect &#8212; until this week, when FCC Chairman Ajit Pai said he would issue guidance redefining the law.</li>\n<li>And just days earlier, Supreme Court Associate Justice Clarence Thomas, one of the court's conservative members, wrote an unusual opinion arguing that courts should reinterpret Section 230 to give tech companies fewer protections.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>After years of threats, the US government appears closer than ever to stripping away one of Big Tech's biggest shields.</p><p>In the weeks before the election, President Donald Trump has called with growing urgency for the repeal of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-section-230-internet-law-communications-decency-act-explained-2020-5\">Section 230</a>, a law that prevents internet companies from being held liable for the content of users' posts as long as they make a good faith effort to remove illegal content.</p><p>This week, officials mounted more immediate threats to the law that&#160;could fundamentally reshape the internet and its biggest companies.</p><p>On Thursday, Ajit Pai, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fcc-section-230-reform-trump-puppet-ajit-pai-2020-10\">announced</a> that his office would \"clarify the meaning\" of Section 230, a measure that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-signs-executive-order-threatening-twitter-facebook-conservative-bias-2020-5\">Trump has specifically requested</a>. While Pai didn't indicate what the clarifications would include, he implied that social media companies would lose some of the legal immunity currently granted to them by the law.&#160;Two days earlier, Clarence Thomas, associate justice of the Supreme Court and one of the court's conservative justices, issued an <a href=\"https://www.supremecourt.gov/orders/courtorders/101320zor_8m58.pdf\">unusual opinion</a> arguing that courts should reconsider how Section 230 is interpreted to offer social media companies fewer protections.</p><p>The new developments mean big tech companies could face a restructured Section 230 in the near future. And by potentially circumventing Congress and the legislative process needed to amend the law, the federal government could act more immediately, and leave those companies without much recourse to fight the new regulations.</p><p>Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act, known simply as Section 230, is part of a 1996 law that allows websites to avoid being treated as traditional publishers like newspapers that would be legally responsible for the content they produce. It has <a href=\"https://www.eff.org/issues/cda230\">set the legal foundations for the modern internet</a> and enabled sites to host open forums populated by posts from anonymous users. Companies like Facebook and other supporters of Section 230 see it as a fundamental building block for open discussion and innovation on the internet — akin to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/net-neutralityfor-dummies-and-how-it-effects-you-2014-1\">net neutrality</a>. Trump and the law's critics, meanwhile, say that big tech has too frequently wielded the law as a shield for their own bad behavior.</p><p>Republican officials, including Trump's closest allies, have been some of the most high-profile recent drivers advocating a repeal or rewrite of the law. They say actions by Facebook and Twitter to fact-check Trump's false statements are evidence of systemic bias against conservatives, a claim <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/27/technology/what-if-facebook-is-the-real-silent-majority.html\">without much data to back it up</a>. Meanwhile, some Democrats — including House Speaker <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/2019/4/12/18307957/nancy-pelosi-donald-trump-twitter-tweet-cheap-freak-presidency-kara-swisher-decode-podcast-interview\">Nancy Pelosi</a> — have implied tech companies should face harsher penalties for hosting misinformation or hate speech, but have not gone as far as to push to dismantle Section 230.</p><p>Tech companies like Facebook, Twitter, and Google have objected to calls to weaken the law's protections. A Facebook spokesperson <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/28/trump-targets-social-media-with-executive-order-after-twitter-fact-checks-him.html\">said in May</a> that limiting Section 230 \"will restrict more speech online, not less\" by penalizing companies \"that choose to allow controversial speech,\" while a Google spokesperson <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/05/28/trump-social-media-executive-order/\">said</a> the same month that repealing the law could hurt the US' stature as a leader in internet freedom.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Donald J. Trump  (@realDonaldTrump) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1313511340124917760?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 6, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><h2>If Thomas' opinion wins out, new liabilities could crush or reshape tech companies' businesses</h2><p>On Tuesday, the Supreme Court declined to hear a case concerning Section 230. In the rejection, Thomas <a href=\"https://www.supremecourt.gov/orders/courtorders/101320zor_8m58.pdf\">argued</a>&#160;that courts should still reconsider the law at some point in the near future.</p><p>He cited examples of previous lawsuits in the opinion, arguing that Section 230 was interpreted too broadly to shield tech companies.</p><p>In one case, a group called Sikhs for Justice <a href=\"https://blog.ericgoldman.org/archives/2017/09/facebook-wins-appeal-over-allegedly-discriminatory-content-removal-sikhs-for-justice-v-facebook.htm\">sued Facebook</a>, claiming it removed their page at the request of the Indian government and refused to reinstate it, amounting to racial discrimination. In another case, a man <a href=\"https://ecfsapi.fcc.gov/file/10902194429858/20200902_Goldberg_FCC_Coments_Final.pdf\">sued</a> the gay dating app Grindr for allegedly failing to remove the profile of another man who was impersonating him using his photos.</p><p>Facebook and Grindr won each of their cases. In both, courts didn't rule on whether the plaintiffs' claims were true — rather, they argued that Section 230 protected Facebook from claims of racial discrimination in how it moderates content, and that Section 230 immunized Grindr from complaints about how it removes fake profiles.</p><p>Thomas argued that those cases established an overly broad definition of Section 230 that should be narrowed in the future.</p><p>If Thomas' view prevails, hosting social media platforms would pose a far greater liability for tech companies, opening them up to a slew of new potential lawsuits. Legal experts are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/if-section-230-dies-twitter-facebook-would-likely-ban-trump-2020-5\">divided</a> on what social media would look like without Section 230 protections, but changing the law could massively reshape how open forums are hosted across the internet.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-section-230-facebook-trump-clarence-thomas-ajit-pai-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=sjqMOIRV4FU:3ueK-wrNh4c:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=sjqMOIRV4FU:3ueK-wrNh4c:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sjqMOIRV4FU:3ueK-wrNh4c:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=sjqMOIRV4FU:3ueK-wrNh4c:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/sjqMOIRV4FU\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 22:36:16 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f89ca2fd260780019341dc6?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"bfe0bf7d1f1a9b5a4e7f4faba29cd124","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn9@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-13-891_e597a9fefeef125f.webp","destWidth":628,"destHeight":471,"sourceBytes":15852,"destBytes":15852,"author":"aholmes@businessinsider.com (Aaron Holmes)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f89ca599e9fe40019009ca2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn23@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-17-497_2726ef46a3f029f0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sjqMOIRV4FU:3ueK-wrNh4c:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn23@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-25-038_f326e0a2559da932.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sjqMOIRV4FU:3ueK-wrNh4c:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn40@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-26-613_c1c67ffaf7e984b5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sjqMOIRV4FU:3ueK-wrNh4c:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn67@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-22-644_f0d56a84478871ee.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/sjqMOIRV4FU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn60@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-19-361_d27f2085686d4468.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799719},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"How to listen to Apple Podcasts on an Android device in 2 ways","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-listen-to-apple-podcasts-on-android","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f745d260780019341f30?format=jpeg\" alt=\"man with headphones holding phone looking out window listening\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can listen to podcasts on your Android with apps like Google Podcasts and others.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Westend61/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can listen to virtually any podcast on your Android, just like you can with Apple Podcasts on your iPhone.</li>\n<li>To listen to your favorite podcasts on Android, install a podcast app like Google Podcasts and subscribe to the shows you want to hear to have them automatically downloaded.</li>\n<li>You can also find many podcasts on the podcast host's website and stream them from there.&#160;</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>For a long time, podcasts were connected with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/apple\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Apple</a> devices in the popular consciousness, likely because it was easy to associate podcasts with the original Apple <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/ipod\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iPod</a>.&#160;</p><p>The reality, of course, is that no mobile platform has a claim to podcasts, and virtually any podcast you can find on the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iPhone's</a> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/apple-podcasts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Apple Podcasts</a> app is also available for <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/android\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Android</a>.&#160;</p><p>Here are two different ways to find and listen to podcasts on Android.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to listen to podcasts on Android using Google Podcasts&#160;</strong></h2><p>Hands down, the easiest way to listen to podcasts is by subscribing to them in a podcast app. You can use Google Podcasts or any third-party podcast app, of which there are many, such as <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.stitcher.app&hl=enl=en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stitcher</a>, <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=au.com.shiftyjelly.pocketcasts&hl=enl=en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Pocket Casts</a>, and even <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.spotify.music&hl=en_US&gl=USmp;gl=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Spotify</a>.</p><p><strong>1.</strong> If you want to try the official Google Podcasts app, <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.podcasts&hl=en_US&gl=USmp;gl=US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">install Google Podcasts</a> from the Google Play store.&#160;</p><p><strong>2.</strong> You can browse the Explore page, but to find a specific podcast, tap the search bar at the top of the page and enter the name of the podcast you're looking for.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f142d260780019341ee7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_listen_to_Apple_Podcasts_on_Android 1\" height=\"2874\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can browse the Explore page of Google Podcast or use the search bar at the top of the page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3.</strong> In the search results, tap the podcast you want to listen to.</p><p><strong>4.</strong> The next page contains an entry for the show itself at the top of the page followed by a list of individual episodes and other results. Tap the entry for the podcast at the top of the page.</p><p><strong>5.</strong> If you want to subscribe to the show, which will automatically download the latest episode to your phone when it's available, tap \"Subscribe.\"&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f2929e9fe40019009dc4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_listen_to_Apple_Podcasts_on_Android 2\" height=\"2870\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>If you want to hear new episodes as they are released, subscribe to the podcast.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>6.</strong> To listen to a specific episode, scroll through the list of episodes and tap the Play button for the one you want to hear.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f2eb9e9fe40019009dc7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_listen_to_Apple_Podcasts_on_Android 3\" height=\"2864\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap the Play button to start listening to any episode.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>How to listen to podcasts on Android from a website</strong></h2><p>If you don't want to go to the trouble of installing a podcast app and subscribing to shows, you might be able to listen to a podcast from your mobile web browser. Many (but not all) podcasts can be streamed from the host's website.&#160;</p><p><strong>1.</strong> In a browser on your Android device, open the webpage that contains the podcast. You might need to search for it – for example, a search for \"NPR podcast\" can take you to npr.com/podcasts.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f33bd260780019341eef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_listen_to_Apple_Podcasts_on_Android 4\" height=\"2876\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can browse for all of NPR&#39;s podcasts from its website.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>2.</strong> Browse for the podcast show or episode you want to listen to.</p><p><strong>3.</strong> Tap the \"Play\" or \"Listen\" button to begin streaming it to your phone.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f444d260780019341ef7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_listen_to_Apple_Podcasts_on_Android 5\" height=\"2873\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Many podcasts are also hosted on web pages and you can listen to them directly from there.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><div id=\"ProductCard_5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e87473ab3b0922aa94f2764\" style=\"position:relative; spacious Premium River View Room.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>The <a data-stringify-link=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly&#160;newsletter&#160;for more buying advice and great deals</a>.</li></ul><p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleansFnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Loews New Orleans Hotel</a> is a NoLa darling, known for its pool and spa, as well as a beloved restaurant and bar that's among the higher ranks of New Orleans four and five-star properties.&#160;</p><p>It sits in a small cluster of luxury hotels (a group that includes Le Meridien, the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/windsor-court-hotel-review-new-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Windsor Court</a>, and Harrah's Hotel) at the end of Poydras Street, just on the outskirts of the historic French Quarter. The Mississippi River is on the doorstep, and its understated elegance merges together with alluring amenities. As a result, it has enjoyed a good reputation.</p><p>Now that New Orleans is cautiously entering phase three of its COVID-19 response, hotels such as Loews are reopening after temporary closures during peak infection rates.</p><p>And they're not only swinging the doors back open, but they're running attractive offers as well, with relatively low room rates designed to stimulate recovery and attract visitors back to the <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Neighborhood-g60864-n8594421-French_Quarter-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">French Quarter</a> and <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Neighborhood-g60864-n8594419-Central_Business_District-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Central Business District</a>&#160;(CBD).</p><p>For locals looking to break out of quarantine with a safety-minded staycation, or those with plans to visit New Orleans, hotels like Loews are making it easier and cheaper than ever to book a stay.</p><p>I already wanted to see for myself how the hotel, and the CBD, adapted to the pandemic, but an extremely affordable promotion — Park, Play, Extend Your Stay — made it a no brainer.</p><p>For $149, I booked a standard a <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleansFnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Deluxe City View Room</a> that came with free parking, a $25 per day food and beverage credit, a room upgrade subject to availability, and a late, 4 p.m. check-out time. This deal is available on Loews' website until January 1, 2021, starts as low as $139, and comes with flexible cancelation policies as well.&#160;</p><p>If you'd rather just book a room without any of the above perks, you can also book just a room starting at $119 per night.</p><p>It was a mixed experience, with some amenities related to the promotion not available (details below), though the hotel did in all fairness set things right. It still felt like decent value, especially given a generous room upgrade, but the property was obviously still relatively empty. Thankfully, the professionalism of the staff meant it was a positive experience, though, and I would stay here again given some clearer information.&#160;&#160;</p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-hotel-review-new-orleans#-1\">The first impression</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-hotel-review-new-orleans#-5\">The room</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-hotel-review-new-orleans#-12\">On-site amenities</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-hotel-review-new-orleans#-15\">What's nearby</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-hotel-review-new-orleans#-16\">What others say</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-hotel-review-new-orleans#-17\">What you need to know</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-hotel-review-new-orleans#-18\">COVID-19 policies</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-hotel-review-new-orleans#-19\">The bottom line</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleansFnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Book the Loews New Orleans Hotel starting at $119 per night</a></li></ul><h2>Keep reading to see why I was so impressed by the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&awinaffid=257137&clickref=&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleansFnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Loews New Orleans Hotel</a>.</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d9b60d6695b583f20756fd3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1 Hotel Reviews Banner first impression\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ad099e9fe40019009bbe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews New Orleans hotel lobby\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The grand lobby is one of the hotel&#39;s best features.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Loews New Orleans Hotel</a> is part of the small chain of Loews hotels, which operates 28 high-end, luxe properties across North America. We've previously reviewed the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-regency-hotel-review-new-york\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">New York</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-miami-beach-hotel-review-miami\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Miami</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/loews-coronado-bay-resort-hotel-review-san-diego\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">San Diego</a> locations and were big fans.</p><p>This particular location is in a contemporary building that meshes well with the modern aesthetics of the surrounding <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Neighborhood-g60864-n8594419-Central_Business_District-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Central Business District</a> thanks to an Art Deco-looking canopy that adds a more whimsical look to the main entrance.</p><p>When I arrived, things appeared looked less busy than usual with the regular team of doormen and valets reduced to a single employee.</p><p>Inside, the lobby was as striking as ever, with marble and tiles polished to a gleaming shine. It's a coherent collage of Beaux Arts, Art Deco, and contemporary design flourishes, exuding a regal flair thanks to a brown, cream, and gold color palette.</p><p>A large modern art piece hung behind twin teak reception desks, now embellished with plastic barriers.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ad4bd260780019341ceb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews hotel lobby hand sanitizer\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Hand sanitizer stations were placed at all elevator doors.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Everyone, the door person/lobby assistant included, was masked and enthusiastically welcomed me. I immediately saw a couple of hand sanitizing stations, as well as place markers on the floor to denote social distancing measures, and a couple of posters that outlined the hotel's new protocols.</p><p>I was the sole guest checking in at around 3 p.m. on a Wednesday afternoon, which was a nod to how hospitality in this city has slowed amid the pandemic.</p><p>Despite arriving an hour before official check-in time, the room was ready and in line with my promotion, I was also upgraded from an entry-level <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Deluxe City View Room</a> to a <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Premium River View Room</a>. In addition to the enhanced view, this next room category meant I would be on a higher floor and enjoy more space.&#160;</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ad62d260780019341cec?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews hotel social distancing sticker\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Floor markers help with social distancing measures and are in line with the hotel&#39;s new safety branding campaign.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Before I left to find my room, the front desk employee politely explained the hotel's COVID protocols, though when I asked about where I could spend my $25 food and beverage credit, the bad news arrived.</p><p>The bar and restaurant were only open at the weekend and I was staying midweek. Additionally, the minibars in the rooms were to remain locked for hygiene reasons.</p><p>I felt this should have been made much clearer at the time of booking and expressed my concern. The hotel agreed to credit the $25 to my bill, meaning that I now only paid $124 for an upgraded room with a late 4 p.m. check-out time (and free parking, though, I don't have a car), which offered excellent value.</p><p>Check-in complete, I headed to my room, noting additional sanitizer stations at the elevators.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d979264d831b2141f07abd1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2 Hotel Reviews Banner The room\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ada5d260780019341cee?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews hotel room view\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The view from my room across to Harrah&#39;s Casino.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>As part of my complimentary upgrade, I was allocated a <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Premium River View Room</a> on the 15th floor &#8212; the hotel has 22 floors in total.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Loews New Orleans Hotel</a> has seven room categories, all with similar artwork and amenities, just varying sizes and views.</p><p>A contemporary luxe aesthetic carries through all of the rooms and suites, mostly neutral greys, creams, and whites with royal blue accents and sleek decor that blends in rather than standing out.</p><p>I didn't find anything particularly striking about the look, but my room felt reassuringly high quality and would be unlikely to offend anyone.</p><p>The views were namely what I noticed first. From the large windows, I could look out over the Mississippi River, the neighboring <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g60864-d106446-Reviews-Harrah_s_Casino_New_Orleans-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Harrah's Casino</a>, and the edges of the <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g60864-d102533-Reviews-French_Quarter-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Historic French Quarter</a>.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89a6c4d260780019341ca2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews New Orleans bedroom\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The spacious Premium River View Room.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>My <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Premium River View Room</a> was a tier up from the entry-level room I originally booked.</p><p>At 435 square feet, it felt almost like a junior suite considering the generous living space that was incorporated into the layout. Large windows let in lots of light and 1o-foot ceilings maintained the spacious feel. As noted, the decor was modern and unobtrusive, with sleek lines and neutral tones. A dark blue and gold carpet added some subtle color.</p><p>The King-sized bed boasted crisp, high-end linens and a firm mattress for a very good night's sleep. There was a slight level of ambient noise from some very loud street performers below, but thankfully, they didn't last into the night and I imagine they aren't a permanent fixture.</p><p>Traffic and general street noise were muted, and I didn't hear any noise from neighbors or the hotel corridors.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89adffd260780019341cf3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews hotel new orleans minibar\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The minibar was locked but the coffee machine was a handy amenity.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The hotel promotes its COVID-19 cleaning and general protocols available on their <a href=\"https://cdn.loewshotels.com/loewshotels.com-2466770763/cms/pressroom/lh_safetyprotocols_71820.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">website</a> and it felt as though my stay lived up to them.</p><p>Rooms are given at least 24 hours between guests, and so, it felt fresh and hygienic, although the promised bottle of water and hand sanitizer were missing from my room, which was disappointing &#8212; especially the latter given the pandemic.</p><p>As part of the new policy, many amenities were stripped out, including paper pads, pens, and the minibars, as noted. Neither were there any robes. My TV remote control was wrapped in plastic.</p><p>In-room coffee and tea were still available via a Keurig machine<em>. </em>If my stay had been longer, I could have requested housekeeping, which was halted for my one-night stay. Had they arrived, the staff would be required to wear masks.&#160;</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89afce9e9fe40019009bdb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews new orleans hotel living space\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The extra living space made my room feel more like a junior suite.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>A large living space would make this room more than comfortable for a couple or small family. I enjoyed the large, adjustable flat screen TV and fast complimentary Wi-Fi while working from either the large comfy sofa and coffee table, or the desk with an ergonomically-designed chair. A couple of musical instrument-themed photos and artwork hung on the walls to solidify a sense of place.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89af809e9fe40019009bd7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews new orleans hotel bathroom\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The marble counter top and shaving mirror in the bathroom was clean and upscale.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The toiletries in the tiled bathroom were branded Julien Farel, a nod to the New York Loews where Farel operates a posh salon and spa. There was also a marble countertop with one sink and plentiful thick towels, plus a vanity kit.</p><p>The water pressure from the shower and tub combo, as well as the temperature controls, were all satisfactory and responsive. A ring light shaving mirror added to the luxurious appearance.</p><p>Although not cutting edge or particularly striking, the bathroom, and space in general, felt like a well-maintained, modern room that equaled any amenities at this level in the city.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89af33d260780019341d00?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews new orleans hotel writing desk\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The room came with a sizeable writing desk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>I haven't stayed in the suites at this hotel, but from the photographs, it appears the comfort and style levels don't increase dramatically, which speaks well of the rooms rather than badly of the suites. They do, of course, offer much more space. A suite at current prices would be well worth considering if space is a concern.</p><p>As such, there are <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Grand King Suites</a> (721 square feet) on each floor and a <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Presidential Suite</a> (1079 square feet) on the top floor. These suites currently sell for around $365 and $929 per night respectively, which, again are good prices for that level of room in the city.</p><p>The entry-level <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Deluxe City Room</a> I originally booked would have been a perfectly acceptable 346 square feet and regular nightly rates start even lower than what I paid for it, at around $139.</p><p>My upgraded Premium River Room usually starts at around $295 per night for its 435 square feet. With the free upgrade, late checkout, great views, and sofa-enhanced living space that made it feel like a junior suite, the current promotion (and subsequent $25 rate reduction), which runs until January 1, 2021, made this stay one of exceptionally strong value in terms of the room alone. Sure, I could have booked just the room for $119, but for a few dollars more, the added perks proved more than worth it.</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Compare room types and prices for the Loews Hotel New Orleans</a></h2>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d9b60d7695b583f20756fda?format=jpeg\" alt=\"3 Hotel Reviews Banner On site amenities\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89b061d260780019341d05?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews hotel new orleans lounge\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The lounge area just before the bar and restaurant were sadly closed, but well styled.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>As noted, I was sadly denied the experience of eating and drinking at the hotel's bar and restaurant, Poydras and Peters. If you click through on the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Loews New Orleans Hotel</a> website, the dining page does direct you to a customer helpline to check whether facilities are open, so the information is available pre-booking, it's just not very prominent.</p><p>I've eaten at Poydras and Peters in the past and it's a perfectly pleasant hotel restaurant, though many feel it's a slight letdown from its previous incarnation, run by the high-profile Brennan's group, who own several locally celebrated dining establishments.</p><p>I was informed that should I have stayed Friday through Sunday, I could have eaten there. The menu mixes international and southern favorites, and their gumbo is particularly good, as far as I remember.</p><p>In-room dining was also not possible, nor is it at any time at present. The hotel is, however, well placed for walking to many of the local dining highlights.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89b0909e9fe40019009be3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"loews hotel New Orleans indoor pool\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The hotel&#39;s indoor pool is one of the few in the city.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paul Oswell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The hotel spa was also closed, but the 8th-floor pool and exercise rooms remained open.</p><p>The swimming pool here is a New Orleans rarity, being one of the very few heated indoor pools available. There were no guests using either facility when I visited them, but the prominent signage reminded people of their COVID distancing responsibilities. The pool area was of a very good standard and felt like a high-end country club facility, as did the well-equipped exercise room, which had a good mix of modern cardio and weights machines.</p><p>The only other amenity adjustment I noticed were ice machines were only available on alternate floors, but that did not feel too high up in terms of inconvenience.</p><p>Overall, I felt that the hotel was working towards a balanced experience, keeping the pool and gym open, but exercising caution with dining facilities.</p><p>Again, this would have been useful information up front, but with restaurants close by, it didn't detract too much from an otherwise reassuringly well-managed environment.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d97928ad831b2140609a1c0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"4 Hotel Reviews Banner What&#39;s nearby\" height=\"151\" width=\"1201\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The hotel's location is a good one, a couple of blocks away from the historic <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Neighborhood-g60864-n8594421-French_Quarter-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">French Quarter</a> but that distance offers a good buffer against what is usually a busy, noisy neighborhood.</p><p>On the doorstep are a couple of major local attractions, the first being the city's only casino, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g60864-d106446-Reviews-Harrah_s_Casino_New_Orleans-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Harrah's</a>, and beyond that, the banks of the Mississippi River and its attendant steamboats and parks are also very close. It's also possible to walk to the <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g60864-d106440-Reviews-The_National_WWII_Museum-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">National World War II Museum</a>, the highest-rated attraction in the city.</p><p>A streetcar line runs from the stations at the foot of Poydras Street right outside the hotel and local transportation is also very manageable. Walking into the French Quarter for some of the city's best shopping and dining is a breeze.</p><h2><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.expedia.com%2FCheap-Flights-To-New-Orleans.d178292.Travel-Guide-Flights\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Check flight prices to New Orleans on Expedia</a></h2>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d97929ab15102103d15bdb7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"5 Hotel Reviews Banner What others say\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Loews New Orleans Hotel</a> receives an 'excellent' 4.5 out of 5-star rating on <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g60864-d268257-Reviews-Loews_New_Orleans_Hotel-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Trip Advisor</a> and is ranked 32 out of 177 hotels in New Orleans with just under 3,500 reviews.</p><p>Past guests praise the spacious rooms and amenities, as well as proximity to some of the city's tourist highlights.</p><p>Many reviewers also rave about the level of service offered by the hotel staff, and this summary of the location and rooms is typical: \"The location is ideal if wanting larger spaces, peace and quiet, and a simply gorgeous view of the Mississippi.\"</p><p>Guests on lower floors, however, don't all share this opinion. Some were disappointed that the casino blocks views of the river.</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g60864-d268257-Reviews-Loews_New_Orleans_Hotel-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Read reviews, compare prices, and book the Loews New Orleans Hotel on TripAdvisor</a></h2>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d9b60d7695b583f20756fde?format=jpeg\" alt=\"6 Hotel Reviews Banner What you need to know\" height=\"151\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><strong>Who stays here</strong>: A slightly more mature crowd that wants to retire to greater levels of tranquility after a day in the <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.tripadvisor.com/Neighborhood-g60864-n8594421-French_Quarter-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">French Quarter</a>, and tourists in town to visit the casino. Travelers with COVID-related concerns should feel relatively assured by the protocols in place.</p><p><strong>We like</strong>: The overall politeness and can-do attitude of the staff, spacious rooms, and competitive prices for a luxury hotel.</p><p><strong>We love (don't miss this feature!)</strong>: The very well appointed and heated indoor swimming pool, one of only a couple of indoor pools in the city.</p><p><strong>We think you should know</strong>: Street performers on Poydras Street can cause a certain amount of noise, especially if you're staying on a lower floor.</p><p><strong>We'd do this differently next time</strong>: Book a room over the weekend when the hotel restaurant and bar are both open for service.</p>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1f2225aee6a822c9029ff4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hotel Reviews Banner COVID 19 policies\" height=\"418\" width=\"3335\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">BI</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>During my stay, all the staff I saw were wearing masks at all times, including the lobby staff as they stood outside the main entrance on the street. Cleaning standards were seemingly adhered to, and I was generally impressed by the levels of responsibility being maintained in accordance with the company's stated aims.</p><p>A full list of the COVID-19 protocols for <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Loews Hotels</a> can be found online <a href=\"https://cdn.loewshotels.com/loewshotels.com-2466770763/cms/pressroom/lh_safetyprotocols_71820.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.</p><p><strong>In summary:</strong></p><ul><li>Upon arrival, all guests will be asked to have a face covering/mask on, prior to entering the hotel.</li><li>Everyday cleaning standards include cleaning guestrooms, meeting rooms, outlets, corridors, and public areas with a Peroxide Multi Surface Cleaner and Disinfectant, an EPA approved product effective against emerging viral pathogens and COVID-19, including the frequent cleaning of \"high touch areas\" such as telephones, remote controls, door handles, light switches, elevators, and tabletops.</li><li>High alcohol content hand sanitizer stations have been added to front desks, spas, fitness centers, elevator landings, meeting rooms, and other high traffic guest areas.</li><li>The hotel limits the number of passengers for each elevator ride. Face coverings/masks are required in elevators. The elevator buttons and handrails are disinfected every hour and we have also added hand sanitizer stations on all landings throughout the hotel.</li></ul><p><strong>Contactless Experiences:</strong></p><ul><li>Chat Your Service is a hotelwide texting service that allows guests to send a text from their own personal phone to order make requests or ask for recommendations.</li><li>Guests may download the Sonifi app to their smartphones to turn the television on and off as well as change the channel.</li><li>With housekeeping services being limited, the hotel can provide fresh linens and towels, dropped in a sealed bag right at the guest room door.</li><li>When and wherever possible the hotel will leave previously occupied guestrooms vacant for 24 hours, before thoroughly cleaning and checking in a new guest.</li></ul>\n\t\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e275a2fe0e1441cde3c4892?format=jpeg\" alt=\"7 Hotel Reviews Banner Bottom Line\" height=\"151\" width=\"1201\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>My booking automatically took place within the hotel's 'Park, Play and Extend Your Stay' promotion, and as such as I was looking forward to taking advantage of the $25 food and beverage credit, especially having enjoyed the hotel's restaurant on previous occasions. However, I wish its limited availability had been disclosed at the time of booking for better transparency. Thankfully, the on-site staff were more than helpful and applying that credit to my room rate was a very acceptable, and welcome compromise.</p><p>It's strange to stay in a New Orleans hotel and not experience a cocktail or a bowl of gumbo, but given the circumstances, understandable, and weekend guests may still enjoy that experience.</p><p>In terms of other hotel amenities, I thought the <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Loews New Orleans Hotel</a> did a good job of balancing availability with public health measures, and the pool and exercise room are among the city's best.</p><p>The low level of occupancy didn't put any kind of strain on the hotel's protocols, but should the crowds return, I felt they were well equipped with sanitizer stations and clear directions around the lobby and beyond.</p><p>My room was also similarly reassuring in terms of cleanliness, not to mention spacious, comfortable, and came with great views.&#160;</p><p>The rates during this promotional period offer very good value, even aside from the credit I received, especially if you plan to drive yourself or want the space of a junior suite without the price tag. Fans of modern design and an elevated stay in a great location would definitely do well to consider this hotel.</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=7745&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.loewshotels.com%2Fnew-orleans\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Book a room at the Loews Hotel New Orleans starting at $119 per night</a></h2>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
