10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"Dow rises 112 points as retail-sales blowout helps snap 3-day skid","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-news-today-indexes-rally-retail-sales-stimulus-deadlock-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ee11d260780019341eca?format=jpeg\" alt=\"happy trader\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mario Tama/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>US stocks jumped on Friday as investors cheered a better-than-expected reading of September retail sales.</strong></li><li><strong>American retail spending climbed 1.9% last month, more than double economist estimates. The reading marked the gauge's fifth straight increase and a sharp bounce from August's 0.6% gain.</strong></li><li><strong>The encouraging economic data offset dwindling odds of a preelection stimulus deal. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said Thursday that he <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcconnell-stimulus-package-coronavirus-relief-compromise-white-house-democrats-2020-10\">planned to bring only Senate Republicans' smaller package to a vote</a>, quashing hopes for Democrats' larger proposal.</strong></li><li><strong>Oil futures pared losses through the day but failed to settle in positive territory. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> fell as much as 2.2%, to $40.08 per barrel.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/indices\">Watch major indexes update live here</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>US equities climbed on Friday after an advance reading of September retail sales showed stronger-than-expected growth.</p><p>American retail spending <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-retail-sales-beat-september-estimates-economic-recovery-coronavirus-recession-2020-10\">climbed 1.9% last month</a>, handily surpassing the 0.8% estimate from economists surveyed by Bloomberg. The reading marked the fifth straight increase in retail sales since the gauge cratered in April.</p><p>The Friday report was also an acceleration from August's paltry 0.6% uptick, suggesting the bounce-back in consumer spending has more room to run.</p><p><strong>Here's where US indexes stood at the 4 p.m. ET market close on Friday:</strong></p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S&#38;P 500</a>:</strong> 3,483.81, up 0.01%</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestmp;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dow Jones industrial average</a>:</strong> 28,606.31, up 0.4% (112 points)</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_composite?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestmp;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nasdaq composite</a>:</strong> 11,671.56, down 0.4%</li></ul><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-jim-osman-investing-expert-3-winners-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"7\" data-analytics-module=\"\">200-plus money managers pay thousands to see which stocks are on Jim Osman's buy list. He details 2 he sees doubling and says one has at least 50% left to soar.</a></em></p><p>Elsewhere on the economic data front, consumer sentiment climbed in a preliminary October reading. The University of Michigan's <a href=\"http://www.sca.isr.umich.edu\">sentiment index</a> rose to 81.2 from 80.4, buoyed by improving expectations for economic growth. Economists expected a reading of 80.5.</p><p>The encouraging reports offset gloomy updates on stimulus negotiations. The White House crept closer to a deal with Democrats on Thursday, with Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin saying the administration was willing to accept funding for increased COVID-19 testing.</p><p>But Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said on Thursday afternoon that he <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcconnell-stimulus-package-coronavirus-relief-compromise-white-house-democrats-2020-10\">planned to bring only a smaller bill to a vote</a>, quashing hopes for a package of $1.8 trillion to $2.2 trillion sought by the White House and Democrats.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/long-term-stock-picks-recommendations-investing-strategy-parnassus-lori-keith-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Lori Keith's mutual fund has grown 98,000% in 12 years by focusing on unflashy companies. She told us about 7 such stocks that thrived in the recession — and will likely do even better in the recovery.</a></em></p><p>Mnuchin indicated that President Donald Trump might approach McConnell to push for a larger deal, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Drew_Hammill/status/1316849926953988096?s=20\">deputy chief of staff said</a>. With Election Day on the horizon, investors remain sensitive to any hint of stimulus progress.</p><p>\"As the prospects of an immediate fiscal relief package dim, the risk is growing that declining income and reduced savings buffers will constrain household spending in coming months, especially among the most vulnerable tranches of the population,\" Gregory Daco, chief US economist at Oxford Economics, said in a note.</p><p>Health care and utilities stocks outperformed the broad market rally. Energy stocks fared the worst of the S&#38;P 500's 11 sectors.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/hertz-stock-price-lines-up-billion-potential-financing-bankruptcy-rental-2020-10-1029688370\">Hertz surged</a> after lining up $1.65 billion in potential financing. The beleaguered car-rental giant has seen its shares trade with outsized volatility through the year amid strong retail-trader interest and bankruptcy risk.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/nikola-stock-price-plan-work-without-gm-deal-falls-apart-2020-10-1029689351\">Nikola plunged</a> after its CEO said the truck manufacturer has plans to continue operations on its own should its partnership with General Motors fall through. Negotiations between the two companies are ongoing, though they face a December 3 deadline to ink a deal.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-21-potential-future-index-leaders-goldman-sachs-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">GOLDMAN SACHS: Buy these 21 high-growth stocks that have huge upside potential as future index leaders</a></em></p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/pfe-stock\">Pfizer</a> jumped after announcing that it would pursue emergency authorization for its coronavirus vaccine candidate as early as next month. The update suggested that a vaccine could be approved before 2021.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/ba-stock\">Boeing</a> shares gained after European regulators deemed its 737 Max model safe.</p><p>Spot <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/gold-price\">gold</a> flirted with its $1,900-per-ounce support level throughout the session after climbing as high as $1,914.06. Treasury yields gained, and the US dollar fell slightly against a basket of major currencies.</p><p>Oil futures retraced some early losses but still settled down for the day. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> fell as much as 2.2%, to $40.08 per barrel. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestarkets&#38;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brent crude</a>, oil's international benchmark, fell 2.1%, to $42.27 per barrel, at intraday highs.</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-investing-strategy-inflation-spike-hedge-protection-jim-paulsen-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">A Wall Street chief strategist shares the best defense against a much-feared spike in inflation — and explains why it's a better option than 7 more traditional hedges</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a 2020 20:06:37 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f89ee1ad260780019341ecc?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5607db8d562460ef5b4aeaf0b0969548","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn17@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-20-181_61ca311263e787ae.webp","destWidth":2971,"destHeight":2228,"sourceBytes":376730,"destBytes":376730,"author":"bwinck@businessinsider.com (Ben Winck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f89ee11d260780019341eca?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn64@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-24-704_0a66a114ee624058.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=A24OrHAtqUc:UurF5Pr76nI:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn68@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-15-026_ce04c400e47c1eee.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=A24OrHAtqUc:UurF5Pr76nI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn96@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-20-813_7df1c0278680ec52.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=A24OrHAtqUc:UurF5Pr76nI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn36@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-15-698_09af7ccd96bf4f43.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/A24OrHAtqUc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn40@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-23-001_75e2530137c1d073.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799710},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"EV maker Fisker just debuted its $37,499 all-electric 'Ocean' SUV coming 2022 which claims will be the 'world's most sustainable vehicle'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/fisker-debuts-all-electric-suv-ocean-with-a-solar-roof-2020-1","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e1363e0855cc24239035532?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean SUV\" height=\"1234\" width=\"1645\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>American automaker Fisker has debuted its all-electric SUV 'Ocean' with a solar roof for $37,499 &#8212;&#160;considerably cheaper than <a href=\"https://www.tesla.com/modelx/design#battery\">Tesla's Model X SUV which goes for $84,990</a>.</li>\n<li>The interior of the vehicle will be fully vegan and made of mostly recycled materials, including abandoned fish nets, plastic bottles, and T-shirts.</li>\n<li>The car will be closely tied with the Fisker app and will allow drivers to pay for their vehicle, book service appointments, and potentially set up rideshares and carpooling in the future.</li>\n<li>On October 15, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fisker-deal-with-magna-take-a-stake-in-the-electric-car-startup\">Fisker announced that </a>Magna International, a global contract automaker, would take a 6% stake in the electric vehicle startup and help Fisker manufacture the Ocean SUV.</li>\n<li>Fisker will begin producing the Ocean in 2022.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>American startup automaker Fisker has debuted its all-electric SUV, Ocean, which comes with a solar roof.</p><p>The Ocean SUV will go for $37,499 — cheaper than <a href=\"https://www.tesla.com/modelx/design#battery\">Tesla's $74,190 Model X SUV</a> and $49,990 Model Y SUV.</p><p>Ocean — which the automaker claims is the \"world's most sustainable vehicle\" — was unveiled at the 2020 Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas in January.. The car starts at $37,499 but drops to $29,999 after US federal tax credit, according to Fisker, and can now be reserved with a $250 deposit.</p><p>The Ocean sets itself apart from other electric vehicles currently available in the rapidly expanding market with its solar roof, varying \"modes\", and emphasis on sustainability.</p><p>Fisker's CEO Henrik Fisker also said in a statement that the company will be the world's first \"all-digital car company.\" The Ocean will be synced to an app that will allow its owners to manage actions such as car payments and maintenance schedules, and in the future, <a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/fisker-ocean-reservations-open-convenient-mobile-app-affordable-pricing-and-all-digital-experience-unveiled-300965984.html\">Fisker plans on integrating options</a> such as carpooling and ride-hailing onto the app.</p><p>On October 15 — less than a year after the Ocean's debut — <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fisker-deal-with-magna-take-a-stake-in-the-electric-car-startup\">Fisker announced that </a>Magna International, a global contract automaker, would take a 6% stake in the electric vehicle startup and help Fisker manufacture the Ocean in Europe. The new automaker will then use Magna's \"lightweight aluminum intensive 'FM29'\" platform for the Ocean SUV and any future releases.</p><p>This 6% will be equivalent to about $180 million when <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/spartan-energy-stock-price-after-spac-merger-fisker-electric-vehicle-2020-7-1029388615\">Fisker completes its $2.9 billion reverse merger</a>&#160;with Spartan Energy Acquisition at the end of this month.</p><p>\"The big news here is that Magna has skin in the game,\" <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fisker-deal-with-magna-take-a-stake-in-the-electric-car-startup\">Fisker told Business Insider in an interview with Matthew DeBord</a>. \"Magna understands the whole value chain, from the start of engineering to production.\"</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t\"Our mission is to become the [number one] e-mobility service provider on Earth, featuring the world's most desirable and sustainable vehicles while shaking up the old automotive industry model – from the way a customer attains a vehicle, chooses affordable insurance, services a vehicle to the overall mobility experience,\" Fisker said in a statement.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88bb0f9e9fe40019009a6b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"fisker ocean interior.\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/in/news-releases/fisker-ocean-reservations-open-convenient-mobile-app-affordable-pricing-and-all-digital-experience-unveiled-825624510.html#:~:text=1%20e%2Dmobility%20service%20provider,Henrik%20Fisker%2C%20chairman%20and%20CEO\">Fisker</a></em></p>\n\tThe Ocean has multiple components that are optimized to be environmentally friendly.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88bb15d260780019341b8e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"fisker ocean interior.\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis in part allows the automaker to meet chemical emission limits for different volatile organic compounds (VOCs).\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5c69e9fe40019009a17?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd unlike many cars currently available on the market, the Ocean will have a fully vegan interior with parts made of recycled products.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88bb1ad260780019341b8f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"fisker ocean interior.\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis includes the carpeting, which will be made from recycled nylon created from fishing net waste found in the ocean ...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5cbd260780019341b3b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean\" height=\"1874\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t... and the eco-suede, which will be made of recycled plastic, bottles, and polyester fibers from items like T-shirts.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5abd260780019341b38?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe automaker also repurposes and uses its extra rubber waste from tire manufacturing.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5bcd260780019341b39?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean SUV\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tUsing recycled materials will allow the company to reduce its emissions by 80%, according to the automaker.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5d0d260780019341b3c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\"Eco-sustainability, as well as the lowest levels of polluting emissions and energy consumption, are guaranteed throughout the whole production cycle,\" Fisker says.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5fbd260780019341b3f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean SUV\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn line with the general uniqueness of the electric SUV, the Ocean will also have different \"modes\" not found in any other vehicles.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5819e9fe40019009a13?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean\" height=\"1904\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis includes a karaoke feature that syncs the display with the Fisker Flexee app, and a California mode that lowers nine glass windows and panels — including the rear quarter windows — with one button.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5f29e9fe40019009a1c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean SUV\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe automaker says the latter mode creates \"an open-air feeling, while still maintaining a full 'roll cage' safety structure around the passengers.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5de9e9fe40019009a1a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean SUV\" height=\"1019\" width=\"1358\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe electric SUV will also be topped with a full-length solar roof that provides 1,000 miles of power in one year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5ed9e9fe40019009a1b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean SUV\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis solar roof will provide energy to the electric power source and increase the vehicle's efficiency while decreasing its charging needs.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5e3d260780019341b3d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean SUV\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFisker also partnered with Electrify America —  which owns one of the largest networks of electric vehicle charging stations in the US — to make charging the Ocean on-the-go more accessible.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88c3879e9fe40019009a89?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean SUV\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tProduction of the Ocean is set to begin at the end of 2021 with deliveries beginning in 2022.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b601d260780019341b40?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean SUV\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe automaker will also pick up and return vehicles when it needs maintenance so customers don't have to bring it in to service.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b5d49e9fe40019009a19?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fisker Ocean\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2221\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFisker projects over one million vehicles will be made from 2022 to 2027.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f88b62f9e9fe40019009a1f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Fisker Ocean.\" height=\"1874\" width=\"2499\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Fisker Ocean.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.fiskerinc.com/media/\" target=\"_blank\">Fisker</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div e40019009a1a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn79@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-26-181_c5e1141388456fc6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f88b5ed9e9fe40019009a1b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn20@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-19-937_32ddd1becfa55726.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f88b5e3d260780019341b3d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn7@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-16-611_170494d95c9dc23a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f88c3879e9fe40019009a89?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn31@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-21-575_9a4bb25d9a81b7b0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f88b601d260780019341b40?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn23@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-21-643_45189b68fd4dc9db.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f88b5d49e9fe40019009a19?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn64@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-25-444_0b7047ed3e92a762.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f88b62f9e9fe40019009a1f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn71@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-21-102_a671fd439034a89a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=spPMjF-Mfzg:fIOR_28MzAw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn55@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-24-685_9bc42bc93d13e05e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=spPMjF-Mfzg:fIOR_28MzAw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn8@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-28-735_983e52f3201ff9fe.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=spPMjF-Mfzg:fIOR_28MzAw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn4@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-22-108_624c03566a3b1219.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/spPMjF-Mfzg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn52@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-24-738_19ad72d0e3b7bc0e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799687},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"Nikola sheds 15% after CEO says it has plan to work without GM if deal falls apart","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/nikola-stock-price-plan-work-without-gm-deal-falls-apart-2020-10","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c55ad260780019341da1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Nikola Badger Electric Pickup Truck1\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption> \n   <p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://nikolamotor.com/press_releases/nikola-unveils-the-nikola-badger-pickup-73\" target=\"_blank\">Nikola</a></p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul>\n <li><strong>Nikola fell on Friday after its CEO <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-16/nikola-ceo-says-startup-s-plans-intact-even-if-gm-deal-unravels?srnd=premium&amp;sref=VeWHXK2UXK2U\">told Bloomberg on Thursday</a> that it had plans to work on its own if a deal with General Motors falls apart.</strong></li>\n <li><strong>Talks between the companies are ongoing, with a December 3 deadline to reach a deal.</strong></li>\n <li><strong>Nikola CEO Mark Russell said the company needed an OEM partner to manufacture its Badger electric-pickup-truck prototype and would abandon the car if it can't find one.</strong></li>\n <li><strong>Shares of Nikola have been in a tailspin since Hindenburg Research released a report in September accusing the company of deception, fraud, and misleading investors.</strong></li>\n <li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/international?r=US&amp;IR=T?utm_source=markets&amp;utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&amp;utm_medium=ingestedium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul>\n<hr>\n <p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/nkla-stock\">Nikola</a> extended its monthlong decline on Friday after its CEO, Mark Russell, <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-16/nikola-ceo-says-startup-s-plans-intact-even-if-gm-deal-unravels?srnd=premium&amp;sref=VeWHXK2UXK2U\">told Bloomberg</a> that the electric-vehicle startup would work alone if a deal with <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/gm-stock\">General Motors</a> falls apart.</p>\n <p>Shares fell as much as 15% on Friday. They're down more than 50% since <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/nikola-stock-price-short-seller-report-alleges-years-deception-hindenburg-2020-9-1029579021#\">Hindenburg Research released a short-seller report</a> on September 10 accusing the company of fraud, deception, and misleading investors.</p>\n <p>That report came two days after Nikola <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/nikola-stock-price-gm-strikes-manufacturing-partnership-badger-general-motors-2020-9-1029569699#\">announced a partnership with GM worth $2 billion</a>. Talks are ongoing, with a December 3 deadline to close a deal.</p>\n <p>Under the proposed deal, GM would be tasked with manufacturing Nikola's electric pickup truck, the Badger. But Russell said the company was prepared to abandon the Badger if it can't strike a deal with an original equipment manufacturer.</p>\n <p>\"The Badger is part of our discussions with GM. And we've been clear all along that we wouldn't build a Badger without an OEM partner,\" Russell told Bloomberg in an interview on Thursday.</p>\n <p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-21-potential-future-index-leaders-goldman-sachs-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">GOLDMAN SACHS: Buy these 21 high-growth stocks that have huge upside potential as future index leaders</a></em></p>\n <p>But Russell said Nikola had a \"base plan\" if the deal with GM is off. \"If we have a partner,\" he added, \"that just enables us to consider going faster and helps reduce the risk.\"</p>\n <p>A deal with GM is still possible. Bloomberg said GM could seek an increased stake in Nikola given its depressed valuation since the deal was announced last month. Another option would be for GM to receive warrants on Nikola.</p>\n <p>Regarding Nikola's hydrogen-fueling-station ambitions, Russell said Nikola was still targeting a deal with an energy company by the end of the year. Bloomberg reported last month that Nikola had held talks with BP, but those were put on hold after the Hindenburg report, which <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/nikola-stock-price-founder-trevor-milton-leaves-executive-chairman-hindenburg-2020-9-1029606958#\">led to the resignation of Trevor Milton</a>, Nikola's founder.</p>\n <p>If no deal is reached, Russell said, Nikola plans to develop hydrogen-refueling stations on its own.</p>\n <p><em>Do you work at GM or Nikola? Contact us at <a href=\"mailto:ijibilian@businessinsider.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">ijibilian@businessinsider.com</a>, or via the secure messaging app Signal at 917-727-6830.</em></p>\n <p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-investing-championship-trent-mcgraw-shares-secrets-to-huge-returns-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">US Investing Championship contender Trent McGraw hauled in a 104.3% return in just 8 months. He shares his two favorite trading setups that've led to his king-size returns.</a></em></p>\n <figure> \n  <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ce35d260780019341ddd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nkla cha.JPG\" 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"'The Mandalorian' returns to Disney Plus with new episodes on October 30 — here's how to watch the exclusive 'Star Wars' series","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-the-mandalorian","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4fc2337ed0ee001e25d032?format=jpeg\" alt=\"the mandalorian s2 date announce tall 038587373654\" height=\"864\" width=\"1536\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Disney</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>The second season of \"The Mandalorian\" will debut on <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/c/196318/564546/9358?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.disneyplus.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Disney Plus</a> on October 30.</li><li>\"The Mandalorian\" is an original \"Star Wars\" series set after the events of \"Return of the Jedi,\" and the show's first season was one of the most watched series of 2019.</li><li>Rosario Dawson will reportedly join the cast as a Jedi Knight in season two, while Temuera Morrison will reprise his role as Boba Fett.</li><li><a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/c/196318/564546/9358?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.disneyplus.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Disney Plus</a> costs $6.99 per month or $69.99 per year; it's available in a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-bundle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">bundle with Hulu and ESPN+ for $12.99 per month</a>.</li><li>For detail impressions on Disney Plus, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">read our full Disney Plus review here</a>.</li></ul><div id=\"ProductCard_5dc5bb627eece5443d2df8b9\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5dc5bb627eece5443d2df8b9&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e38a0505bc79c55442b3598\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e38a0505bc79c55442b3598&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Season two of \"The Mandalorian\" is set to debut on Disney Plus on October 30.</p><p>The first season of \"The Mandalorian\" was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-mandalorian-disney-plus-is-top-tv-show-in-world-2019-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the most watched show in the world</a> during its eight episode run and recently <a href=\"https://www.starwars.com/news/the-mandalorian-emmy-awards\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">earned seven Emmy awards including Outstanding Special Visual Effects.</a> Pedro Pascal will return as the titular Mandalorian, a space-fighting bounty hunter tasked with protecting a small child whose special abilities could bring hope to the galaxy.</p><p>\"The Mandalorian\" has been praised for its tight, self-contained episodes and regularly evokes the spirit of classic Western and samurai genre films despite its sci-fi setting. As a nameless warrior, the Mandalorian uses his skills to earn a living, encountering new threats in each episode and constantly defending The Child from the evil forces of the Empire.</p><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/7fUNPLWkykI\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p><a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/star-wars-mandalorian-movie-pedro-pascal-jon-favreau-1234805417/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Executive Producer Jon Favreau told Variety</a> that \"The Mandalorian\" has already been renewed for a third season, with production for season 3 scheduled to start before the end of the year. Former Disney <a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/disneys-bob-iger-teases-mandalorian-falcon-winter-soldier-wandavision-dates-1276326\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">CEO Bob Iger also said that more \"Star Wars\" series</a> could be coming to Disney Plus based on characters from \"The Mandalorian\" during an earnings call in February.</p><p>Few details about season two of \"The Mandalorian\" have been revealed, but <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/rosario-dawson-ahsoka-tano-the-mandalorian-season-2-1203540472/#:~:text=Rosario%20Dawson%20has%20joined%20season,Ahsoka%20Tano%2C%20Variety%20has%20confirmed.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Rosario Dawson will reportedly join the series as Ahsoka Tano</a>, a Jedi introduced in \"Star Wars: The Clone Wars,\" and Temuera Morrison will <a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/mandalorian-finds-boba-fett-temuera-morrison-1293675\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">join the series as Boba Fett,</a> the iconic bounty hunter who first introduced the Mandalorian armor to the \"Star Wars\" franchise in the 1978 \"Star Wars Holiday Special.\"</p><p><em>Updated on 10/16/2020 by Kevin Webb: Added the latest trailer for season two of \"The Mandalorian,\" and details on the show's Emmy Awards.</em></p><h2>How to watch 'The Mandalorian' on Disney Plus</h2><p>To watch \"The Mandalorian\" you'll need a <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/c/196318/564546/9358?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.disneyplus.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Disney Plus</a> subscription. The service costs $6.99 a month or $69.99 a year. Season two will premiere on October 30, and all eight episodes of the show's first season are available to stream right now.</p><p>Unlike the popular exclusives on streaming services like Netflix, new episodes of \"The Mandalorian\" are released on a weekly schedule. Fans looking to binge watch season two of \"The Mandalorian\" will need to wait a few weeks after the season premiere for all the episodes to be available on <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/c/196318/564546/9358?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.disneyplus.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Disney Plus</a>.</p><p>You can find the Disney Plus app on iOS, Android, PlayStation, Xbox, and most smart TV and streaming player brands. You can also access the service through the <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/c/196318/564546/9358?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.disneyplus.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Disney Plus website</a> to watch online. Disney Plus has some of the best quality options of any streaming service, with support for up to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-hdr-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">4K HDR video</a> with Dolby Vision and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-dolby-atmos\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dolby Atmos</a>. You can also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-app\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">download movies and shows</a> from Disney Plus to watch offline later.&#160;</p><p>If you're looking to fill your \"Star Wars\" fix before season two of \"The Mandalorian\" arrives on October 30, be sure to check out our <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/star-wars-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">full breakdown of all the \"Star Wars\" offerings</a> on Disney Plus, and our list of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ranked-the-10-best-star-wars-video-games-2019-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the top \"Star Wars\" video games.</a></p><h2>When does 'The Mandalorian' take place?</h2><p>\"The Mandalorian\" is set five years after the fall of the Empire in \"Star Wars: Return of the Jedi.\" This puts the show's timeline about 25 years before the events of \"Star Wars: The Force Awakens.\"&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-star-wars\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">You can check out the full chronology of the \"Star Wars\" film series here</a>.</p><h2>How many episodes of 'The Mandalorian' are there?</h2><p>The second season of \"The Mandalorian\" will feature eight episodes, which is the same number as season one.</p><p>A behind-the-scenes documentary series for \"The Mandalorian\" is also available on Disney Plus. The show, called \"Disney Gallery: The Mandalorian,\" is available now and includes eight episodes.</p><h2>What other movies and shows can I watch on Disney Plus?</h2><p><a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/c/196318/564546/9358?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.disneyplus.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Disney Plus</a> is an on-demand subscription service that gives you access to thousands of hours worth of \"Star Wars,\" \"Marvel,\" and \"Disney\" movies and shows for $6.99 per month or $69.99 per year.</p><p>In addition to a huge library that includes almost every \"Star Wars\" movie and show, Disney Plus is also producing a collection of exclusive series to go alongside \"The Mandalorian,\" like the \"The Right Stuff,\" and Marvel's upcoming series \"Loki,\" \"The Falcon and the Winter Solider,\" and \"WandaVision.\"</p><p>You can check out a detailed roundup of all the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-shows-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Disney Plus exclusive shows here</a>, and a full breakdown of all the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-movies-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">exclusive Disney Plus movies here</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on 2020 20:32:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5eb5a3d4e3c3fb7acf26cc77?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0c13991026484856cb1cfd21c05bbb1a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn93@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-17-229_595ef5eddc51c537.webp","destWidth":1067,"destHeight":800,"sourceBytes":50770,"destBytes":50770,"author":"kwebb@businessinsider.com (Kevin Webb)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4fc2337ed0ee001e25d032?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn43@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-28-221_c5e8752c63cba81f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JoGj4AuRWic:REpVBEAImq0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn8@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-15-262_1849348895f1e712.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JoGj4AuRWic:REpVBEAImq0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn83@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-26-276_de547afa0ea7d4e8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JoGj4AuRWic:REpVBEAImq0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn95@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-22-982_3428ae84a08c4506.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/JoGj4AuRWic":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn95@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-15-085_aea9b32997ce3bb4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799697},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"Trump's campaign team doesn't see a path to victory without North Carolina, and they're not entirely wrong","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-needs-to-win-in-north-carolina-or-else-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f2b09e9fe40019009dc6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump hosts north carolina event\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Trump speaks at a Make America Great event in North Carolina.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Peter Zay/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>During a week of Supreme Court hearings and town halls, both presidential candidates spent time in North Carolina to win over undecided voters.</li>\n<li>The state holds 15 seats in the electoral college.</li>\n<li>In the 2016 presidential election, President Donald Trump defeated Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton by 3.7 percentage points.</li>\n<li>This year, however, former Vice President Joe Biden is leading Trump by 4 percentage points among likely voters, according to recent polling.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Amidst a tumultuous week of Supreme Court hearings and dueling town halls, both President Donald Trump and former Vice President Mike Pence made sure to set aside time to campaign in North Carolina.</p><p>Per a recent <a href=\"https://www.axios.com/trump-advisers-brace-for-loss-02d6b688-4d15-46f8-a28c-efdf2a5640c3.html\">report from Axios</a>, the Trump administration is looking at three main pathways for a second term in the White House. Each of the three paths is contingent upon Trump winning the Tar Heel State.&#160;</p><p>According to election simulations from Decision Desk HQ, there are scenarios where Trump can win on Nov. 3 without North Carolina's support. However, picking up North Carolina is one of the easiest ways for Trump to get four more years.</p><p>In DDHQ simulations, only 17% of instances where Trump wins a second term in office are accompanied by a loss in North Carolina. Biden is much less reliant upon the state: Simulations show he wins the presidency 32% of the time even without the state's 15 electoral votes.</p><p>North Carolina voted for a Republican candidate in 10 of the last 12 presidential elections. The most recent time the state voted for a Democratic presidential candidate was in 2008 for President Barack Obama. In 2016, it was close, with&#160; Trump edging out Hillary Clinton by 3.7 percentage points, <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/0/d/1zxyOQDjNOJS_UkzerorUCf2OAdcMcIQEwRciKuYBIZ4/pubhtml/sheet?headers=false&gid=6587268026802\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"c3ef407b6d7b42cb43c23d60804253cd\">according to Ballotpedia</a>.</p><p>\"Even if Trump loses North Carolina, if he can hold on to some other pivotal states in the electoral college — especially Florida and Pennsylvania — he can still manage a narrow win,\" Kiel Williams, author at DDHQ, said about the 2020 election.</p><p>Williams noted that while Trump could win without the state, losing North Carolina would bode poorly for the Trump campaign on election night. Losing there would mean that Trump likely didn't deliver in other battleground states either.&#160;</p><p>\"If Biden is winning in an environment like North Carolina, he is likely winning on terrain like Pennsylvania as well,\" Williams added.</p><section data-track-content=\"\" data-post-type=\"post\"><p><a href=\"https://forecast.decisiondeskhq.com/president/P2020NC\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"b48dbfb065cca85c0c5b716a5d1da45e\">Forecasting</a> from DDHQ shows Biden has a 61% chance of winning North Carolina. Recent polling from October 9 to October 13 by the <a href=\"https://int.nyt.com/data/documenttools/nc100920-crosstabs/3bf558d7ca17e9de/full.pdf\">New York Times and Siena College</a> shows Biden leading Trump by 4 percentage points among likely voters in the state.&#160;</p></section><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-needs-to-win-in-north-carolina-or-else-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eu4-mNVzfoc:tzAj8YCW24g:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eu4-mNVzfoc:tzAj8YCW24g:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/eu4-mNVzfoc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 21:39:52 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8a098ad260780019341f8d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0b544f165888cfb2b32b0d06a2ad6362","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn37@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-13-728_b1f312d6a8a8ac25.webp","destWidth":2000,"destHeight":1500,"sourceBytes":95588,"destBytes":95588,"author":"mhall@businessinsider.com (Madison Hall)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f89f2b09e9fe40019009dc6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn80@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-27-671_0736c8f7b8bd7bbf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eu4-mNVzfoc:tzAj8YCW24g:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn7@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-22-316_8ff56796a174590b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eu4-mNVzfoc:tzAj8YCW24g:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn43@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-15-008_f8183112552ccde5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eu4-mNVzfoc:tzAj8YCW24g:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn32@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-19-214_b219e72abe2f0b5d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/eu4-mNVzfoc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn92@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-23-438_9d68b0ac75c3fd84.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799719},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"The US has entered its 3rd — and possibly largest — wave of coronavirus cases. Experts say states should 'pull back.'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-third-wave-coronavirus-cases-hospitalizations-surge-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1af2991918241aa070f563?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coronavirus testing florida cases deaths surge \" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Medical workers in Florida test a person for the coronavirus on July 22.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Joe Raedle/Getty Images)</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The US has entered its third wave of coronavirus infections. New cases are spiking in the Midwest.</li>\n<li>Public-health experts worry this wave could be the largest, and perhaps deadliest, yet.</li>\n<li>A surge in cases and hospitalizations was expected, they added, since lockdowns have lifted, people are spending more time indoors, and \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/europes-spike-coronavirus-cases-relaxing-lockdown-pandemic-fatigue-2020-10\">pandemic fatigue</a>\" has set in.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Seventeen US states have reported more new coronavirus cases in the past week than in any week prior. The country's seven-day average of new cases has risen about 25% since October 1, with the number of new cases <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/10/15/us/coronavirus-cases-us-surge.html\">climbing in 41 states</a> over the past two weeks. The US is now seeing an average of more than 50,000 cases per day.</p><p>\"I'm not a doomsday person: but this is the beginning of the wave,\" Dr. Megan Ranney, an emergency-medicine physician at Brown University, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/meganranney/status/1316712211360907265\">wrote Thursday on Twitter</a>.</p><p>Indeed, the US has entered its third major wave of infections — one experts worry could wind up being the largest. The reason, they say, is a combination of factors: Lockdown measures have lifted, more people are spending time indoors as weather gets cold, residents are feeling fatigued by safety measures, and cases never dropped sufficiently.</p><p>\"If the rates never get that low, and basic public-health measures are not universally adopted, and then you bring people indoors to share a meal together, you're kind of putting together the perfect storm,\" Ingrid Katz, an assistant professor at Harvard Medical School, told Business Insider. \"Unfortunately this was completely anticipated.\"</p><p>Indeed, the University of Washington's Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) predicted in August that <a href=\"http://www.healthdata.org/news-release/new-ihme-covid-19-forecasts-see-nearly-300000-deaths-december-1\">more than 20 states would need to reimpose lockdown measures</a> before December, including closing nonessential businesses and reinstating stay-at-home orders. Their model predicted at least 175,000 more people in the US could die from now through February 1. That would make this third wave the deadliest yet.</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"COVID-19 new cases and deaths in the US\" aria-label=\"Interactive line chart\" src=\"//datawrapper.dwcdn.net/eEGoc/2/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"border: none;\" width=\"600\" height=\"525\"></iframe></div><p>\"The infections that will fill our hospital in 2 weeks have already been transmitted,\" Ranney said. \"Wear a mask and get ready to hunker down again.\"</p><h2>Pandemic fatigue has arrived</h2><p>During the first wave in the spring, US cases were concentrated in the Northeast. By the second wave this summer, cases had migrated to the South and Sunbelt. Now cases are concentrated in the Midwest, but the virus is more widespread than ever before — it's had 10 months to spread, after all.</p><p>What remains the same, however, is that the US continues to be hamstrung by insufficient contact tracing and a widespread distrust of scientific recommendations.</p><p>\"We still don't have a national coordinated response. We still have a lot of misinformation about simple, basic public-health behavior, like wearing a mask, which we know is effective,\" Katz said, adding, \"in a way, we're battling two pandemics — that of COVID itself and then, of course, the misinformation that surrounds it.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5efbf69c1918245a2749e1a5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"wisconsin reopening\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jonesy&#39;s Local Bar in Hudson, Wisconsin, on May 14.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jerry Holt/Star Tribune via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>But it's understandable that some Americans are struggling to follow public safety measures, she added, since many people <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/europes-spike-coronavirus-cases-relaxing-lockdown-pandemic-fatigue-2020-10\">have developed \"pandemic fatigue.\"</a> That could make them less likely to remain at home or stay informed about local transmission. As schools and businesses reopen, others may get the false impression that those environments are now completely safe.</p><p>\"We're seeing a roller coaster in the United States,\" IHME Director Dr. Christopher Murray said in a statement. \"It appears that people are wearing masks and socially distancing more frequently as infections increase, then after a while as infections drop, people let their guard down and stop taking these measures to protect themselves and others – which, of course, leads to more infections. And the potentially deadly cycle starts over again.\"&#160;</p><h2>Rising hospitalizations could trigger more lockdowns</h2><p>Though new cases are concentrated in the Midwest, experts said they could quickly spill into other parts of the country.</p><p>At least 14 states have test-positivity rates — the share of coronavirus tests that come back positive — above 10%, according to data from Johns Hopkins University. Dr. Anthony Fauci, the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, has said test-positivity rates should ideally sit below 3%. A rate between 7 and 9% is \"very disturbing,\" Dr. Howard Koh, a professor at the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-coronavirus-cases-deaths-real-scale-estimates-charts-2020-7\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"4e4e1eb7fbbb92496a542cc7d5991736\">previously told Business Insider</a>.</p><p>The US's overall test-positivity rate was at 5.2% on Thursday, a slight uptick from 4.6% on October 1.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f04cb5d1918245bd33242ec?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Texas coronavirus hospital patient covid 19 death \" height=\"2000\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Medical staff push a stretcher with a deceased patient outside the COVID-19 intensive-care unit at United Memorial Medical Center in Houston on June 30.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Go Nakamura/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Coronavirus hospitalizations are on the rise as well. As of Friday, they'd risen by 21% compared with three weeks prior. A dozen states — including Montana, North Dakota, and Wisconsin — have seen record hospitalization rates in the past week, <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/10/15/coronavirus-cases-surging/\">The Washington Post reported Thursday</a>.</p><p>It's difficult to know whether this will translate to a proportional uptick in deaths. Doctors have gotten better at treating patients since the start of the pandemic, and death rates vary depending on the specific population groups that get exposed or infected, but there's still no cure for the virus.</p><p>If hospitals start to become crowded, public-health experts say that could create a need for tighter lockdown restrictions again.&#160;</p><p>\"There's lots of steps you can take between this and a whole quarantine,\" Katz said. \"You can stop doing in-person dining, you can stop having people go to the gym, you can stop having your hot-yoga class. There are all these different ways that we can pull back.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/us-third-wave-coronavirus-cases-hospitalizations-surge-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=NhfoV-XkN8I:dsJ_wOdlx8o:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=NhfoV-XkN8I:dsJ_wOdlx8o:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=NhfoV-XkN8I:dsJ_wOdlx8o:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/NhfoV-XkN8I\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 20:05:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f889620d260780019341a61?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"488b1d61535743af4f252d6e72c12a30","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn28@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-14-334_cc8d8dc3cb1763ab.webp","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":130738,"destBytes":130738,"author":"insider@insider.com (Aria Bendix)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f1af2991918241aa070f563?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn12@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-17-399_bc698d8347a2b3b9.webp","https://i.insider.com/5efbf69c1918245a2749e1a5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn16@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-18-266_45de4a88bbe5bfd3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f04cb5d1918245bd33242ec?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn67@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-28-253_0291d92859369bce.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=NhfoV-XkN8I:dsJ_wOdlx8o:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn88@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-17-130_59dab3be14d7e2fd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=NhfoV-XkN8I:dsJ_wOdlx8o:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn36@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-17-763_c2191e6c0a4c9d35.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=NhfoV-XkN8I:dsJ_wOdlx8o:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn39@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-21-073_a584cfcc41b52bea.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/NhfoV-XkN8I":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn8@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-26-548_141380f1ca158190.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799699},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"'I gave money to your campaign': Trump was frustrated by John McCain after he ignored him at a congressional hearing, new book says","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-john-mccain-casino-mark-salter-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0de59e9fe40019009e70?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Donald Trump Taj Mahal resort casino Atlantic City NJ\" height=\"1496\" width=\"2993\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Donald Trump at his Trump Taj Mahal Casino Resort in Atlantic City, New Jersey, April 5, 1990.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mike Derer/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>One of the earliest interactions between Donald Trump and the late Sen. John McCain came at a congressional hearing in 1993.</li>\n<li>Trump, who owned casinos in Atlantic City, was in Washington, DC, to claim that casinos on Native American reservations were controlled by the mob and avoiding taxes.</li>\n<li>Trump tried to get McCain's attention by saying, \"I gave money to your campaign,\" according to a new book, by a longtime McCain aide.</li>\n<li>McCain yelled in response, \"Oh yeah? See what that will get you.\"</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>One of the earliest interactions between Donald Trump and the late Sen. John McCain of Arizona came during a congressional hearing more than two decades before the real-estate mogul won the presidency, according to a new book written by a longtime McCain confidant.</p><p>Mark Slater, who started working for McCain in 1989, writes in a book published this week, \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Luckiest-Man-Life-John-McCain/dp/1982120932\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\">The Luckiest Man: Life with John McCain</a>,\" that Trump was incensed by McCain's disregard of his presence in Washington DC in the early 1990s.</p><p>Trump, who owned casinos in Atlantic City, was in Washington to claim that casinos operated on Native American reservations were controlled by the mob and getting away with not paying taxes.</p><p>\"The Indians don't have to pay tax,\" Trump said in testimony to a House subcommittee in 1993. \"Nobody's more for the Indians than Donald Trump.\"</p><p>\"You ask about competing. I love to compete ... but I like to compete on an equal footing,\" Trump added. \"I'm competing and paying hundreds of millions of dollars in tax.\"</p><p>McCain was also scheduled to testify at the hearing. McCain, who twice served as chairman of the Senate Indian Affairs Committee, had been an advocate of legislation supporting Native Americans, including the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act of 1988 that allowed tribes to operate casinos on reservations.</p><p>At the hearing, Trump tried to grab McCain's attention, according to Salter's book. McCain, however, pretended not to notice and tried to walk past him quickly.</p><p>Trump shouted at McCain, \"I gave money to your campaign.\"</p><p>McCain yelled back, \"Oh yeah? See what that will get you.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b842e9f2badb91e57771851?format=jpeg\" alt=\"John Mccain\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>John McCain.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/APTOPIX-McCain-2008/0082c8c3684b41be8e5f6710ac2bba98/146/0\" target=\"_blank\">Carolyn Kaster/AP</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Decades after the back-and-forth, Trump still held a grudge against the Republican senator. In 2015, Trump derided McCain's military service, which included being captured and tortured for over five years during the Vietnam War.</p><p>\"He's not a war hero,\" Trump said at the time. \"He was a war hero because he was captured. I like people who weren't captured. OK? I hate to tell you.\"</p><p>According to a September report in <a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/09/trump-americans-who-died-at-war-are-losers-and-suckers/615997/\">The Atlantic</a>, Trump had also complained about McCain after his death in 2018 after a months-long fight with an aggressive form of brain cancer.</p><p>After the late senator was to receive half-staff flag honors, Trump reportedly became angry.</p><p>\"We're not going to support that loser's funeral,\" sources with knowledge of the conversations told The Atlantic. \"What the f--- are we doing that for? Guy was a f---ing loser.\"</p><p>Although Trump and the White House denied he made the remarks, the president had telegraphed his opinion of the late senator to the public.</p><p>\"I don't care about this. I didn't get 'thank you.' That's OK,\" Trump said of McCain and his state memorial service at the US Capitol, during a campaign speech in 2019. \"We sent him on the way, but I wasn't a fan of John McCain.\"</p><p>McCain withdrew his endorsement of then-candidate Trump during the 2016 US presidential election. He frequently criticized Trump during the first year and a half of his presidency, particularly after the president's controversial performance at a summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin in 2018.</p><p>McCain described Trump's remarks at the summit as \"one of the most disgraceful performances by an American president in memory.\"</p><p>McCain also denounced Trump's repeated attacks on the press: \"Trump continues his unrelenting attacks on the integrity of American journalists and news outlets,\" McCain wrote in <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/mr-president-stop-attacking-the-press/2018/01/16/9438c0ac-faf0-11e7-a46b-a3614530bd87_story.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a 2018 op-ed</a>. \"This has provided cover for repressive regimes to follow suit.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-john-mccain-casino-mark-salter-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a (David Choi)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0de59e9fe40019009e70?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn23@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-26-586_74bf947332737b6a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5b842e9f2badb91e57771851?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn60@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-17-915_0cc7a15baa5caefa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7MRecsByD6I:QVFddGcjYow:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn44@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-16-837_168f4890243c2999.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7MRecsByD6I:QVFddGcjYow:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn92@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-17-244_c564f439e82b409d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7MRecsByD6I:QVFddGcjYow:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn20@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-16-634_c0e8517b92b01b43.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/7MRecsByD6I":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn24@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-18-266_580926dcaaecfd39.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799719},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"3 features I wish Apple's new iPhone 12 had that Android phones have had for years","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-iphone-12-launch-missing-features-samsung-galaxy-s20-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f85e24491aa9e001880b4fc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Apple iPhone 12 Event October\" height=\"1462\" width=\"2778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>iPhone 12\n<p class=\"copyright\">Apple</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Apple's iPhone 12 comes with several upgrades like 5G support, a refreshed design, and a camera that's better at taking photos in the dark.</li>\n<li>But there are several useful features found on Android phones that the iPhone still lacks.</li>\n<li>These include a fingerprint sensor and an always-on display.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Apple's iPhone 12, which is available for pre-order starting Friday, brings a number of changes that differentiate it from last year's iPhone 11. These include an updated design, 5G support, improved cameras, and new size options.</p><p>Plus, the iPhone 12 lineup will be compatible with a new line of accessories Apple is launching called MagSafe, which as its name implies uses magnets to quickly and securely attach to the iPhone.</p><p>The addition of 5G and a wider range of sizes and price points certainly gives Apple more leverage to compete with products from Android rivals like Samsung and Google. But there are still a few small but useful features found on Android phones that I had hoped to see on the iPhone 12 lineup.</p><p>Here's a closer look at the top Android features missing from Apple's latest smartphones.&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tA fingerprint sensor for quickly unlocking your phone\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c6d537c0d15f55d816ff975?format=jpeg\" alt=\"in display fingerprint sensor\" height=\"2138\" width=\"3181\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Samsung&#39;s Galaxy S lines have had fingerprint sensors built into their screens since last year.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Antonio Villas-Boas/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>When Apple introduced its new iPad Air, which has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apples-ipad-air-new-touch-id-2020-9\">Touch ID built into the top button</a>, I was hopeful that the company would bring its fingerprint-scanning tech back to the iPhone, too.</p><p>Unfortunately, that wasn't the case with the iPhone 12. Like every modern iPhone with a borderless, edge-to-edge screen, the iPhone 12 lineup only supports Face ID when it comes to biometric authentication.</p><p>At a time when I find myself typing in my passcode more than ever because I'm wearing a mask, it would have been nice to see Apple re-introduce Touch ID to the iPhone.</p><p>Some Android phones like the Samsung Galaxy S20, Galaxy Note 20, and OnePlus 8 Pro offer both fingerprint detection and face unlock. Google's new Pixel 5 also has a fingerprint sensor, although it lacks facial recognition.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tAn always-on display so that you can see the time without picking up your phone\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5efd02102618b96b03618e7d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"TCL 10 Pro Always On Display\" height=\"2751\" width=\"2671\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lisa Eadicicco/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The Apple Watch has had an always-on display since the Series 5 model debuted last year, but we have yet to see this feature on the iPhone.</p><p>Android phones like the Galaxy S20, Galaxy Note 20, and Google Pixel 5 have displays that can show information like the time, date, battery level, and unread notifications even when the display is turned off. That can make it easier to see information at a glance without having to reach for your phone.</p><p>In my experience, having an always-on display has made it easier to check the time or see which app a notification came from without falling down the rabbit hole of scrolling through Instagram or my overflowing email inbox.</p><p>The iPhone 12 may not have an always-on display, but Apple did improve the iPhone's screen in a couple of other ways, such as by making OLED screens standard across all models and improving their durability with a new ceramic shield coating.&#160;</p>\n\tA higher refresh rate for smoother scrolling\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cc07bc5b14bf43f0e79d5f1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ipad pro\" height=\"1929\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>A number of Android phones such as those from Samsung, Google, and OnePlus also have screens that are capable of reaching a higher refresh rate for smoother scrolling.&#160;</p><p>Phones like the Galaxy S20 lineup, Galaxy Note 20 Ultra, and OnePlus 8 Pro can increase their screens' refresh rates up to 120Hz, compared to the 60Hz refresh rate that's considered average on smartphones.&#160;</p><p>The ability to crank up the refresh rate can make navigating the phone's software feel faster, more responsive, and more fluid,&#160; although that <a href=\"https://www.tomsguide.com/news/how-to-change-the-galaxy-s20s-refresh-rate\">can also mean compromising</a> when it comes to resolution.&#160;&#160;</p><p>This feature isn't available on the iPhone, but Apple does offer it elsewhere: on the iPad Pro. Apple's high-end tablet has a feature called ProMotion, which boosts the screen's refresh rate up to 120Hz, a capability that Apple has touted as being ideal for use with the Apple Pencil.&#160;&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
