share the meeting later</a></h3></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-cast-google-meet-video'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ZAASfVqMQaw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 22:18:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f87534aea23a5001903d698?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"1e64a2d8911e53864e39a4e9b76412ff","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn11@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-13-968_d1423d2d7e07da6a.webp","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":107700,"destBytes":107700,"author":"insider@insider.com (Chrissy Montelli)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f875355ea23a5001903d699?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn68@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-18-813_1cec80b22b027b8e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn27@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-17-543_82da84f59a3c497a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn28@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-27-250_eb815a35fe52e04a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ZAASfVqMQaw:1KYhILHLW8Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn36@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-20-946_8e00e4f169b77788.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ZAASfVqMQaw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn76@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-16-067_5ff626520e294240.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799675},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"How to uninstall the Epic Games Launcher from your PC or Mac, along with all of its games","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-uninstall-epic-games-launcher","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0f44d260780019341fab?format=jpeg\" alt=\"epic games fortnite\" height=\"1421\" width=\"2842\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to uninstall the Epic Games Launcher.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chesnot/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can uninstall the Epic Games Launcher from your PC or Mac in just a few moments each.</li>\n<li>To uninstall the Epic Games Launcher from your PC, go to the \"Add or Remove Programs\" section of the Windows Control Panel.&#160;&#160;</li>\n<li>To uninstall the Launcher from your Mac, find its icon in your \"Applications\" folder and move it to the Trash.</li>\n<li>Before you uninstall the Launcher, be sure to fully close it and any games running through it.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>A few years ago, the only game launcher that anyone needed to think about was Steam. Now, between Battle.net, GOG Galaxy, and the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/epic-games\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Epic Games Launcher</a>, it seems like every new game comes with its own program to run it.</p><p>If you've installed the Epic Games Launcher but later decide you don't want or need it, you can uninstall it with just a few clicks.</p><p>Just note that before you uninstall the Epic Games Launcher or any of your games, you should make sure they're fully closed. If you're on a PC, this might involve <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-force-quit-on-pc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ending their processes through the Task Manager.</a></p><h2><strong>How to uninstall the Epic Games Launcher from a PC</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>In the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-search-in-windows-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Start button search box</a>, type \"remove\" and then click \"Add or remove programs\" when it appears in the search results.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0b7b9e9fe40019009e65?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to uninstall Epic Games launcher 3\" height=\"1332\" width=\"2369\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Start &#34;Add or remove programs&#34; from the Windows Control Panel.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>2. </strong>In the list of programs, click \"Epic Games Launcher\" and then click \"Uninstall.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0b9d9e9fe40019009e67?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to uninstall Epic Games launcher 4\" height=\"1296\" width=\"1601\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can uninstall the Epic Games Launcher from the Control Panel.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Wait while Windows uninstalls the program.&#160;</p><p>You've now completely uninstalled the Launcher, along with any games you might have installed using the Launcher.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to uninstall the Epic Games Launcher from a Mac</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>Open the Finder and click \"Applications\" in the left sidebar.</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Find the Epic Games Launcher icon and move it to the Trash. You can do this by dragging the icon to the trashcan in your Dock, or by right-clicking it and selecting \"Move to Trash.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0c6cd260780019341f9f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to uninstall Epic Games launcher 5\" height=\"1699\" width=\"2076\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Uninstall the Epic Games Launcher from your Applications folder.\n<p class=\"copyright\">William Antonelli/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/3v33dQb3bsc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 22:53:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0f1fd260780019341faa?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"6256c1f7963afad911e862d1ccd9886a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn96@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-13-866_bfe7b5e555bec0d1.webp","destWidth":2342,"destHeight":1757,"sourceBytes":183348,"destBytes":183348,"author":"insider@insider.com (Dave Johnson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8a0f44d260780019341fab?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn79@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-26-890_4aa8136d6366e838.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8a0b7b9e9fe40019009e65?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn24@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-16-653_355bfd05b08f65f5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8a0b9d9e9fe40019009e67?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn88@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-23-465_67c2430141622757.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f8a0c6cd260780019341f9f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn35@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-24-617_4d236871bce3693e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3v33dQb3bsc:8JGlujSOHYU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn83@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-24-830_ff19c204167abbd8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3v33dQb3bsc:8JGlujSOHYU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn55@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-28-887_66936c4159527a09.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3v33dQb3bsc:8JGlujSOHYU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn79@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-22-033_69ca80c9a8794981.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/3v33dQb3bsc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-26-881_22984c64869b7061.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799700},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"SCOTT GALLOWAY: Here's why Airbnb is the most valuable private company in America — and why you should expect it to take off at this time next year","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/scott-galloway-why-airbnb-most-valuable-private-firm-in-america-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f7c29e9fe40019009e04?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: A woman talks on the phone at the Airbnb office headquarters in the SOMA district of San Francisco, California, U.S., August 2, 2016.  REUTERS/Gabrielle Lurie\" height=\"2609\" width=\"3479\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Inside the Airbnb office headquarters in the SOMA district of San Francisco.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Scott Galloway is a bestselling author and professor of marketing at NYU Stern.</li>\n<li>The following is his recent blog post and video, republished with permission. It originally ran on his blog, \"<a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"b7607304edf402bcb8ea325f54bfd4f3\">No Mercy / No Malice.\"</a></li>\n<li>In the years since it's founding in 2008, Airbnb has amassed more listings worldwide than major hotel companies like Hyatt, Hilton, and Marriott have combined.</li>\n<li>Airbnb isn't a hotel company or SaaS firm &#8212; it's in a class of its own, Galloway explains, apart from other massive private companies that are overvalued or hurt the public.</li>\n<li>The tech firm's projected 2021 revenues of $5-6 billion could yield a potential $100-120 billion valuation, which Galloway says makes it the most valuable private firm in America today.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>While the entire professional class, and every elected official, all claim to be optimists, I see the world through gray-colored glasses. Vaccine by fall, herd immunity, a robust recovery, markets will continue to surge, AI …&#160;</p><p>Yeah, right.&#160;</p><p>Pessimists are underappreciated, as while optimists built the first plane, pessimists suggested seat belts. Both parties have a role. Neville Chamberlain, Charles Keating, and Bobbi Brown were all likely optimists. But I digress.</p><p>So, being angry and depressed doesn't mean I'm wrong. There are good companies that are overvalued (Tesla, Snowflake), good businesses whose emissions are bad for society (Facebook, Twitter), and firms that are just a menace (Uber). There are also firms that are all three (Palantir). However, occasionally there is a firm that is so gangster even I can't help but see the glass as half empty, versus empty. The most valuable private firm in America is Airbnb.</p><p>I believe this time next year, Airbnb will be the most valuable hospitality firm in the world and one of the world's 10 strongest brands. (Note: Rankings of \"the world's best brands\" are a desperate yelp for relevance from ad agencies begging clients to buy more media and cling to the nineties, the Brand Era.) The SF platform will likely be worth more than the three largest hotel firms, combined. Why?</p><h2><strong>The biggest moat in travel</strong></h2><p>Ride hailing requires local supply (drivers) and demand (hailers). Hotels need local supply (hotel rooms) and regional demand (guests). But a global hotel brand requires both local supply and global demand, as guests are from all over the world. Airbnb has global supply, boasting more than&#160;<a href=\"https://news.airbnb.com/about-us/#:~:text=Airbnb%20is%20one%20of%20the,all%20powered%20by%20local%20hosts.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">seven million</a>&#160;listings worldwide — more than Marriott International, Hilton Worldwide, InterContinental Hotels Group, Wyndham Hotel Group, and Hyatt Hotels, combined. More impressive, and singular, Airbnb is the only hospitality brand that has the global awareness to generate unrivaled demand.&#160;</p><p>In 2021, there will be more Airbnb&#160;<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/346589/number-of-us-airbnb-users/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">users</a> in the US than <a href=\"https://www.opendatanetwork.com/entity/0400000US06/California/demographics.population.count?year=2018\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">people</a>&#160;in California.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f3e09e9fe40019009dcb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway https://www.profgalloway.com/\" height=\"1105\" width=\"1303\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Outside of luxury, which is not relevant/affordable to 90% of travelers, there isn't a truly global brand, until now. Google searches reflect that Airbnb has eclipsed the equity of century-old brands, in one decade, across markets big and small. While competitors may have equity in a specific market, no brand sits on the iron throne across all markets as Airbnb does.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f40a9e9fe40019009dce?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway https://www.profgalloway.com/\" height=\"1647\" width=\"1303\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>This equity also bests that of airlines and online booking engines that may have global awareness (like Qantas) but only regional relevance (i.e., not an option for intracontinental travel in markets outside Australia).&#160;</p><p>So, how to value the gangster of all private gangsters? What is the benchmark and the corresponding multiple? It's clearly not a hotel business, but not a SaaS firm either. However, Airbnb is a tech firm and highly \"disruptive.\" The firm has a greater share of employees with an engineering background than Amazon or Uber.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f423d260780019341ef6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" height=\"1407\" width=\"1304\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>How to value?</strong></h2><p>The only firms I can think of that have global demand/supply and brand equity, and an asset-light high-margin business are the credit card companies, which trade at 20+ multiples of revenue. Airbnb projects 2021 revenues of $5-6 billion, yielding a potential $100-120 billion valuation.&#160;</p><p>In 2020, in the private markets, Airbnb shares have traded at a valuation ranging between $15-30 billion. The media pegs the IPO valuation at $30 billion. Put on your seatbelts, as the bankers will have no excuse to not price the shares at the high end of a recast (higher) range, and then reward their institutional clients with a Snowflake-like flurry when it begins trading. There's something about weather and cruise analogies that becomes more appealing as you get older.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f44e9e9fe40019009dd1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway\" height=\"938\" width=\"1303\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>Ali versus Holmes</strong></h2><p>In 1980, 38-year-old Muhammad Ali returned to the ring to fight a 30-year-old undefeated Larry Holmes. In the pre-fight examination Ali was unable to consistently touch his finger to his nose, had difficulty coordinating the muscles used in speaking, and could not hop on one foot. Boxing pundits describe the medical clearance to fight as criminal. I'm pretty sure the physician who cleared Ali for the fight now serves on the board of Facebook.&#160;</p><p>It's difficult to identify another sector, this large, that has one player more ascendant while the rest of the industry can't touch its nose. The hospitality sector has experienced an unprecedented shock that dwarfs 9/11 or any recession. Recessions, even wars, take occupancy levels down to 60%, or even 50%. No hotel owner or management firm modeled occupancy dropping to 0%. The result is an entire industry on its heels, except for one player that's on its toes, waiting to spring forward with an information-age Super Bowl ad, the Initial Public Offering, and begin firing a howitzer of capital as other firms return fire with squirt guns.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f4759e9fe40019009dd2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway\" height=\"1105\" width=\"1303\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Airbnb is also a better value than hotels, offering more space but with less COVID (no check-in, elevators, or common areas) at a <a href=\"https://www.busbud.com/blog/airbnb-vs-hotel-rates/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">lower</a> cost. A crisis is a terrible thing to waste, and COVID afforded the CEO the cloud cover to cut costs and refocus on the core business. In May, Airbnb laid off a <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/airbnb-to-cut-25-of-workforce-as-coronavirus-stalls-global-travel-11588707183\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">quarter</a>&#160;of its staff (1,900 employees). CEO Chesky managed to pull a Bezos and was seen as a hero for his&#160;<a href=\"https://news.airbnb.com/a-message-from-co-founder-and-ceo-brian-chesky/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">empathetic</a>&#160;approach to layoffs (generous severance, extended healthcare, and a&#160;<a href=\"https://www.airbnb.com/d/talent\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">website</a> of Airbnb employees who were laid off to help them find new leads). Firing people, sending out d--- pics — tomato/tomahto. Chesky and cofounders relinquished their salaries, cut pay in half for executives, and slashed nearly $1 billion in marketing expenses. The firm is in fighting shape.</p><p>The reduced cost structure and market recovery mean the path to profitability has become bigger, better lit, and shorter. There are rumors the firm will accelerate into/through profitability in 2021. The story here won't be one of distant, but burgeoning, profits.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f4cc9e9fe40019009ddb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway\" height=\"1044\" width=\"1303\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>The new story stock</strong></h2><p>The story stock of 2020, where the narrative rode shotgun as the numbers sat quietly in the backseat, was Tesla. Airbnb will not electrify the world, but it will host it and reshape the resources required to let people tap into a basic instinct: to explore with others. What Airbnb lacks in story (unlikely Mr. Chesky can land two Brooklyn studio apartments on dual barges concurrently), it makes up in performance. There is no better vision than performance.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89f4e9d260780019341f08?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Scott Galloway\" height=\"1045\" width=\"1303\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.profgalloway.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Scott Galloway</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>This morning I was on Bloomberg TV discussing SPAC stocks. Despite the echoes of \"It's different this time,\" I believe SPACs are canaries in the digital coal mine and will continue, over the medium- and long-term, to underperform the market (note: this year they have over-performed). My advice, if you want to play SPACs, is to buy a basket, as among the bastards (I'm rewatching all nine seasons of GOT with my son), a dragon will be birthed. Or you could just buy the dragon …&#160; Airbnb.</p><p>Life is so rich,</p><p>Scott</p><p>P.S. On the pod&#160;<a href=\"https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/5g-disney-and-all-things-social-media/id1498802610?i=1000494818704\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">I spoke to Sinan Aral</a> about his new book on social media and how to overcome its negative effects. And … we have a new sprint — Product Strategy, taught by my NYU Stern colleague Professor Adam Alter.&#160;<a href=\"https://register.section4.com/introducing-product-strategy/?utm_source=1016nmnm&utm_medium=blog&utm_campaign=pspaign=ps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Sign up</a>&#160;to join the early access list.</p><p><em><strong>READ MORE:&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nyu-professor-scott-galloway-business-strategy-online-course\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"1cd465ec2f30c2f43346e36b7a80353d\">Popular NYU professor Scott Galloway has a new course on business strategy anyone can sign up to take — I took away MBA-like insights for way less money than going to business school</a></strong></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a -21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=y7jjtjF_Z_g:i2vJhVf9npU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn72@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-18-841_232fa311a8464737.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/y7jjtjF_Z_g":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn4@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-21-377_53c8308e9df04143.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799711},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"The town hall ratings are in, and Trump completely miscalculated by backing out of the debate","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-town-hall-ratings-mistake-by-backing-out-of-debate-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89de25d260780019341e65?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Donald Trump with Savannah Guthrie NBC Trump town hall\" height=\"2153\" width=\"4307\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump sits and speaks with moderator Savannah Guthrie after an NBC News town hall event at the Perez Art Museum in Miami.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brendan Smialowski / AFP via</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Donald Trump dropped out of the second presidential debate after it was switched from in-person to virtual following his positive COVID-19 diagnosis.</li>\n<li>Instead, Trump appeared at a town hall which was hosted by NBC at the same time as Democratic nominee Joe Biden's on ABC News.</li>\n<li>According to Nielsen television ratings first reported by CNN Business, Biden's town hall drew in about one million more viewers than Trump's.</li>\n</ul><p>After testing positive for COVID-19, President Donald Trump announced a new plan: Instead of participating in a virtual second presidential debate against Democratic nominee Joe Biden, Trump would appear at a town hall at the same time as his opponent.</p><p>The move was clearly a&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-skipping-the-second-debate-for-town-hall-is-mistake-2020-10\">risky one</a> for the president and his campaign, and following the publication of Nielsen television ratings by <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/16/media/town-hall-ratings-biden-trump/index.html\">CNN Business,</a> it's obvious that Trump made a mistake by forgoing the second debate.&#160;</p><p>According to CNN, Biden's town hall on ABC drew in 13.9 million viewers. The Trump town hall was broadcast on three channels -- NBC, CNBC, and MSNBC -- and brought in 13 million viewers, or about 1 million fewer than Biden's. These numbers do not take into account online streams for the events, so the final number for both town is likely higher.&#160;</p><p>Before the town halls began, Trump campaign senior advisor Jason Miller predicted, \"We're gonna have a much bigger audience than Joe.\"&#160;</p><p>Miller was wrong, and there may not be enough time to turn the campaign around.</p><p>With 18 days left until election day, Trump trails Biden by 10.5 points, according to a national polling average from <a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/national/\">FiveThirtyEight</a>.</p><p>Trump needed to be seen by as many potential voters as possible on Thursday night. Instead of an audience of over 60 million, the number of people who watched the <a href=\"https://www.nielsen.com/us/en/insights/article/2016/second-presidential-debate-of-2016-draws-66-5-million-viewers/\">second presidential debate</a> in 2016, Trump squandered the opportunity and was seen by just 13 million.</p><p>Following the first presidential debate, Biden gained 5 to 7 percentage points in the battleground states of Pennsylvania and Florida, according to polling from the <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/03/upshot/polls-election-florida-pennsylvania.html\">New York Times and Siena College</a>.</p><p>While Trump can't afford a similar drop in the polls from a second debate this close to election day, now is not the time for the trailing campaign to limit its audience. For Trump to be reelected, he needs to win over any undecided voters, and quickly.</p><p>As of October 16, <a href=\"https://electproject.github.io/Early-Vote-2020G/index.html\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"92235dcf49c8479097fa7c34970cf487\">over 22 million people</a> have already cast their votes through mail-in and early voting in an election expected to receive the most mailed votes in US history. At this point in 2016, less than a month away from the election, <a href=\"http://www.electproject.org/early_2016\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"87fe344aa09337f91a2aa54ef72f5e18\">only 1.4 million mail-in votes</a>&#160;had been cast. According to&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/america-likely-wont-know-presidential-race-winner-on-election-night-2020-5\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"1e9ae4f6973e5e60f4f470f70336a2d3\">voting rights experts</a>, voting by mail is expected to make up 50% to 70% of the total vote in November.</p><p>With barely any time until the election, longtime supporters of the president in Congress and Trump officials are beginning to blame one another for these campaign missteps. But as one Republican close to the president's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-world-braces-for-blowout-loss-playing-the-blame-game-2020-10\">campaign told Insider</a>, \"The one person to blame for all this is Donald J. Trump.\"</p><p>&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-town-hall-ratings-mistake-by-backing-out-of-debate-2020-10'>Business Hall)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f89de25d260780019341e65?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn96@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-21-257_78ce45d2be88decf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8d0Jp-MafRk:ilhXJZCU0m8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn11@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-24-340_0d83062a8ed12102.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8d0Jp-MafRk:ilhXJZCU0m8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn55@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-23-867_3a1890784a7b2e3c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8d0Jp-MafRk:ilhXJZCU0m8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn36@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-28-022_ce684a9ad218c428.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8d0Jp-MafRk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-20-262_087d755f407a3ac4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799695},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"How to delete your Epic Games account and clear all game data and progress along with it","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-delete-epic-games-account","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89ff2d9e9fe40019009e34?format=jpeg\" alt=\"friends playing games controller video games\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can request an account deletion from your Epic Games account page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">10&#39;000 Hours/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can delete your Epic Games account if you no longer want it &#8212; but deleting your Epic account permanently deletes all games and game progress.&#160;</li>\n<li>To delete the account, go to your account settings on the Epic Games website and choose \"Request Account Delete.\"</li>\n<li>After requesting account deletion, Epic will email you a confirmation code that you need to enter on the website. After doing this, there is no way to undo the deletion.&#160;</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/epic-games\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Epic Games</a> allows you to delete your account, but because this action permanently deletes all purchases you have made along with all game progress, Epic makes you confirm you want to do this with a verification code sent to your email account.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to delete Epic Games account</strong></h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Open the <a href=\"https://www.epicgames.com/id/login\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Epic Games website</a> in a web browser and log into your account.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> If you're not already on the General Settings page with your account settings, click your account name at the top and then click \"Account.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89fb87d260780019341f4d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_delete_Epic_Games_account 1\" height=\"1279\" width=\"1915\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Go to your account&#39;s General Settings page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3.</strong> Scroll to the bottom and, in the Delete Account section, click \"Request Account Delete.\" A pop-up window will appear.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89fc129e9fe40019009e20?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_delete_Epic_Games_account 2\" height=\"1152\" width=\"1499\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The account deletion request button is at the bottom of the page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4.</strong> Epic will send a message to the email account you have associated with this account. Wait for the email to arrive. When it does, copy the verification code into the pop-up on the Epic Games website and click \"Confirm Delete Request.\"</p><p><strong>5.</strong> After a few moments, you'll see a window that confirms your deletion request. Within two weeks, your account will be completely deleted.</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-change-epic-games-password\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" on your Xbox One in 5 ways</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-get-free-steam-games\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to get border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/dhd2NffHnzA\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 22:40:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f89ff239e9fe40019009e33?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"8beb5a5b75ca891318bc798fb9b581a5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn42@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-18-904_50f66c3a516c4bbf.webp","destWidth":2225,"destHeight":1669,"sourceBytes":298242,"destBytes":298242,"author":"insider@insider.com (Dave Johnson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f89ff2d9e9fe40019009e34?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-28-291_7b835c5cb7ef630e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f89fb87d260780019341f4d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn16@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-23-632_5224e1b417abadaa.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f89fc129e9fe40019009e20?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn87@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-18-012_1a9964c4f9c8d106.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=dhd2NffHnzA:hgU9taMsYwU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn80@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-16-134_fb808a4a0c0fd4cf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=dhd2NffHnzA:hgU9taMsYwU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-21-962_949d145628b442d7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=dhd2NffHnzA:hgU9taMsYwU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn15@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-28-639_36e24cdf0fbb98bf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/dhd2NffHnzA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn92@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-15-046_67d4c330def84509.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799689},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"10 toxic behaviors from parents that make children less functional in adulthood","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/toxic-behaviors-parents-make-children-unhealthy-less-functional-adults","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d39c612454a3970421fa74b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"child sad parents fighting\" height=\"2898\" width=\"3864\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Being unreceptive to your child&#39;s emotions can stunt their emotional and mental growth.\n<p class=\"copyright\">djedzura/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/author/amy-morin\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">Amy Morin</a>&#160;is a psychotherapist, licensed clinical social worker, mental strength coach, and international bestselling author.</li>\n<li>She explains it doesn't always take an extreme mistreatment or neglect to create damaged children; sometimes seemingly minor parenting behaviors can have a serious impact.</li>\n<li>Morin says parents who invalidate their children's feelings by telling them not to cry or constantly expect them to behave perfectly can cause long-lasting emotional trauma that their children can carry well into adulthood.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Mary Trump's new book, \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Too-Much-Never-Enough-Dangerous/dp/1982141468\">Too Much and Never Enough: How My Family Created the World's Most Dangerous Man</a>,\" has some people wondering how family dysfunction affects kids. What kind of adults do they become when they've been exposed to toxic parenting behaviors?</p><p>Most people clearly recognize that serious maltreatment, like abuse or neglect, can have a lasting impact on children. But what about toxic parenting strategies that don't rise to an extreme level of abuse? Or what about destructive parenting behaviors that might be less obvious?</p><p>As a therapist, I see some families who appear to function okay to the outside world yet are riddled with dysfunctional family dynamics behind closed doors. And just because these don't constitute abuse, or because they aren't visible to anyone outside the family, doesn't mean they won't prevent kids from becoming healthy adults.</p><p>Here are 10 toxic parenting behaviors that can make children less functional in adulthood:</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">1. Shielding kids from pain</strong></h2><p>While you don't want to expose kids to pain just for the purpose of \"toughening them up,\" you also don't want to shield them from all discomfort.</p><p>Whether a parent insists the coach put their kid on the team or they say their missing cat is \"on vacation,\" kids who lack experience dealing with pain often become adults who crumble when they encounter adversity.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">2. Invalidating their feelings</strong></h2><p>Telling kids to \"stop worrying\" or \"stop crying\" sends a message that their feelings are bad. It teaches them that they need to hide their feelings or fight those emotions. They may grow up to mask their feelings or numb their pain in unhealthy ways.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">3. Praising their achievements only</strong></h2><p>When parents praise kids for getting a perfect score on a math test or the most points in the game, they teach them that their accomplishments matter more than everything else.</p><p>Kids who only hear praise for their achievements (rather than for putting in the hard work it took to get there or a willingness to be brave and try something where they may fail) may grow up to become adults who think they need to succeed at all costs. They might be more willing to lie, cheat, and steal so they can come out a winner.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">4. Living vicariously through their kids</strong></h2><p>Parents have unhealed emotional wounds, too. And it can be tempting to try and live through your kids as a way to heal those wounds.</p><p>But when a parent insists that a child try to reach their own unrealized dreams, their children are likely to grow up without a strong sense of self. They may be resentful toward their parents while also being dependent on them to help make decisions.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">5. Expecting perfection</strong></h2><p>Setting the bar high can be good for kids. It teaches them that they can do more than they think.</p><p>But expecting perfection could cause them to feel like they can't ever measure up. They may grow up to feel as though they aren't good enough because they couldn't achieve what you told them they could.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">6. Using fear to gain compliance</strong></h2><p>Whether a parent shoots kids intimidating looks or threatens to embarrass or hit them, scaring kids into complying can backfire.</p><p>They'll be more likely to make decisions based on fear instead of on what they actually believe is right. This could cause them to become an adult without a healthy moral compass.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">7. Trying to win favor with their kids</strong></h2><p>Whether parents are coparenting after they're divorced or still happily married, some parents work hard to be the \"favorite.\"</p><p>And while winning a child's favor might make a parent feel good momentarily, ultimately the kids lose in the end. They may grow up to become adults who manipulate others as a way to get what they want.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">8. Using guilt trips as a tool</strong></h2><p>Constantly reminding your child how hard you work to pay for their stuff or insisting that they'd listen better if they really loved you might guilt kids into doing what you want.</p><p>But it also means they'll be easy targets for that friend who wants to cheat off their paper or that romantic interest who wants to have sex and use similar guilt trips. Or they may turn into adults who repeat the pattern by using guilt as a weapon against their loved ones as well.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">9. 'Parentifying' their kids</strong></h2><p>Parents who lack adult confidantes or are insecure about their decision-making may depend on their kids to step up.</p><p>Giving kids more information and responsibility than they're capable of handling raises their anxiety and leaves them feeling like you aren't equipped to lead the family. Consequently, they may grow up to become anxious adults who feel as though they need to constantly control everything around them to stay safe.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">10. Being emotionally unavailable</strong></h2><p>It's cliché but it's true — kids need your presence more than presents.</p><p>Parents who are always staring at their phones or too busy and stressed out to support their kids emotionally aren't fostering their child's emotional development. Kids who grow up with emotionally unavailable parents may struggle to develop healthy, meaningful relationships in adulthood.</p><p><em>This article was originally published on Business Insider July 11, 2020.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/toxic-behaviors-parents-make-children-unhealthy-less-functional-adults'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/HRA9FtaRzBE\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 21:39:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5d39c612454a3970421fa74b?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e1385ccc2be4cfeb52afbeb60591d9a1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn17@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-00-074_1257ee300b6349c0.webp","destWidth":3864,"destHeight":2898,"sourceBytes":248482,"destBytes":248482,"author":"insider@insider.com (Amy Morin)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d39c612454a3970421fa74b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn17@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-00-074_1257ee300b6349c0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn91@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-25-607_916946bd3c672d0f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn48@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-936_12e384786416cd88.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=HRA9FtaRzBE:AF1cxQNc3Nw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn55@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-28-720_2bc6e3c95e5f1fa8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/HRA9FtaRzBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn56@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-28-054_687ff49c6773f73b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799719},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"When you need to apply for and submit your mail-in ballot in every US state","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/deadlines-for-absentee-and-mail-ballot-in-every-state-2020-7","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f217d6d4e52b7232d63289c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Vote by mail .JPG\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Lexi Menth of Seattle holds up her vote-by-mail ballot as supporters line up at a rally for U.S. Democratic 2020 presidential candidate Senator Elizabeth Warren at the Seattle Center Armory in Seattle, Washington, U.S. February 22, 2020\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Jason Redmond</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Record numbers of American voters are expected to cast ballots by mail in the 2020 election.</li>\n<li>In addition to the seven states and the District of Columbia that are sending all or most registered voters a ballot, voters can already request their November ballots in every state.&#160;</li>\n<li>The process of requesting and returning a ballot can be unfamiliar and confusing to many voters, especially those in states with historically low levels of mail voting.&#160;</li>\n<li>The US Postal Service is urging voters to request their ballots at least two weeks in advance but ideally as soon as possible, and mail it back at least a week before the election.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Over a dozen states <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/states-where-you-can-vote-by-mail-map-2020-8\">have made it easier to vote by mail</a> in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/politics/vote-by-mail-states/?no_nav=true&p9w22b2p=b2p22p9w00098&tid=a_classic-iphonec-iphone\">with a Washington Post analysis</a> finding that over 190 million voters will have a ballot sent to them or be able to cast a ballot without an excuse beyond the fear of contracting COVID-19.&#160;</p><p>This fall, nine states and the District of Columbia, in addition to many Montana counties, are sending all or most registered voters a ballot, and several more have already sent out mail ballot application forms to all or most voters. In all remaining US states, voters can already request their November ballots.</p><p>Hundreds of thousands of ballots have gone out to voters in nearly 20 states already, with even more states gearing up to start sending ballots out to voters who have requested them this week.&#160;</p><p>But the process of requesting and returning a ballot can be unfamiliar and confusing to many voters, especially those in states with historically low levels of mail voting. And mail votes are often rejected at higher rates than ballots cast in-person.&#160;</p><p>Half of US states are to <a href=\"https://www.ncsl.org/research/elections-and-campaigns/vopp-table-6-states-with-web-based-and-online-absentee-ballot-applications.aspx\">allow US voters to request ballots through an online portal</a>, with <a href=\"https://www.wcpo.com/news/coronavirus/live-beshear-gives-friday-update-on-covid-19-in-kentucky\">Kentucky</a>, <a href=\"https://www.13wmaz.com/article/news/politics/elections/georgia-election-officials-approve-online-absentee-ballot-portal/85-83ab6070-6bcf-48e6-bc97-236d9187e3a2\">Georgia</a>, and <a href=\"https://abc11.com/absentee-ballot-nc-voting-request-north-carolina/6365463/\">North Carolina</a> recently rolling out online absentee ballot request tools.</p><h2>Here are the first days to apply for your ballot by mail and the deadlines to return them in every state:&#160;</h2><p>&#160;</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"Mail-in voting dates for the 2020 presidential election\" aria-label=\"chart\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-KAb1e\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/KAb1e/1/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; min-width: 100% ; border: none;\" height=\"971\"></iframe><script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(){\"use strict\";window.addEventListener(\"message\",(function(a){if(void 0!==a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"])for(var e in a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"]){var t=document.getElementById(\"datawrapper-chart-\"+e)||document.querySelector(\"iframe[src*='\"+e+\"']\");t&&(t.style.height=a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"][e]+\"px\")}}))}();</script></div><p>n the lead-up to the end of voting in the 2020 election, judges have issued conflicting court rulings on whether ballots must be postmarked or received by Election Day.&#160;</p><p>Judges in Indiana, Georgia, Michigan, and Wisconsin ruled that election officials must accept ballots that are postmarked by November 2 or November 3 and arrive after Election Day only for those rulings to be overturned by appeals courts.&#160;</p><p>A GOP lawsuit challenging the Pennsylvania Supreme Court ruling to extend the deadline by which ballots must be received from November 3 to November 6 is currently pending before the US Supreme Court.&#160;</p><p>Even if a court has recently ruled to extend the deadline by which ballots must be received in your state, you should still get your ballot in the mail at least seven days before November 3 or drop it off in-person to a secure dropbox or your local elections office, if it's an option in your county.&#160;</p><p>And even though 31 out of the 40 states not sending all voters a ballot this November allow voters <a href=\"https://www.voteamerica.com/absentee-ballot-deadlines/\">to request ballots within a week of the election</a>, both election officials and the United States Postal Service are encouraging voters to request their ballots <strong>as soon as possible</strong>&#160;to ensure they receive their ballots on time.&#160;</p><p>In primaries so far this year, many election offices that saw exponential increases in voters requesting mail ballots at the last minute <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/missing-ballots-long-lines-foreshadow-november-election-problems-2020-6\">struggled to get ballots out to all voters</a> in time in parts of Maryland, D.C., Pennsylvania, Georgia, and New York.&#160;</p><p>The US Postal Service, which delivers millions of mail ballots every year, has told election officials that it cannot guarantee that voters' ballots will arrive by a certain date, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/voters-should-request-mail-ballots-15-days-before-election-usps-2020-7\">advising voters to plan for their ballot to take at least a 14-day round-trip.</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/08/22/904693468/more-than-550-000-primary-absentee-ballots-rejected-in-2020-far-outpacing-2016\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">A recent NPR analysis</a> found that over 550,000 ballots have been rejected in primaries this year alone, many for arriving past the state's deadline, making it even more essential for voters to not leave their vote up to chance and mail their ballots back at least seven days in advance.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"expanded-coverage\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-source=\"insider-voter-guide\" data-show-header=\"false\">Expanded Coverage Module: insider-voter-guide</bi-shortcode><div +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f217d6040c1f325d2201ca6?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"c4a6d6fa28d08f011e6ed34a6b91a30c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn26@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-13-688_9a8ffdd7f4edeb68.webp","destWidth":1778,"destHeight":1334,"sourceBytes":80320,"destBytes":80320,"author":"sgal@businessinsider.com (Shayanne Gal,Grace Panetta)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f217d6d4e52b7232d63289c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn19@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-24-995_5915286e04406253.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=93QF1kdv124:mLUKNVHwx_E:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn87@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-19-694_73e730ce4d5f1bc9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=93QF1kdv124:mLUKNVHwx_E:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn71@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-28-255_552eab0ad171728e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=93QF1kdv124:mLUKNVHwx_E:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn63@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-22-603_31ad66a7624dd132.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/93QF1kdv124":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn91@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-26-210_139f04dd2013c027.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799696},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"The Supreme Court will hear arguments in the Trump administration's bid to exclude undocumented immigrants from the total population in this year's census","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/supreme-court-to-hear-trump-case-on-undocumented-immigrants-census-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a2d979e9fe40019009eac?format=jpeg\" alt=\"crowd of people in New York City\" height=\"1639\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>People wear protective face masks while shopping at the Union Square Greenmarket on September 19, 2020 in New York City.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Noam Galai/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Supreme Court has agreed to hear arguments on whether President Donald Trump's administration can exclude undocumented immigrants from the total population count in the 2020 census.&#160;</li>\n<li>The Trump administration has said it's unfair that some states get more congressional representation due to having a larger population of undocumented immigrants.&#160;</li>\n<li>The census does not ask a citizenship question and it's unclear how this would be achieved.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The Supreme Court has agreed to consider whether President Donald Trump's administration can exclude undocumented immigrants from the total population count in the 2020 census, several outlets reported.&#160;</p><p>The Trump administration's proposal could shift political representation and federal funding away from communities across the country.&#160;</p><p>Last month, a federal appeals court in Manhattan <a href=\"https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/new-york/nysdce/1:2020cv05770/540927/164/\">blocked</a> the Commerce Department and the Census Bureau from including information on the number of undocumented immigrants.&#160;</p><p>The court also blocked a July memorandum by Trump that would have allowed for undocumented immigrants to be excluded from the total population count, <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/16/supreme-court-will-hear-trump-appeal-to-exclude-undocumented-immigrants-from-census-count.html\">CNBC</a> reported.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/courts_law/supreme-court-census-undocumented-immigrants/2020/10/16/cf8288be-0f51-11eb-8074-0e943a91bf08_story.html\">The Washington Post</a> said that in 2019, the Supreme Court blocked the Trump administration's efforts to add a citizenship question on the census.&#160;</p><p>According to The Post, the current battle revolved are the fact that the number of representatives allotted to each state is based on the number of residents in that state, and that historically that has always meant all people living in that state, not just citizens.&#160;&#160;</p><p>In his July memorandum, Trump argued that some states would get more representation than they \"deserved\" because of undocumented immigrants.&#160;</p><p>Since the census does not ask about citizenship, it's not clear how the administration plans to assess this.&#160;</p><p>\"The Census Bureau is still evaluating the extent to which, as a practical matter, administrative records pertaining to immigration status can be used to identify and exclude illegal aliens from the apportionment population count,\" acting solicitor general Jeffrey B. Wall said in a filing to the Supreme Court, The Post reported.&#160;</p><p>Oral arguments are scheduled for November 30.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/supreme-court-to-hear-trump-case-on-undocumented-immigrants-census-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/eL3rPd0C09o\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 16 Oct 2020 23:47:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8a2e22d260780019341fe4?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e31f67bf348961f99e72c6f53dee16f5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn74@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-13-717_0b3389ca04d38f98.webp","destWidth":2184,"destHeight":1638,"sourceBytes":177926,"destBytes":177926,"author":"salarshani@businessinsider.com (Sarah Al-Arshani)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8a2d979e9fe40019009eac?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn40@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-27-297_1c517cbff213cf6f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn20@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-26-047_07beaa7e5d47cc9c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn63@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-16-189_a7001b5b0206461e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eL3rPd0C09o:nmoqe7Jb6zQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn79@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-20-366_b4cc84734ebd6e17.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/eL3rPd0C09o":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn48@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-28-921_48f4d3917e74fd02.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799692},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"Independent Al Gross takes on Republican Sen. Dan Sullivan in Alaska","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/alaska-us-senate-election-preview-dan-sullivan-vs-al-gross-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5f7e0a7ed0ee001e25f120?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Dr. Al Gross\" height=\"948\" width=\"1896\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Dr. Al Gross is running as an independent who would caucus with the Democrats.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Screenshot via Dr. Al Gross/YouTube</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Independent candidate Al Gross is challenging Republican Sen. Dan Sullivan this year in Alaska.&#160;</li>\n<li>Sullivan, Alaska's former attorney general and a longtime servicemember in the US Marine Corps, was first elected in 2014 and is now seeking a second term.&#160;</li>\n<li>Gross, an orthopedic surgeon and commercial fisherman, is running as an independent who would caucus with Democrats if elected, but says he would still maintain his own unique political brand.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Independent candidate&#160;<strong>Dr. Al Gross&#160;</strong>is challenging Republican&#160;<strong>Sen. Dan Sullivan&#160;</strong>in Alaska this November.&#160;</p><h2>The candidates</h2><p>Sullivan, a former clerk on multiple state and federal courts, has served as Alaska Attorney General and Department of Natural Resources Commissioner, and was first elected to the US Senate in 2014.</p><p>Sullivan has also served in the US Marine Corps since 1993 in multiple roles, and currently holds the rank of Colonel in the US Marine Corps Reserves. In Congress, he serves on the Committees on Armed Services, Commerce, and Transportation.</p><p>The senator has heavily focused <a href=\"https://www.sullivan.senate.gov/about/legislation\">his legislative efforts</a> on sponsoring bills addressing military and veterans' affairs and infrastructure, two key issues in Alaska. He's voted in lockstep with President Donald Trump 97% of the time since 2017, according to FiveThirtyEight.</p><p>Gross, his opponent, is running as an independent but would caucus with Democrats if elected, similarly to independent Senators Bernie Sanders of Vermont and Angus King of Maine.&#160;</p><p>Gross, an Alaska native and son of former Alaska Attorney General Avrum Gross, is an orthopedic surgeon, commercial fisherman, and affordable healthcare advocate. He left his orthopedic surgery practice in 2013 to earn a master's degree in public health and tackling some of the inequalities in Alaska's healthcare system.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://dralgrossak.com/prescriptions/\">He's campaigning</a> on expanding healthcare access and lowering prescription drug costs, addressing climate change and protecting Alaska's natural resources, and investing in Alaska's infrastructure and economy.</p><p>While Gross would caucus with the Democrats, he's created some distance between himself and some of the Democrats' most liberal policies, including creating a Medicare for All system and the Green New Deal resolution on climate, prominently noting that he's supportive of gun rights and even once killed a grizzly bear that snuck up on him.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Greg Giroux  (@greggiroux) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1301906258564395008?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 4, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><h2>The stakes</h2><p>In addition to winning back the White House, regaining control of the US Senate for the first time since 2015 is a top priority for Democrats and would be a major step towards either delivering on a future president Joe Biden's policy goals or thwarting President Donald Trump's second-term agenda.</p><p>Currently, the US Senate is made up of 53 Republicans, 45 Democrats, and two independents that caucus with Democrats, meaning that Democrats need to win back a net total of four seats to have a 51-seat majority (if Biden wins, his vice president would also serve as president of the Senate and would be a tie-breaker vote).&#160;</p><p>While Alaska has traditionally voted Republican at the statewide level, the state has a unique relationship to the federal government and a particularly independent-minded brand of politics where local issues and concerns about economic development, public lands, and the fishing and energy industries often take the forefront in campaigns.&#160;</p><p>The state also has a large population of Native Alaskan residents, a community facing their own unique challenges and needs, including economic opportunity, access to infrastructure, and especially high rates of domestic violence and sexual abuse, a tough topic that <a href=\"https://twitter.com/DanSullivan_AK/status/1290792398763638784\">both candidates are addressing in their campaigns</a>.&#160;</p><p>While Sullivan is currently favored to win reelection this year by most election analysts, the race could be especially competitive if a large enough proportion of voters split their tickets between Trump and Gross.&#160;</p><p>In 2014, a highly favorable year for the GOP as Republicans swept thousands of offices, Sullivan still only defeated his Democratic opponent by a margin of two percentage points, hardly a blowout victory.&#160;</p><h2><strong>What the polling says</strong></h2><p>Alaska is a difficult state to poll, so public surveys of this race have been few and far between.</p><p>The most recent public poll of the race <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/16/upshot/poll-alaska-2020-election.html\">conducted by The New York Times and Siena College</a> found Sullivan leading Gross by eight points, 45% to 37%, with Alaskan Independence candidate Jon Howe taking 10% of the vote.&#160;</p><p>Another previous poll <a href=\"https://twitter.com/IvanMoore1/status/1313647136257372161?s=20\">conducted by Alaska Survey Research</a> found Sullivan leading Gross by four points, 48% to 44%. A survey <a href=\"https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ir0a6eAHT04YSudrwp2AT-SC71wvmCqe/view\">conducted by Public Policy Polling</a> from August 27-28 found Sullivan and Gross tied at 43% support each. In early July, <a href=\"https://www.publicpolicypolling.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/AlaskaResults20200709.pdf\">PPP found Sullivan leading Gross by five points</a>, 39% to 34%.&#160;</p><h2><strong>The money race</strong></h2><p>A last-minute surge of momentum and enthusiasm around Gross <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/news/2020/10/democratic-senate-candidates-unprecedented/\">gave him a huge boost in fundraising</a>. In 2020's third quarter, Gross brought in $9 million compared to just $1.34 million for Sullivan. Gross enters the final stretch of the campaign with $5 million compared to $2.5 million for Sullivan.&#160;</p><p>Gross' campaign has also benefited from nearly $3 million <a href=\"https://www.opensecrets.org/races/outside-spending?cycle=2020&id=AKS1&spec=Np;spec=N\">in independent expenditures from outside groups</a> supporting his candidacy in the race from organizations including The Lincoln Project and 314 Action.</p><p>Politico <a href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/10/08/alaska-senate-race-spending-428257\">recently reported that Alaska</a> is turning into a \"money bomb,\" writing that \"a new influx of outside spending and grassroots dollars into Gross' campaign have given Democrats a major<strong>&#160;</strong>financial edge in the state in the final four weeks.\"</p><h2><strong>What some of the experts say</strong></h2><p>The race between Sullivan and Gross is rated as \"leans Republican\" by the <a href=\"https://cookpolitical.com/ratings/senate-race-ratings\">Cook Political Report</a> and <a href=\"http://centerforpolitics.org/crystalball/2020-senate/\">Sabato's Crystal Ball at the University of Virginia Center for Politics</a>, and is rated \"likely Republican\" <a href=\"https://insideelections.com/ratings/senate\">by Inside Elections.</a></p><p><a href=\"https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2020-election-forecast/senate/alaska/\">FiveThirtyEight's US Senate forecasting model</a> gives Sullivan a 77% chance of winning the race compared to 23% for Gross. The model projects that Sullivan will win 51% of the popular vote compared to 44% for Gross.&#160;</p><bi-shortcode id=\"expanded-coverage\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-source=\"insider-voter-guide\" data-show-header=\"false\">Expanded Coverage Module: insider-voter-guide</bi-shortcode><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
