2020 20:02:21 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f5f7bbd7ed0ee001e25f112?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"697bb38df1249ad1e3ad297a934c4cd6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn78@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-13-795_4de4fa38ac69d72a.webp","destWidth":2789,"destHeight":2091,"sourceBytes":107044,"destBytes":107044,"author":"gpanetta@businessinsider.com (Grace Panetta)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f5f7e0a7ed0ee001e25f120?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn12@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-15-408_f6051524777bfdee.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tIp0-bBB9Zk:CB0SVnb4F7g:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn76@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-20-528_53c0ec88df17fdb6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tIp0-bBB9Zk:CB0SVnb4F7g:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn63@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-17-880_eeb23c40ba9e9ce7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=tIp0-bBB9Zk:CB0SVnb4F7g:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn15@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-24-289_80947f86fedc7149.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/tIp0-bBB9Zk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn88@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-28-384_27221f8eaa275520.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799718},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"How to watch 'Lovecraft Country' on HBO when the season finale airs on October 18","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-lovecraft-country-hbo-max","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f36c08ae89ebf001f044aaa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lovecraft Country HBO\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">HBO</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>\"Lovecraft Country\" premiered on the HBO cable channel and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hbo-max-streaming-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HBO Max streaming service</a> on August 16.</li><li>The series is produced by Jordan Peele (\"Get Out\"), Misha Green (\"Underground\"), and J. J. Abrams (\"Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker\").</li><li>\"Lovecraft Country\" incorporates elements of drama, fantasy, and horror as it tackles racism in 1950s America along with supernatural terrors inspired by the works of H.P. Lovecraft.</li><li>To watch the show, you need an HBO cable subscription or an HBO Max streaming subscription.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hbo-max-streaming-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HBO Max</a> is available for $14.99 a month, and access to the app is also included with most HBO pay-TV memberships.</li></ul><p>HBO's latest original series, \"Lovecraft Country,\" premiered on August 16 and the season finale will air on October 18. The show is based on the 2016 novel written by Matt Ruff, and includes supernatural threats influenced by the works of horror writer H.P. Lovecraft. Misha Green serves as the series' executive producer, along with Jordan Peele and J. J. Abrams.&#160;</p><p>\"Lovecraft Country\" follows Atticus Freeman (Jonathan Majors), a Black man in the 1950s who sets off on a road trip across the country to find his missing father. He's joined by his friend Leticia (Jurnee Smollett) and his Uncle George (Courtney B. Vance). As they continue their search, the group encounters disturbing racist threats and monstrous creatures.&#160;</p><p>Though H.P. Lovecraft, who passed away in 1937, is considered a highly influential horror writer, he is also known for racist elements in his work and bigoted opinions in his personal life. These facts did not escape showrunner Misha Green when working on the series. While the show does take some inspiration from Lovecraft's mythology, Green makes a point to address the author's troubling history on race.</p><p>As reported by <a href=\"https://www.thewrap.com/lovecraft-country-hp-lovecraft-racist-racism-misha-green-series-premiere-hbo/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Wrap</a>, Green followed a similar strategy used by author Matt Ruff in the book that the show is based on. Speaking to reporters during a virtual press event Green said, \"I think it was that thing that Matt was doing that I was really intrigued about, which is this idea of reclaiming it and not saying that we're going to honor all of your contributions to this genre — and there are many — but we're going to take that, we're going to acknowledge who you are as a person, as well, and we're going to move forward.\"&#160;&#160;</p><p>\"Lovecraft Country\" currently holds an \"87% Fresh\" rating on review aggregation website <a href=\"https://www.rottentomatoes.com/tv/lovecraft_country/s01\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Rotten Tomatoes</a>, as well as a score of 79/100 on <a href=\"https://www.metacritic.com/tv/lovecraft-country/season-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Metacritic</a>.&#160;</p><p><em>Updated on 10/16/2020 by Steven Cohen: We've revised this article to remind viewers that the season one finale airs on October 18.</em></p><h2>How to watch 'Lovecraft Country'</h2><p>To watch \"Lovecraft Country\" you'll need access to the HBO cable channel or HBO Max streaming service. The HBO channel is available through a variety of pay-TV cable and satellite packages. Meanwhile, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hbo-max-streaming-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HBO Max</a> is a standalone streaming service with all of HBO's content plus a ton of extra WarnerMedia movies and shows.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hbo-max-streaming-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HBO Max</a> costs $14.99 a month, and you can sign up for the service through the <a href=\"https://www.hbomax.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HBO Max website</a>. HBO Max is also available as a paid add-on to other streaming apps you might already use, including <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2FwelcomeFwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Hulu</a>, <a href=\"https://apple.sjv.io/c/196318/435031/7613?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.apple.com%2Ftv%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Apple TV</a>, and <a href=\"https://tv.youtube.com/welcome/?zipcode=11105\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube TV</a>. In all cases, new HBO Max subscribers can receive a free seven-day trial.</p><p>The first season of \"Lovecraft Country\" consists of 10 episodes. The season finale is set to air on October 18. If you're on the fence about committing to an HBO Max subscription, but you're interested in watching \"Lovecraft Country,\" you can sign up for the HBO Max trial on or after October 18 to binge watch the entire season for free.&#160;</p><p>The HBO Max app is supported on a variety of connected devices. including Apple TV, Android, PlayStation, Xbox, Chromecast, and Samsung smart TVs. With that said, Roku and Fire TV devices do not currently include access to the HBO Max app.</p><p>However, you can still watch \"Lovecraft Country\" on Roku and Fire TV products if you subscribe to the standard HBO app (formerly known as HBO Now). This service also costs $14.99 a month, but it does not include any of the extra content that HBO Max offers. For more details on the differences between HBO's various streaming options, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hbo-go-vs-hbo-now-vs-hbo-max\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">check out our HBO app comparison here</a>.</p><h2>Will there be a second season of 'Lovecraft Country' on HBO?</h2><p>HBO has not confirmed plans for a second season of \"Lovecraft Country\" yet. It's possible that the show will still be renewed for additional episodes, but we'll have to wait to hear more.</p><p>We'll update this section with more details once they're announced.</p><h2>What other shows and movies are on HBO Max?</h2><p>In addition to \"Lovecraft Country,\" HBO Max features access to HBO's entire catalog of movies and original shows, including \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-westworld\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Westworld</a>\", \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-the-third-day-on-hbo-max\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Third Day</a>,\" \"Game of Thrones,\" \"The Sopranos,\" and more. HBO Max also offers a growing selection of additional WarnerMedia shows and movies not found on the HBO cable channel, including titles from DC, CNN, TNT, TBS, truTV, Cartoon Network, Criterion Collection, Studio Ghibli, Adult Swim, Rooster Teeth, Looney Tunes, and Warner Bros.</p><p>The service is also home to original shows and movies produced exclusively for HBO Max. HBO Max originals include the sci-fi series \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-raised-by-wolves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Raised by Wolves</a>,\" the Anna Kendrick-led anthology series \"Love Life,\" the Seth Rogen comedy \"An American Pickle,\" the voguing competition series \"Legendary\", and more.</p><p>For detailed impressions on HBO Max, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hbo-max-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">check out our full HBO Max review here</a>. And for more information about other streaming platforms, be sure to read our guide to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-streaming-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the best streaming service you can subscribe to online</a>.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module-end-of-article\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-shortcode-display-text=\"Related Article Module: Multiple Articles\"><a data-type=\"5ed61f6a19182459b5180a03\" data-title=\"HBO Max's movie library is better than Netflix and Hulu, but with no 4K playback or support for Roku and Fire TV, it's hard to justify 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"How to set up a YouTube TV account and customize your subscription in several ways","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-set-up-youtube-tv","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8a28779e9fe40019009ea9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"youtube tv app\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>YouTube TV is a premium streaming app that&#39;s easy to set up.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong>You can set up a YouTube TV subscription in several ways, but you'll first need to create a YouTube TV account using the website or Android app.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>When you sign up for YouTube TV, you'll get to pick out what premium channels you want, and choose how you want to pay for it.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Once you start watching, you can set up your DVR Library, personalize your \"Live Guide,\" and even change how sports scores are displayed.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>YouTube TV can be streamed&#160;</strong><strong>on a computer, mobile device, smart TV, or using a streaming device like Chromecast.</strong></li>\n</ul>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Whether you want to watch live TV, sports, news, record favorite TV shows for later viewing, or browse through an impressive archive of past programming, a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/youtube-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube TV</a> subscription has you covered.</p><p>YouTube TV isn't meant to be a cheaper alternative to cable — its $64.99 monthly cost is comparable to what you'd pay for legacy cable providers. But the many ways you can engage with the content and the range of programming offered makes YouTube TV an excellent service.</p><h2><strong>How to set up a YouTube TV account</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>On a Mac or PC computer, go to the <a href=\"https://tv.youtube.com/welcome/?utm_campaign=signup&utm_medium=email&utm_source=support&zipcode=10035ipcode=10035\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube TV website</a>. On an Android device, download the <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.youtube.unplugged&hl=en_USn_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube TV app from the app store</a>. You can't sign up through the iPhone or iPad YouTube app, but you can watch YouTube TV on them.</p><p>Once there, sign into your Google or YouTube account.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Tap or click the \"Try It Free\" button to begin the free trial.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89c94cd260780019341dc1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"youtubetv\" height=\"1172\" width=\"2707\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Click the blue button to start the free trial.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Grace Eliza Goodwin/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3.</strong> Share your home location and zip code.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89cac69e9fe40019009ca4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"youtubetv2\" height=\"881\" width=\"1175\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Type in your zip code and click the Next arrow.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Grace Eliza Goodwin/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4.</strong> Review the total price and networks included in your membership, then tap or click \"Next: Add-Ons.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89cb59d260780019341dcd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"youtubetv3\" height=\"1359\" width=\"2719\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Review the price and included networks and hit the blue Next button.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Grace Eliza Goodwin/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>5.</strong> Select any premium networks to add to your membership by checking the circle next to each network, then tap or click \"Next: Checkout.\" You can also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-add-channels-to-youtube-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">add these channels later</a> if you decide you want more.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89cbe79e9fe40019009ca8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"youtubetv4\" height=\"1341\" width=\"2739\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select premium add-ons and click the Next button.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Grace Eliza Goodwin/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>6.</strong> Enter and confirm the credit card you'd like to use for your membership, or connect your PayPal account. You'll be charged after your free trial ends, but you can cancel at any time before that date.&#160;</p><p><strong>7.</strong> Tap or click \"Free Trial\" or \"Buy\" (if you've already used up your trial) to finish the process.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89d543d260780019341e12?format=jpeg\" alt=\"youtubetv5\" height=\"1395\" width=\"1321\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Enter your credit card information and click &#34;Start Trial.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Grace Eliza Goodwin/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>How to watch YouTube TV on your smart TV or gaming system</strong></h2><p>You can watch YouTube TV on most smart TVs and gaming systems.&#160;</p><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"5e176980f442314e6d3fbb73\" data-title=\"'How many devices can you use on YouTube TV?': You can connect up to 3 devices to your subscription at once — here's how that compares to other streaming services\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-many-devices-youtube-tv\" data-thumbnail=\"https://i.insider.com/5dee6536fd9db25ec846c205\" data-shortcode-display-text=\"Related Article Module: 'How many devices can you use on YouTube TV?': You can connect up to 3 devices to your subscription at once — here's how that compares to other streaming services\">&#160;</bi-shortcode><p>Options include <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-youtube-tv-on-apple-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Apple TV</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/can-you-get-youtube-tv-on-ps4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PS4</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-add-youtube-tv-to-roku\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roku</a>, Xbox One, Android TV,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/can-i-watch-youtube-tv-on-fire-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Fire TV</a>, and select Samsung, LG and Vizio models.&#160;You can also stream on your TV with AirPlay, Google Chromecast, or a Chromecast-enabled TV.</p><p>Just note that even if you have a 4K TV and streaming device, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/does-youtube-tv-have-4k\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube TV can't be streamed in 4K</a>.</p><h2>How to customize your YouTube TV subscription</h2><p>Once you've made your account and started watching, there are various ways to enhance your subscription, and personalize it for your tastes.</p><h3><strong>Navigate and customize the three main tabs on the YouTube TV homepage</strong></h3><p>These tabs are \"Library, Home,\" and \"Live.\" The \"Home\" tab is where YouTube gives you recommendations of what to watch.&#160;</p><p>You can tap the \"+\" button next to programs you'd like to add to your library, and YouTube TV will automatically record all programs as they air. You can then access all of them in the Library tab.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d4b21ec100a247ce242410e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019 08 07 at 1.45.17 PM\" height=\"987\" width=\"1590\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The YouTube TV home screen gives you recommendations to watch.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steven John/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The \"Live\" TV tab shows you everything that's playing right now. Check out your local live broadcast channels and watch sports, local news, or catch primetime shows airing on those broadcast networks. You can scroll down further to see over 70 popular cable networks and local sports networks.</p><p>You can customize the Live tab to match your viewing preferences. For example, you can reorder networks in the guide or hide certain networks so that only your favorite networks appear.&#160;</p><p>To do this, select \"Sort\" on the Live tab, tap \"Edit\" and customize your Live tab.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d4b21bf100a2443ec7f3af2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019 08 07 at 1.47.22 PM\" height=\"993\" width=\"1594\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can see what&#39;s currently playing on YouTube TV in the Live tab.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steven John/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>&#160;</p><p>Finally, the \"Library\" tab is for your recordings. Add any show, sports team, event, movie, and so on to your library just by tapping the \"+\" button. YouTube TV will record all current and upcoming airings.&#160;</p><p>You can add as many programs to your library as you like — YouTube TV includes unlimited cloud-based DVR space, and recording doesn't take up space on your device.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d4b20aa100a2424d5392b5b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019 08 07 at 1.45.39 PM\" height=\"918\" width=\"1597\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can access all recent and upcoming recordings in Library.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steven John/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h3><strong>Search for shows, sports, and movies by genre&#160;</strong></h3><p>Head to the search area by clicking the magnifying glass at the top right.&#160;</p><p>You can search via general terms like Sports, News, or Movies, or you can search for specific shows, movies, or televised events.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d4b20f1100a243a354b76f5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019 08 07 at 1.44.59 PM\" height=\"937\" width=\"1565\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can search for shows and movies in the Search bar.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steven John/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h3><strong>Hide sports scores (and avoid spoilers)</strong></h3><p>You can turn on the \"Hide all scores for this team/league\" feature in YouTube TV to hide scores for specific sports teams and leagues.&#160;</p><p>This will prevent spoiler information, like final scores or live previews, from appearing before you've started watching.&#160;</p><p>To enable this feature, open YouTube TV, select the overflow menu three-dot on a team or league page, and toggle on \"Hide all scores for this team/league.\"</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a people</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/youtube-keyboard-shortcuts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">17 essential YouTube keyboard Island'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-ufc-fight-night","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f8775642a400c0019debbe0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Korean Zombie and Brian Ortega, Fight Island\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photos by Jeff Bottari/Zuffa LLC via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></h3><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong><a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">UFC Fight Night: Ortega vs. Jung</a> will be streamed live on ESPN+ from <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ufc-fight-island-card\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\"UFC Fight Island\"</a> on October 17.</strong></li><li><strong>Brian Ortega and Chan Sung Jung will meet in a main event that could decide the course of UFC's featherweight division.</strong></li><li>The rivalry between Ortega and Jung (also known as the Korean Zombie) has been brewing for more than a year, spurred on by incidents outside the Octagon.</li><li><strong>Prelims are set to start at 4 p.m. ET and the main card is scheduled to begin at 7 p.m. ET.</strong></li><li><strong>Every UFC Fight Night event</strong><strong> is included with an </strong><a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>ESPN+</strong></a><strong> subscription, which costs $5.99 per month or $49.99 per year. </strong></li></ul><div id=\"ProductCard_5da75fc94af9097b0e52c613\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5da75fc94af9097b0e52c613&type=small\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><p>A long-brewing rivalry between UFC featherweights Brian Ortega and Chan Sung Jung will reach a climax during the main event of this weekend's' <a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">UFC Fight Night</a>, streaming live from the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ufc-fight-island-card\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UFC Fight Island campus</a> in Abu Dhabi on October 17.</p><p>The fight was originally scheduled in Jung's home country of South Korea in December 2019, but Ortega suffered a knee injury that delayed the match. In the interim, Ortega was accused of attacking Jung's friend and translator Jay Park while they were spectating at UFC 248 in March. Jung said Ortega hit Park while he was in the bathroom; Ortega was kicked out of the event and later apologized for the incident with a challenge for Jung.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Brian Ortega  (@BrianTcity) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1237566540381163520?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">March 11, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Ortega vs. Jung will have major ramifications for UFC's featherweight division. Jung called featherweight champion Alexander Volkanovski \"shameful' after Volkanovski narrowly defended his title with a split-decision victory over former champ Max Holloway in July. In response, Volkanovski said that Jung could earn a title fight with a decisive victory over Ortega. Ortega's last match was a loss against Holloway, so his path to the title may be a bit longer, even with a win over Jung.</p><p><a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">UFC Fight Night: Ortega vs. Jung</a> is the fourth match in a series of five UFC events scheduled in Abu Dhabi through October 24. UFC 254 will close out the Fight Island promotions with light heavyweight champion Khabib Nurmagomedov returning to face interim champion Justin Gaethje in a unification match.&#160;</p><p>UFC has committed to holding its events without fans due to the coronavirus pandemic and the organization has at least 18 different safety precautions for staff, including advanced medical screenings, regular testing, temperature checks, and social distancing guidelines.</p><p><em>Updated on 10/16/2020 by Kevin Webb: This article has been revised to include details for the UFC Fight Night event scheduled for October 17.</em></p><h2>Here's the match schedule for UFC Fight Night: Ortega vs. Jung</h2><h3><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c41f1b70f2d9b5cda160dc7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"espn&#43;\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">ESPN</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></h3><h3>Prelims — 4 p.m. ET, 1 p.m. PT on <a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">ESPN+</a></h3><ul><li>Said Nurmagomedov vs. Mark Striegl</li><li>Gadzhimurad Antigulov vs. Maxim Grishin</li><li>Jamie Mullarkey vs. Fares Ziam</li><li>Jun Yong Park vs. John Phillips</li><li>Gillian Robertson vs. Poliana Botelho</li><li>Mateusz Gamrot vs. Guram Kutateladze</li></ul><h3>Main Card&#160; — 7 p.m. ET, 4 p.m. PT on <a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">ESPN+</a></h3><ul><li>Thomas Almeida vs. Jonathan Martinez</li><li>Claudio Silva vs. James Krause</li><li>Jim Crute vs. Modestas Bukauskas</li><li>Katlyn Chookagian vs. Jessica Andrade</li><li>Brian Ortega vs. Chan Sung Jung</li></ul><h2>How to watch UFC Fight Night matches on <a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">ESPN+</a></h2><p><a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">UFC Fight Night: Ortega vs. Jung</a> will be streamed live on ESPN+.</p><p><a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">ESPN+</a> subscribers can watch every <a href=\"https://go.web.plus.espn.com/c/196318/531511/9070?u=https%3A%2F%2Fplus.espn.com%2Fufc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">UFC Fight Night event</a> live and also gain access to a huge catalog of classic UFC matches and recent highlights. ESPN+ costs $5.99 per month or $49.99 for a full year, and it's available as an app on most mobile and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-streaming-box-stick\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">streaming devices</a>. You can also bundle <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-bundle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ESPN+ with Disney Plus and Hulu</a> for $12.99 a month. Here's a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-espn-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">full breakdown of additional features and details for ESPN+</a>.</p><p>Leading up to major PPV events, ESPN+ typically offers a special deal that bundles one UFC PPV fight and an annual ESPN+ subscription for a total of $84.98. This bundle deal gives you an overall discount of $30 if you plan on following the UFC closely for the rest of the year.</p><p>Select UFC Fight Night matches are also broadcast on the ESPN cable network. ESPN&#160;is available as a channel through several live TV streaming services, including <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tv&u1=1589574448100ayyw2hd9u|xid:fr1589574449571chb574449571chb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-ml-dynamic=\"true\" data-ml-dynamic-type=\"sl\" data-orig-url=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tv&u1=1589574448100ayyw2hd9u100ayyw2hd9u\" data-ml-id=\"16\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1589574449571chb\">Hulu + Live TV</a>,&#160;<a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/sid/1589574448100ar5pjzhgs%7Cxid:fr1589574449571jdh/https://www.sling.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-orig-url=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/sid/1589574448100ar5pjzhgs/https://www.sling.com/\" data-ml-id=\"17\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1589574449571jdh\">Sling TV</a>,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/sid/1589574448100aeqqu31v5%7Cxid:fr1589574449571igi/https://www.att.com/tv/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-orig-url=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/sid/1589574448100aeqqu31v5/https://www.att.com/tv/\" data-ml-id=\"18\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1589574449571igi\">AT&#38;T TV</a>, and&#160;<a href=\"https://tv.youtube.com/welcome/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\">Youtube TV</a>. Webb)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f8775642a400c0019debbe0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn12@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-23-601_031b6a35c8e9be23.webp","https://i.insider.com/5c41f1b70f2d9b5cda160dc7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn16@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-22-108_013c27b34326ec54.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=xxQWJOD1o9k:bQyO3E5mMz0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn61@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-15-088_b25427f0e594b5c5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=xxQWJOD1o9k:bQyO3E5mMz0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn28@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-19-349_ab522d80e4369ef2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=xxQWJOD1o9k:bQyO3E5mMz0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn55@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-15-955_14cda980903ebe8c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/xxQWJOD1o9k":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn63@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-064_5e7f7b6990004428.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799719},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"What it takes to be a White House photographer","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-it-takes-to-be-a-white-house-photographer-2020-10","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/TZywj6Du-jZbcmOYf.html\"\nwidth=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"What it takes to be a White House photographer\"\nstyle=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/petesouza/\">Pete Souza</a> served as the official White House photographer for President Barack <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-obamacare-aca-replacement-supreme-court-arguments-2020-10\">Obama</a> and President Ronald Reagan.&#160;</li>\n<li>For both administrations, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/former-white-house-photographer-pete-souza-obamas-notes-trumps-memo-2019-11\">Souza</a> put his personal life on hold to follow the presidents for eight years, photographing history.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/\">Business Insider</a> sits down with Souza to break down his most iconic shots and learn what it takes to get the gig.&#160;</li>\n<li>Check out Souza's new documentary, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7L4ktHbelhc\">\"The Way I See It,\"</a>&#160;<strong>premiering</strong> on MSNBC on October 16 at 10 p.m. EST.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><em>Following is a transcription of the video.</em></p><p><strong>Pete Souza:</strong> My attitude is, if you're documenting for history, you wanna be there all the time, 'cause you don't wanna miss anything. And you can't always predict when history is gonna take place.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> That's Pete Souza, former White House photographer to Presidents Ronald Reagan and Barack Obama.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> I think it's important for history. I think it's important to have these moments behind the scenes, where you get a real good sense of not only what he was like as a president, but what he was like as a human being.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> Pete was behind the camera for iconic Obama-era moments like this and this.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> The photographs can show emotion and context and mood in a way that words can't. The still image is something that is just seared in your brain.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> After documenting the lives of two sitting presidents, Pete Souza knows better than most what it takes to be a White House photographer.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> I started out working for newspapers in Kansas and Chicago. In 1983, the White House photo editor at the time reached out to me about a position at the White House. So that's what led to the job at the Reagan White House.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> After photographing the Reagan administration, Pete worked for National Geographic and as the national photographer for the Chicago Tribune. In 2004, when Barack Obama was elected senator of Illinois, Pete took an assignment to follow and photograph the up-and-coming senator.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> That led to some, you know, real good access with Sen. Obama. I ended up going to five different countries with him. So I got to know him pretty well professionally. And so when he was elected to the presidency, he asked me to become his chief photographer. I don't think my political views play into it at all. I mean, look, I worked for a Republican and Democrat. This job is about documenting the presidency for history. All this other stuff just doesn't really matter.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> Pete photographed Reagan and Obama during all eight years of both administrations.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> Well, I think that was the most difficult part of the job for me. It was just, it was physically and mentally exhausting, to essentially put your personal life on hold for eight years.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> Just as he did with Reagan, Pete often followed Obama seven days a week.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> Well, I mean, I was with him, like, every day.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> It was because Pete didn't leave Obama's side that he was able to capture this historic moment.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> This is during the bin Laden raid. They're monitoring it as it happens. So we were all jammed into this room for 40 minutes. You've got the most powerful people of the executive branch, and they're essentially helpless. And I think you can feel the tension in that room just by looking at their faces. As the meeting's breaking up at night, they know they have bin Laden, and it was just, like, such a subtle reaction to a momentous event in many ways. I don't know that I knew how widely circulated this photograph would become, but I certainly knew this would be a historic day. I think without the trust, you can't get the access. It's as simple as that. I think he did trust me. I think the people around him trusted me. And I think if not for that, there's no way I would have had the access to some of the things that I did.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> Pete's intimate access allowed him to capture some of the most poignant moments of the administration.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> The most difficult times to photograph him were when he was consoling families that had been affected by some tragedy. And oftentimes the emotions were so raw.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> Pete says neither he nor the president ever got used to facing such tragedies.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> When I would get to the photographs from Newtown, I would break down, 'cause it's still emotional thinking about that day and thinking about the circumstances of that day.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> But not all the moments he captured were tough ones.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> I think the picture resonates for a couple reasons. One, you got, you know, a 5- or 6-year-old African American kid touching the head of the president of the United States that looks like him. But at the same time, I think it tells you something about Barack Obama, that at the behest of this young kid, you'd go ahead and bend over and let the kid touch your head like that. I don't think that would happen today. You know, one thing that I don't know that the photographs showed necessarily was his sense of humor and his competitiveness. Although I think I actually do a pretty good job in showing those.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> Here's a photo where Pete did catch his competitive spirit.</p><p><strong>Pete:</strong> Reggie Love, who was 20 years younger than him, was four inches taller than him, captain of the Duke University basketball team. And here's Barack Obama, who didn't even start for his high-school basketball team. When they finished the game, President Obama starts walking towards me, sweat's dripping down his face, and he just comes up to me. He goes, \"Did you get that block?\" [laughs] 'Cause he was so proud of the fact that he had blocked Reggie. You know, look, I'm not the best photographer in the world. I'll be the first to admit that. But I do think that I was the right photographer to be the chief photographer for Barack Obama. It's one of those jobs that it's not like you apply for the job. They come looking for you. It's a hard job to aspire to do. Just so much of it involves luck. I do tell photographers around the country, photograph your mayor, your governor, because you never know if they, maybe they'll end up becoming a national politician someday. 50, 100 years from now, people will be able to go through all of my photographs and get a real sense of what it was like to be in this moment. What he was like as a person, you know, as seen through my eyes and my photographs. And I think that's the most lasting impact.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/what-it-takes-to-be-a-white-house-photographer-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a Dyer)","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=co4XnjYU1To:a6cRhvL7U30:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn83@2020_1/2020/10/17/02-30-27-668_f26522d0e0de34fe.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=co4XnjYU1To:a6cRhvL7U30:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn16@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-21-432_c79b217ca864bde6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=co4XnjYU1To:a6cRhvL7U30:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn96@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-24-182_515ec5950cb4811f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/co4XnjYU1To":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn19@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-23-060_e4bfc29148b12fcd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799716},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"Republican lawmaker is symptom-free after attending a concert in Montana that was linked to several coronavirus cases","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/montana-lawmaker-attended-concert-linked-to-a-coronavirus-outbreak-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f89efd8d260780019341edf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"greg gianforte\" height=\"1720\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Greg Gianforte, R-Mont., walks through the Capitol on Tuesday Oct. 29, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bill Clark/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Rep. Greg Gianforte of Montana was at a concert on October 3, which has since been linked to several people testing positive for coronavirus.</li>\n<li>Gianforte led the pledge of allegiance at the outdoor event and left soon thereafter. Since he is not displaying any symptoms, a COVID-19 test hasn't been recommended, his spokesperson Travis Hall said.</li>\n<li>The concert was greenlit by local health officials, but organizers have been criticized for violating COVID-19 restrictions that limit public gatherings to 250 people.</li>\n<li>It's unclear exactly how many people attended the event as well as how many concertgoers contracted coronavirus.</li>\n<li>Gianforte is running for governor and his opponent, Democratic Lt. Gov. Mike Cooney, has called on the Republican lawmaker to pause in-person campaign activities until he tests negative for coronavirus.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A Montana concert attended by Republican U.S. Rep. Greg Gianforte, who is running for governor, has been linked to several COVID-19 cases, <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-greg-gianforte-montana-helena-b12fff1395d6f9c3222d344beeab3438\">local health officials said Thursday</a>.</p><p>The outdoor concert, held October 3 in Helena, was approved by the local health department, the Independent Record <a href=\"https://helenair.com/news/local/organizers-promote-unity-at-let-freedom-ring-concert-in-helena-valley/article_fe70320b-776a-568a-80a8-a2bd48916fc3.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">reported</a>.</p><p>Event organizers later faced criticism for failing to abide by local health orders to prevent the spread of the coronavirus, which limit public events to less than 250 attendees.</p><p>Gianforte led the Pledge of Allegiance at the event and left a short time later, according to his spokesperson, Travis Hall.</p><p>Gianforte has not shown symptoms of the virus and his health care provider did not recommend a COVID-19 test, Hall said.</p><p>The local health department issued a statement Thursday asking concert attendees to closely monitor themselves for symptoms of COVID-19 after several positive cases were linked to some people who went to the event.</p><p>\"Gatherings of this nature, and at this time, can quickly turn into super-spreader events,\" Drenda Niemann, health officer for the Lewis and Clark public health department, said in a statement on Thursday.</p><p>She added: \"Right now, the focus isn't on whether the event was the right or wrong thing to do, we simply need to quickly identify cases and their close contacts if we are to have a chance at containing disease and preventing an outbreak.\"</p><p>The campaign of Gianforte's rival, Democratic Lt. Gov. Mike Cooney, demanded that Gianforte suspend all in-person activities until he tests negative for the virus.</p><p>Gianforte's campaign manager, Jake Eaton, in response accused Cooney of politicizing a public health issue.</p><p>Gianforte has faced criticism from some health professionals, who accuse him of failing to follow public health advice.</p><p>During a recent campaign stop in Helena, Gianforte arrived at the event wearing a face mask, but took it off and hugged unmasked supporters after his speech.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Inc.)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f89efd8d260780019341edf?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn35@2020_5/2020/10/17/02-30-27-422_3fbc70d4b17ce85a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/17/02-30-26-160_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=5NuUzBKH3zk:gZkhictLTmQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn96@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-29-141_977eedab533286fc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=5NuUzBKH3zk:gZkhictLTmQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn48@2020_4/2020/10/17/02-30-20-221_2bed0a847c7474e3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-21-755_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=5NuUzBKH3zk:gZkhictLTmQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn8@2020_2/2020/10/17/02-30-17-358_78bd4be326c5c2b5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/5NuUzBKH3zk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn55@2020_3/2020/10/17/02-30-25-316_f9b082347c8c8d56.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602901799702},{"createdTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","updatedTime":"2020-10-17 10:29:59","title":"Michigan bans open carry of guns at polling places on Election Day","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/michigan-bans-open-carry-guns-at-polling-places-election-day-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f57f7b77ed0ee001e25e14f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jocelyn Benson \" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In this March 5, 2020, file photo, Michigan Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson speaks at a news conference in Lansing, Mich\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/David Eggert, File</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.michigan.gov/documents/sos/BOE_Open_Carry_Polling_Place_Instructions_10_16_2020_705274_7.pdf\">Michigan banned</a> the open carry of guns within \"100 feet of a polling place, clerk's offices, or absent voter counting board\" on Election Day.</li>\n<li>\"The presence of firearms at the polling place, clerk's office(s), or absent voter counting board may cause disruption, fear, or intimidation for voters, election workers, and others present,\" a press release from Michigan Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson said.</li>\n<li>This directive comes a little after federal <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fbi-foiled-right-wing-militia-plot-kidnap-michigan-gretchen-whitmer-2020-10\">prosecutors charged multiple men who plotted to kidnap Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer</a> in a time when fears of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/virginia-trump-supporters-intimidated-voters-disrupt-early-voting-2020-9\">voter intimidation</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-is-normalizing-possibility-of-violence-surrounding-2020-election-2020-9\">violence</a> loom over the country.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><a href=\"https://www.michigan.gov/documents/sos/BOE_Open_Carry_Polling_Place_Instructions_10_16_2020_705274_7.pdf\"> Michigan Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson banned</a> the open carry of firearms within \"100 feet of a polling place, clerk's offices, or absent voter counting board\" on election day.&#160;</p><p>\"The presence of firearms at the polling place, clerk's office(s), or absent voter counting board may cause disruption, fear, or intimidation for voters, election workers, and others present,\" Benson said in a press release on Friday. Benson, who is considered the state's chief election officer, added that she is working with state and local law enforcement in order to carry out the mandate.&#160;</p><p>This ban comes a little over a week after federal <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fbi-foiled-right-wing-militia-plot-kidnap-michigan-gretchen-whitmer-2020-10\">prosecutors charged multiple men who plotted to kidnap Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer,</a> and while voters' concerns about intimidation and violence on election day ramp up.&#160; &#160;</p><p>Whitmer has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/whitmer-says-trump-admin-did-nothing-she-brought-up-threats-2020-10\">criticized the Trump administration's response</a> to security threats and has stated that President Donald Trump is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-said-michigan-governor-has-hatred-in-her-heart-2020-10\">&#160;\"complicit\"</a> to domestic terrorists and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/whitmer-criticizes-trump-and-warns-leaders-can-legitimize-actions-2020-10\">\"legitimizes their actions.\"</a> Far-right agitators have expressed fury over Whitmer's statewide lockdown during the coronavirus pandemic, with hundreds of people — many of them armed — <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/michigan-lockdown-protesters-brought-rifles-into-the-state-capitol-2020-4\">descending on the state capitol</a> to protest earlier this year. In the spring, Trump made a series of tweets calling for US states in lockdown to \"liberate\" themselves, which was heralded by <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-liberate-tweets-are-hailed-by-far-right-extremists-nbc-2020-4\">far-right social media as a sign of support.&#160;</a></p><p>The group of accused men has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-you-need-know-extremist-groups-tied-to-whitmer-conspiracy-2020-10\">a history of ties to extremist militia movements,</a> and one of them was identified by <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/whitmer-conspiracy-allegations-tied-boogaloo-movement-n1242670\">NBC News</a> as a member of a public <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-you-need-know-extremist-groups-tied-to-whitmer-conspiracy-2020-10#one-of-the-men-charged-in-the-alleged-plot-against-gov-whitmer-was-part-of-an-anti-lockdown-facebook-group-4\">Facebook group called \"Open Michigan.\" </a><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/gov-whitmer-kidnap-plot-preceded-trumps-call-to-liberate-michigan-2020-10\">FBI Special Agent Richard Trask testified on Friday</a>, however, that the genesis of the kidnapping plot had occurred prior to Trump's tweets.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Meanwhile, safety at polling sites continues to be a prevalent concern. A report from the <a href=\"https://paxsims.files.wordpress.com/2020/08/preventing-a-disrupted-presidential-election-and-transition-8-3-20.pdf\">bipartisan Transition Integrity Project</a> stated: \"The potential for violent conflict is high, particularly since Trump encourages his supporters to take up arms.\"</p><p>Election inspectors will post signage that indicates the notice of a ban on open carrying firearms in the polling places, clerk's offices, and absent voter counting boards, according to the press release.&#160;</p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/whitmer-doubles-down-extremists-find-comfort-in-republican-rhetoric-2020-10\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Gov. Whitmer says she has 'always felt safe' but doubles down on charges that extremists are 'finding comfort' in Republican rhetoric</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-you-need-know-extremist-groups-tied-to-whitmer-conspiracy-2020-10\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Suspects accused of targeting Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer have a history of ties to self-styled militias. Here's what you need to know about these extremist groups.</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-is-normalizing-possibility-of-violence-surrounding-2020-election-2020-9\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Trump is normalizing the possibility of violence in the 2020 election</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/virginia-trump-supporters-intimidated-voters-disrupt-early-voting-2020-9\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Trump supporters staged a rally at a Virginia polling center during early voting, intimidating voters, election officials say</a></li></ul><p>&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2020 21:26:57 new cat\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shoshi Parks/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Make your
